story:
Hola a todo el mundo,

Esta campaña pretende hacer posible la difícil tarea de ayudar a los más necesitados, los discapacitados, en tiempos de crisis. Más concrétamente, a niños discapacitados de Uganda.

Estos niños están en "Busega Home for Children", un hogar de niños huérfanos, a cargo de "Missionaries of the poor", una asociación que les da cobijo y alimento. Estos niños necesitan rehabilitación y la asociación no se puede permitir ese gasto extra, por ello dependen del voluntariado, que además de tener la formación requerida, el tiempo y las ganas de hacerlo, también deben tener el dinero para costearse ese viaje. 

Cuando no se tiene tiempo, se tiene el dinero y cuando se tiene el tiempo, no se tiene el dinero, el cuál es mi caso. Por esta razón, solicito ayuda para poder pagar el importe del viaje hasta allí, y de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de estos niños y mi deseo e ilusión por ayudarlos. 

Esta es mi oportunidad para hacer del mundo un lugar mejor, ¿me ayudas?

Blessings,

My name is Reverend Patrick McCollum and I am here today to ask for your help.

I have been offered a very special opportunity to help promote world peace and planetary sustainability and to represent our community and Paganism at the highest level on the world stage.

I have been invited to join the Dalai Lama’s International Peace Council and the Association for Global New Thought as a Core Group Leader to help facilitate a world event in Rome, Italy, Awakened World 2012 this October. The event will be attended by many of the foremost political, religious and human rights leaders in the world, and my fellow Core Group team will include such luminaries as: Yolande IIiano, Chairperson, Religions for Peace Europe, HH Pujya Swami Chidananda Saraswati, President of Parmarth Niketan Ashram in India, one of India’s largest spiritual institutions, Sister Joan Chittister, OSB, CO-Chair of the Global Peace Initiative for Women, His Eminence Walter Cardinal Kasper, President, Pontifical Council for Ecumenism, Ela Gandhi, former South African Parliamentarian and granddaughter of Mahatma Gandhi, Dean Lawrence Carter, Dean of Martin Luther King Jr. International Chapel, Rev. Marcus Braybrooke, President of the World Congress of Faiths, and Lynne Twist of the Pachamama Alliance and others.

Each of the esteemed Core Group Leaders are being supported by their communities to attend and facilitate the gathering, and so I am asking you my spiritual community, to join together and support me also, so our voices will be heard and Paganism and Earth Based Spiritual Traditions will be represented at the table when the discussions regarding the future of our planet take place.

The costs to get me to Rome including all transportation and lodging, which have all been negotiated by the conveners on behalf of the Core Group Leaders, are approximately $3,000.00, not including incidentals which I estimate will probably be another $500. So I will need to raise $3,500.00 in order to be able to go.

But first for those who don’t know me or my work, let me tell you a little about my background and why you should support me in this endeavor.

I have been active in our community for over 40 years both teaching for and also speaking out on our behalf. I have always done so with the belief that our traditions contain key elements that can alter the course of our civilization’s downward spiral by adding new perspectives regarding human rights, social justice, saving the environment, and facilitating world peace. I have served over the last 20 years as an activist for Pagan rights and ending religious discrimination in general, and have successfully taken on and resolved over a thousand discrimination cases for our community, from discrimination in the workplace, to reforming the religion programs in our nation’s prisons. I successfully took on AT&T and got them to alter their official policy which disallowed passwords relating to our beliefs. Words like Goddess, magic, Witch, Wiccan, Pagan, etc., which they had listed as pornography. I have also testified on numerous Pagan’s behalf’s in child custody cases, taken on Children’s services who have removed children from their homes because their parents practiced Paganism, and was an active member of the Pentacle Quest team, who headed and won the fight for Pagan vets to have the pentacle on their military headstones.

In a different arena, I have been active in educating our government regarding Paganism and minority faiths, and have played a significant part in advancing pluralism. I have also been very involved internationally in projects promoting interfaith dialog, and in promoting human rights and equality for all people. I have actively and successfully forged alliances between Buddhists, Hindus, Native Americans and Pagans, so we could work together collectively to resolve common problems.

in 1998 I became the first official government Wiccan chaplain in the United States and in 1999, I received a commendation from the California State Senate for my work developing Pagan religion programs in prisons. In 2008 I was selected to advise the United States Commission on Civil Rights as a Pagan, and my comments were central in reports presented to both Congress and the President of the United States.

In 2009, I was selected to address leaders and representatives from over 70 countries In Astana, Kazakhstan for the development of a Global Constitution, and in 2010 I received the Mahatma Gandhi Award as a Pagan at the Capitol in Washington D.C.. Also in 2010, I was honored to be invited as a World Inner Peace Ambassador at a gathering of 150,000 Buddhists in Bangkok, Thailand. I was also given the title, Sheda Garpo, King of Peace, by Rinpoche Lama Gangchen of the World Peace Foundation.

I have been involved in peace talks between Israelis and Palestinians in Amman Jordan, trained teachers in the Himalayas, and presented at two consecutive Parliaments of the World’s Religions … all openly as a Pagan, sharing Pagan values, and striving to put a positive face on Paganism in general.

Also as a Pagan, I am on the Board of Directors of Children of the Earth, a United Nations NGO, where I serve as Development Director for 20,000 youth involved in international Peace programs. And I serve as both an Executive Council Member and as the Chair of their Minority Faith Issues Committee for the American Correctional Chaplains Association. I am also the Chaplaincy Liaison for the American Academy of Religion and serve on the National Advisory Council for Americans United for the Separation of Church and State.

In every case, I have always done my best to shed a positive light on my community and to promote understanding and tolerance worldwide.

Now I have been offered the opportunity to represent us at an even higher level, and to do even more to promote ideals that many of us hold dear. World Peace, tolerance for diversity, the empowerment of women, the accommodation of pluralism, the sacredness of the earth and all of its inhabitants, and the conservation of our planetary environment and its resources.

I hope you will join me in making this happen by donating to my cause. Every little bit helps. And if you feel so inclined in the future, you can also make friends aware of my foundation and support its activities when you can. All donations are tax deductible.

Many Blessings,

Reverend Patrick McCollum

Addiitonal Links:

  • The Patrick McCollum Foundation
  • Awakened World 2012
  • Patrick addressing the International Conference on "Spiritual Paradigm for surmounting Global Management Crisis" in India.
  • Media coverage of Patrick McCollum.

story:
Our Story

We are a small publishing house based in Melbourne, Australia, specialising in erotic fiction. We run a monthly event called Spin the Bottle where writers of erotic fiction can read their work in front of an audience. We record our favourite stories and upload them to our website.

We would like to publish our first collection of short stories in e book form, for those who like to read their erotic fiction on the go.


The Impact

All funding will go towards paying writers for their short stories and designing and publishing the e book.


What We Need & What You Get

We need $1000 to get started; we have a collection of short stories we'd like to publish and we want to be able to pay the writers for their hard work.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends! Abuse those fragile facebook relationships and post the link to our campaign on everyone's wall.

story:
The Summary

There aren't enough stories supporting and helping mothers, fathers and siblings in the tough times of pregnancy and raising a child. We want your help to share more stories of people’s lives in childbirth and raising children. These stories will help support anyone involved with children and hopefully put a smile on your face.

Our short story book is going to be compiled with over 20 (changed from 61) stories about having children and being pregnant. The stories are going to be funny, interesting, charming, courageous and sure to warm your heart. Since we use a crowd of readers to choose books, we want you to help choose the stories for our book, voting starts November 11th, on Facebook. You still have time to submit a story!

We hope to use this campaign to bring the 21 (Changed from 61 due to contest response) authors into the spotlight and get their work highlighted in the world. The book will help lift the spirits of pregnant women, siblings and new parents alike.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have estimated that publishing the book is going to cost about $2,500.   

  • Copy editing, formatting, and the book cover is going to cost about $1,200.
  • The contest we are running to choose the stories will cost about $850.
  • Then the Indiegogo fees and funding the prizes takes up the other bit.

Even if we don’t hit our maximum funding amount we are going to go ahead with the campaign and publish the book, but some of our plans are going to be downgraded in price. Our cover art will be lowered, our contest costs will be reduced, and copy-editing will be expedited. This means we will still have a really great book, but not as good as it could have been.

When you help us you get some of the awesomeness on the right hand side. Check it out. Mostly you get the book, but there are some other cool benefits there as well.

 

The Impact

By supporting us, you help support families and families to be by providing stories that they can use when times are tough or when they need to smile. You also help Bookkus Publishing get its first book into the world. Bookkus is dedicated to letting readers choose the best books to publish. By helping us you help choose what the world gets to see and you support authors everywhere.

You will be helping 21 authors get their stories into the hands into the world, help them get published in the future, and help them learn to write better. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, feel free to come read the stories on Facebook or you can share this information with your friends who are parents or your pregnant friend. I’m sure they would love to give this book a read.

Bookkus is always looking for reviewers for our novels and would love for you to come and help us. Come learn how to review books.

 

About

I’m William from Bookkus Publishing. Bookkus is a really small new publisher that uses a crowd of readers to choose, publish, and create books. We like to do things differently, include people into the action, and have fun doing it. This will be our first publication ever! So come help out.

Thanks to Nina Matthews Photography, Lutty Moreira, dizznbonn, Julien Haler, Dan Harrelson, limaoscarjuliet, makelessnoise, Pink Sherbet Photography,  and Swami Stream from Flickr commons for the photos.

Thanks Javier Anibarro Z. from soundcloud commons for the song 'Lagrimas De Cristal'.

Although this campaign has ended, we still have many copies available. Please reach out to me at: Heatherreb@gmail.com if you would like to pick up a book to support Compassionate Journeys (details below). Thanks!!!

 

 

Short Summary

Kofi is a wonderful child with a giant imagination and even bigger heart. With the help of his family, Kofi wrote a book about his dragons from Ghana and the one who saves the day!
 
Every cedi (Ghanaian currency) will go directly to two projects in Ghana, Kofis' country of origin.

What We Need & What You Get

Proceeds from your purchase of "Kofi's Magical Dragon" book will be split between these deserving projects:

Kwahu Orphanage in Ghana, West Africa is in need of 12 mattresses and running water. This will cost approximately $2500 US dollars.

Compassionate Journeys is building a home for rescued child slaves in the Lake Volta region of Ghana, West Africa. Approximately $8000 US dollars are needed to finish construction.

The Impact

  • Your contribution will immediately improve the lives of vulnerable children. Simple as that.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!
 
Learn more:
Compassionate Journeys
http://www.compassionatejourneys.com/
 
Kwahu Orphanage
https://www.facebook.com/kwahuorphanage.kwahu?f...

story:
Who am I & why am I here?

My name is Kit.  I'm a writer and an enthusiast of history and culture.  Unfortunately, I've never been out of the US, and have yet to really experience cultures other than my own.  To fix this little issue, I've decided to start with England.  I plan to go to England for three months to work for lodging and write about my experiences there.  I want to absorb culture and history, live in the moment, and share it with all of you.  With luck, I'll be able to self-publish my travel journal (whether in hard copy or ebook format) and give you all something to read about!

Writing is my passion and it is so difficult to write effectively and accurately while existing so close to my birth environment.  Help me branch out so that I can show you what a writer can do when given the chance to blossom!

I'll be tracking the IndieGoGo experience, as well as my travel preparations over at http://workawayuk.wordpress.com so stop by!

Other Writing Experience

I've run a blog over at http://gogglesandlace.com for about two years now, and it's housed a lot of my personal goals, loves, rants, and fiction, as well as writing advice and encouragements for aspiring fiction writers.

I've competed in NaNoWriMo (National Novel Writing Month) four times, won twice, and wrangled an entire region of writers for two years as a Municipal Liaison.

With a close friend, I started Inkwell Imaginings, a group dedicated to helping writers refine their work and trash their fears about the process and their prose.  It's going on three years now, and has two chapters, one in MA and one in FL.  With those folks, my writing wouldn't have grown nearly as much as it has.

What I Need & What You Get

What do I need?

  • Airfare
  • Passport
  • Travel expenses
  • This'n'that (bedding, food, sundry items, etc)
  • Notebooks.  Lots of them.

What do you get?

Check out the list of perks!  If you have any questions, comment, and I'll clarify!

Other Ways You Can Help

I adore you all, whether you can contribute monetarily or not.  The fact that you're viewing this page right now means so much to me.  If you can relate to my wanderlust, have an interest in my travel-musings (or my fiction, which always gets better when I'm away from home *hinthint*), or just want to help, show me some love and spread the word about my campaign!  Share with your friends!

story:
Unforgivable II

My name is James Fuller and I am a rising Indie Fiction/Fantasy Author with two books already out. Book one The False Prince to my main series Fall Of A King has been out since januray 4th 2012 and is doing very well on Kindle and is already in several books stores. Book two Brothers of Blood is months away from being completed. My second series Unforgivable is a shorter two book series. Book One has been out since April 2012 and is picking up much interest and a large fan base and holds a solid 4.8 star rating on amazon. http://www.amazon.com/Unforgivable-Part-ebook/dp/B007W3HE84/ref=sr_1_11?s=digital-text&ie=UTF8&qid=1334954992&sr=1-11

Unforgivable II is freshly written and awaiting editing and formating for publishing. So I am looking for whatever support I can find to help cover the cost of doing so, so the final part to this epic, dark tale of revenge can be made ready for everyone who has eagerly been awaiting it. Since I am an Indie Author I am not backed by a big publishing house that covers the pricey costs of editing and formating. Yet from what I have seen my stories have been enjoyed by many and I believe need to be put out there for readers to indugled in.

Any and all support in this project is appreciated and all money raised will go directly into editing and formating this project so it will one day soon see the light of day.

Book One has been out since April 2012 and is picking up much interest and a large fan base and holds a solid 4.8 star rating on amazon. http://www.amazon.com/Unforgivable-Part-ebook/dp/B007W3HE84/ref=sr_1_11?s=digital-text&ie=UTF8&qid=1334954992&sr=1-11
Unforgivable II is freshly written and awaiting editing and formating for publishing. So I am looking for whatever support I can find to help cover the cost of doing so, so the final part to this epic, dark tale of revenge can be made ready for everyone who has eagerly been awaiting it. Since I am an Indie Author I am not backed by a big publishing house that covers the pricey costs of editing and formating. Yet from what I have seen my stories have been enjoyed by many and I believe need to be put out there for readers to indugled in.
Any and all support in this project is appreciated and all money raised will go directly into editing and formating this project so it will one day soon see the light of day.

story:
Four-Rules.com: What is it?

Four-rules.com is a new site for edited long-form economic journalism and analysis. It is meant to be a middle ground between the mainstream media and the more authoritative but less pitched and edited content on blogs and personal websites.

All content will be edited before publication, and will conform to our four eponymous rules:

  1. No promotion,
  2. All pieces must be at least 1500 words,
  3. Pieces must be Comprehensible,
  4. Pieces must be Engaging.

Content will come from the community of economics scholars and writers. Some will be commissioned by our editorial staff, some will be submitted by writers and thinkers in the field.

Where Your Money Will go:

What we need is enough content to get the site started. The bulk of your money will go to funding contests which we will use to gather pieces for publication. Three quarters of the total collected will be used to pay winners of contests, and depending on how much we raise, on commissioning specific pieces.

The remaining quarter will be spent paying for hosting the site, for advertising both the site and the contests, and on incidental expenses.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, there are other ways you can help. You can spread the word about the site. Share this page or our URL. If you are a writer yourself, send us an email at submissions@four-rules.com.

story:
UPDATE!

As you can see from the beautiful green line, we hit our basic goal!!! This is awesomely exciting, and we are very very grateful to everyone who got us here, but if you scroll down to the "What We Need" section of this little essay, you'll see that we still have a long way to go. The $500 more or less covers our cover artists, and not much else, and I (Jax) really want to be able to pay my authors as richly as they deserve! Our next milestone is $2200, which would cover ALL the expenses for Allusions of Innocence and Amok. 
If you're following Jax on Facebook, you'll see that she has been offering flash fiction to people who push us over specific milestones. She's also going to be running a little giveaway for the rest of this week for people who help us by sharing the link to the campaign, so keep an eye out for that.  
We've been contemplating what sort of reward we could offer to people who help us hit our $2200 goal, so watch this space for stretch rewards!

Short Summary

Solarwyrm Press is at it again. With two books under our belts now, we are about to double our catalogue by releasing two anthologies at the same time. The official release date for these books is April 30th, so if you order our new books through Indiegogo, you will get them before then as we'll send them out as soon as Indiegogo gives us the money. They're already prepared at the printer, just waiting for your order!

Jax Goss, the editor behind our inaugural book, Fae Fatales: A Fantasy Noir Anthology, has put together a collection of stories featuring precocious children, in an anthology called Allusions of Innocence.

Dominica Malcolm, the author of our second book (and first novel), Adrift, has put together Amok: An Anthology of Asia-Pacific Speculative Fiction, which summarises itself.

We're seeking funding to pay the authors in the first book (the authors in the second will be paid regardless of the result of this campaign), as well as production and promotion costs for both of them.

About the Books

Both books will be available in paperback and ebook formats. Ebook choices in the campaign may differ from what will be available afterwards. For example, though Amok will be available in the campaign in PDF, epub, and Kindle (mobi) formats, the editor plans to make it available exclusively on Amazon afterwards, to try out their KDP Select program.

Allusions of Innocence

At approximately 75,000 words and 299 pages, this is a collection of 18 stories featuring precocious children characters. Many of them are very dark and twisted, but there are some funny, and sweet, and touching stories too. 
The stories, in book order, are:
Mr. Harris' Door by A.P. Sessler
White Hairs by Recle E. Vibal
The Changing of the Seasons by Frida Stavenow
Step Right Up by Gerri Leen
Summer's End by Meriah L. Crawford
The Lying, the Snitch, and the Wardrobe by Steve Ward
Reflections by James D. Fischer
Dodo by Sean Moreland
Dolls by Drake Vaughn
The Street Game by Scathe meic Beorh
The Cycle of Rebirth by Mona Opubor
Court Out by Shaun Avery
Pulp Adventure by Laird Long
Run Like a Girl by M. Kate Allen
Cupid's Strike by Martin David Edwards
Hex McGowan and the Cat's Meow by Patrick Scalisi
Monster by Terence Toh
The Christmas Dragon by Tom Trumpinski

You can read reviews of the book by Steve Ward and Osie Turner.

Amok: An Anthology of Asia-Pacific Speculative Fiction
At approximately 85,000 words and 252 pages, this is a collection of 24 stories set in the Asia-Pacific region, past, present, and future. They include traditional mythology, re-imagined fantasy and mythology, dystopian futures, speculative new technologies, and more.
The stories, in book order, are:
The Donor by Brett Adams (Australia)
Moon Rabbit by Jo Wu (China/The Moon)
Operation Toba 2049 by Kris Williamson (Malaysia)
Target: Heart by Recle Etino Vibal (Philippines)
Dreams by Tabitha Sin (New Hong Kong)
Bumbye! Said the Candelarios by Ailia Hopkins (Hawaii)
Kitsune by KZ Morano (Japan)
The Volunteer by TR Napper (Vietnam/Thailand)
Bright Student by Terence Toh (Malaysia)
No Name Islands by Kawika Guillermo (Indonesia)
The Dead of the Night by Barry Rosenberg (Australia)
Yamada's Armada by Eeleen Lee (Singapore)
Love and Statues by Jax Goss (New Zealand)
Gone Fishing by Jo Thomas (Pacific Ocean)
Shadows of an Ancient Battle by Daniel A. Kelin, II (Hawaii)
In Memoriam by Fadzlishah Johanabas (Malaysia)
Lola's Lessons by Shenoa Carroll-Bradd (Philippines)
When the Rice was Gone by Dominica Malcolm (South Korea)
The Healer by Aashika Nair (India)
Caves of Noble Truth and Dangerous Knowledge by Celeste A. Peters (China)
The Seventh Month by Agnes Ong (Malaysia)
And Then It Rained by Rebecca Freeman (Australia)
Where the Fireflies Go by NJ Magas (Japan)
The King of Flotsamland by Tom Barlow (North Pacific Gyre)

What We Need

We're setting our goal at the minimum $500 required by Indiegogo because we want to be able to get the books to you regardless of whether we get enough for all our expenses. What we actually need will depend on how many paperbacks are ordered, because they come with expenses that the ebooks don't.

Our rough estimate, not including printing and postage costs for your orders, is $2200.

The breakdown of our expenses:

Indiegogo fees are:
PayPal - 4% if we reach our minimum $500 goal, or 9% if we don't.
Credit card: An additional 3% on top of the PayPal amount.
(So if you want your money to go further with us, pay by PayPal - they even let you pay by credit card without having an account).

Each author in Allusions of Innocence is to be paid US$50. $50 x 18 authors = $900.

The estimated cost for paying Amok authors, and their contributor copies, is $650.

Book cover design for Amok is NZ$220. The cover is illustrated by Jun Hun Yap, who was one of our artists featured in Fae Fatales.

Book cover design for Allusions of Innocence is US$150. The cover is designed by Luke Spooner.

The set-up fee with our printer (Lightning Source) is £42 per book, plus £21 for the cost of the proof version + postage.

Obviously, for print copies ordered, we have to cover the printing and postage costs out of what you give us, which means we'll only be making about $5 per book because we want to keep the cost to you down. It just means that we'll need to sell more than 200 paperbacks (or equivalent) to cover the expenses just for Allusions of Innocence if we're going to pay those authors.

For promotional costs, we plan to give away at least one copy of each anthology on Goodreads. That will be printing and postage costs, to be determined by the printer.

If we do not reach our full goal, the funds we do receive will first go toward the authors in, and then further expenses for Allusions of Innocence, as Dominica Malcolm is able to cover the expenses for Amok herself. Joining this campaign is mostly for cross-promotional reasons.

If we manage to reach funding higher than we need, we will try to find some bonus perks for contributors. Any money left over will go toward the following:
* Re-sending out packages of Fae Fatales, for those orders that were lost in the mail.
* Marketing and promotional costs.
* Funding toward a future anthology.
* Set-up costs to move Fae Fatales to Lightning Source with the rest of our books.

What You Get

Books
We're offering, at various levels, both print and ebook copies of all of the books in our catalogue, but of course most prominently the ones we are currently funding for.

Aside from the anthologies listed above, the books we have available are:

Fae Fatales: A Fantasy Noir Anthology edited by Jax Goss
Details from our previous crowdfunding campaign
On Goodreads

Adrift by Dominica Malcolm
Details from our previous crowdfunding campaign
On Goodreads - read the reviews!

T-shirts


(Dominica Malcolm modelling the Amok t-shirt; the design will differ slightly at the bottom as the colour will change for the text credit)
We have a person in Malaysia printing t-shirts for the books. If you're local to Kuala Lumpur and can arrange to pick up a t-shirt from Dominica, you can get one for US$16. Registered postage to other countries can be a little expensive, so it's US$25 for other locations. The Amok t-shirt includes a royalty payment to the artist.
You can have a choice of colour for the t-shirt, and the sizes available are from S to XXL.


Stories

If you'd like to contribute more, the editors are also offering a limited number of stories written specifically for you, which we will then collate into an ebook, which you will also receive. Your story will be dedicated to you in the ebook. Jax and Dominica will choose between the prompts you provide, which can be up to two of the following:
  • Character name
  • Prompt word/phrase
  • Title
  • Genre (out of sci-fi, fantasy, mythology, dystopia, romance, memoir/creative non-fiction)
You can also order more than one perk, by going through the process. If you would like to order multiple copies of the same perk, then please scroll down to the end of this page to find out how to do that, because we can give you a discount, we just don't have the space to offer them all as options in the perks.

The Impact

A note from Jax on Allusions of Innocence:

I have long been fascinated by childhood, and the various perceptions of it that exist. Children see the world very differently to adults, which can be frightening, or enlightening, or funny. When I picked the theme for this anthology I had no idea just how wide this particular aspect could be.
I’ve always loved stories about smart children, kids who were a bit more perceptive than their peers, children who were often outcasts or sidelined despite (or maybe because) of their precocity. And so I created a brief that the stories should involve these smart child protagonists, but be stories aimed at an adult audience.
I probably should have predicted how dark many of these stories would go, but they ended up often being darker than I anticipated. Many of these stories are not for the faint of heart. Some are downright disturbing. Some are hopeful and funny. All of them are, in my not-so-humble opinion, exceptional. I hope you enjoy reading them as much as I enjoyed compiling them. Welcome to the rabbit-hole.

A note from Dominica on Amok:
My main reason for compiling a collection specific to the Asia-Pacific region is because I wanted to be part of the change to bring people greater diversity in terms of characters. I've been blogging for a while about diversity in the media, or lack thereof, and how I see its impact in the world. I think it's important for people of all backgrounds to be able to see people like themselves in stories, as well as those who are more often represented in the mainstream to be exposed to stories about people different from themselves. Amok represents a range of diverse characters, particularly in terms of race, but also in terms of age, ability, and sexuality.

My reason for focusing on the Asia-Pacific in particular is because it's one I'm most familiar with. I was born in Australia and lived there for the first 25 years of my life, and have since lived in Malaysia for the last 5. All of the countries included in the anthology, bar China, are actually places I've travelled and have various levels of knowledge. I'm also excited to be publishing Malaysians and Filipinos, amongst others with various ties to the region.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the money to support us right now, here are some of the other things you can do to help:

  • Tell your friends! Spread the word via social media using the buttons above.
  • Ask either or both of us for an interview on your blog (if you have one), or offer to promote us some other way there.
  • Are you a reviewer? Would you have time to read and review the book before the end of our campaign? We have PDF ARCs available in limited quantities. Contact us at solarwyrm@gmail.com if you would like to request one.
  • Add the books to your "to-read" shelf on Goodreads:
    Allusions of Innocence
    Amok: An Anthology of Asia-Pacific Speculative Fiction
If you're a bookseller and/or would like to order bulk quantities, you can do so by contacting us at solarwyrm@gmail.com. Just let us know how many copies of which books you would like and we can draw up an order for you. We can offer between 20-40% discount on the retail price of the books, depending on how many you want and what your purpose is (retailers can get a greater discount). Postage not included.
Current/expected retail prices:
Adrift: US$17.95 (Carton contains 18 books)
Allusions of Innocence: US$14.99 (Carton contains 24 books)
Amok: An Anthology of Asia-Pacific Speculative Fiction: US$12.99 (Carton contains 28 books)
Fae Fatales: A Fantasy Noir Anthology (black & white): $25.00
Fae Fatales: A Fantasy Noir Anthology (colour): $40

story:
A Book For Women - Coming Spring 2019

The Crowdfunding Campaign has officially ended, BUT you can still help me get this book out into the world!

Thank you for visiting our crowdfunding campaign page!  Although the crowdfunding portion of the campaign it is technically over, you can still donate, support it, and stay connected!  To learn more, visit us on my documentary website where I've dedicated a page to the book: https://agelessthemovie.com/book.  

 

DESCRIPTION OF THE BOOK AND CAMPAIGN

We know it’s tough being a woman.  We are often told to keep our sensitivity in check -- to smile and play nice.  We are raised to follow a path of safety in a world that claims to be logical, controlled and linear.  Often to get ahead, we also think we have to act like men.

I’ve spent the last 20 years in both the corporate and spiritual worlds -- learning about communication, meditation, energy and the general social sciences, which includes relationships.  My intention with this book is to use the knowledge I’ve gained to hold women up.

In the book, I talk about honoring our sensitivity, how to meditate in a very easy way, the transformative nature and misconceptions of forgiveness, and much more!  There’s even a chapter on dating!

In each chapter, I take spiritual concepts and apply them to real-life experiences that are both grounded in reality and reflect the often absurd, humorousness of life.  Then I back up the stories with scientific data, and close each chapter with an activity, that guides you, step by step, on how to apply the concepts to your own life.

By the end, you will:

  1. Be reminded of your worthiness;

  2. Have more tools to cope with life’s crazy, to be more authentic, happy and empowered; and

  3. Be better able to offer the world the best you have.

As women, I believe it’s our responsibility to hold each other up.  The world right now needs the power of women working together, in our authenticity and at our full potential.

We hope you will help us get this book for women out into the world!

 

CAMPAIGN GOAL AND PERKS

We need your help.  To finish the book, we need to cover editing, graphics and publishing costs!  We offer more details about this in the following description and on the side buttons.

My goal during this campaign is to raise $10,520 to ensure this book is published and made available worldwide.

I also have a stretch goal of $4,500 if I meet the first goal, which would be for legal fees, a PR specialist and enhanced functionality for the website.

$10,520 Campaign Overview

  • Editor(s) - $5,000
  • Fundraiser - $2,370

story_txt:
A Book For Women - Coming Spring 2019The Crowdfunding Campaign has officially ended, BUT you can still help me get this book out into the world!Thank you for visiting our crowdfunding campaign page!  Although the crowdfunding portion of the campaign it is technically over, you can still donate, support it, and stay connected!  To learn more, visit us on my documentary website where I've dedicated a page to the book: https://agelessthemovie.com/book.   DESCRIPTION OF THE BOOK AND CAMPAIGNWe know it’s tough being a woman.  We are often told to keep our sensitivity in check -- to smile and play nice.  We are raised to follow a path of safety in a world that claims to be logical, controlled and linear.  Often to get ahead, we also think we have to act like men.I’ve spent the last 20 years in both the corporate and spiritual worlds -- learning about communication, meditation, energy and the general social sciences, which includes relationships.  My intention with this book is to use the knowledge I’ve gained to hold women up.In the book, I talk about honoring our sensitivity, how to meditate in a very easy way, the transformative nature and misconceptions of forgiveness, and much more!  There’s even a chapter on dating!In each chapter, I take spiritual concepts and apply them to real-life experiences that are both grounded in reality and reflect the often absurd, humorousness of life.  Then I back up the stories with scientific data, and close each chapter with an activity, that guides you, step by step, on how to apply the concepts to your own life.By the end, you will:
Be reminded of your worthiness;
Have more tools to cope with life’s crazy, to be more authentic, happy and empowered; and
Be better able to offer the world the best you have.
As women, I believe it’s our responsibility to hold each other up.  The world right now needs the power of women working together, in our authenticity and at our full potential.We hope you will help us get this book for women out into the world! CAMPAIGN GOAL AND PERKSWe need your help.  To finish the book, we need to cover editing, graphics and publishing costs!  We offer more details about this in the following description and on the side buttons.My goal during this campaign is to raise $10,520 to ensure this book is published and made available worldwide.I also have a stretch goal of $4,500 if I meet the first goal, which would be for legal fees, a PR specialist and enhanced functionality for the website.$10,520 Campaign Overview

story:
The Book

Like many young girls, I wanted to be a princess when I was growing up. While watching TV shows and movies, I noticed that the princesses often had no mothers present. I wrote this book to answer the question of where the mothers are and show the struggles that princesses can face.

The Title

This is a coming-of-age story about a princess being forced to marry a complete stranger whom her father has chosen. She is on a mental journey, which she decides to turn into a physical odyssey as well. She is searching for who she is, who she wants to become, and for her absent mother.

Where the funds are going

I plan to give the funds directly to my publisher, Iguana Books, who is going to use the funds to put together a quality book. The book has already been edited, so these funds will include the book cover and layout, proofreading, distribution, and marketing. As a professional in the industry, I already know the ins and outs of creating a book, so I am trying to share this story with all of the young girls who dream about princesses.

story:
Short Summary

  • If you've read my first book, you can expect to read something more eye opening than the first and it will make you re-think some things in your life. This book is something i've put a lot of effort and pure emotions on each page. Fear, Faith & Fruition is filled with stories of hardships but most importantly stories of how to pick yourself up when you need a spark.

 

  • After you get through the complete book, there is a introduction to a new book coming at a later date entitled "Separate - The Blue Parker Story"- Which is a story about a boy who seemed to have things going in his favour until life stole everything from him in a single day. Its a story that will get you emotionally sucked in towards each character. so you might as well sit back in the chair, grab a coffee, and enjoy the ride with blue and find out how it unfolds!

story:
¿Qué?

El juego de Pandora trata de cuando la violencia se convierte en un acto catártico, posiblemente sin sentido, para aquellos que la utilizan contra sus semejantes; de cuando el encuentro con la sombra nos muestra la peor cara de nosotros mismos.

Dos almas heridas se encuentran y forman un vínculo; no las une el amor, ni una aventura… ni siquiera la amistad. Las une la violencia. Después de acordar unas reglas, empiezan un Juego que se vuelve cada vez más cruel y peligroso, aunque también más adictivo. Un día a la semana dejan de ser ellos, dejan todo atrás y se convierten en depredadores.

Carlos es uno de los creadores del Juego. Para él, ponerse una máscara y salir de madrugada en busca de una presa resulta más fácil que afrontar ciertas situaciones del día a día. Sin embargo, jugar al Juego no hará que desaparezcan sus padres, ni sus compañeros de clase… Si acaso, hará que aumente la oscuridad que hay en su interior.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Miguel Oliva.

Nacido en Pulpí (Almería), en 1993, estudió el bachillerato de ciencias, pero actualmente cursa Traducción e Interpretación en Granada: le encantan las ironías. Apasionado de la escritura y la lectura, empezó a plasmar sus ideas cuando apenas contaba con catorce años, porque un mundo de fantasía ocupó sus pensamientos de tal modo que no pudo sino sacarlo sobre el papel.

También amante de la interpretación y la música, y, por qué no, como algunos dirían, un friki.

Miguel Oliva te sorprenderá y estremecerá a partes iguales.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El juego de Pandora que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Miguel Oliva vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
***click here to see media about productions of my plays, publications and other media:  http://www.crosalindbell.net/blog/  


LOUISIANA, 1928-1964

Nanaan, my grandmother, has as her soul mission the education and uplift of the Negro race. “Education,” she says, “is our only way out.”  She travels rutted roads to beg farmers and sharecroppers to get their children out of the fields and into school.

1948

My mother and my father marry in his hometown where she has come, two years before, to teach. 

1950

My parents’ first miscarriage.

1952

My parents’ second miscarriage.

1953

My parents’ third loss.

1954

In April, Nanaan, drives her Chevy deep into the country to pay last respects to her 44-year old farmer cousin.  He was the father of ten children; his youngest four months old.

A week after the funeral Nanaan returns to the country to speak with her cousin’s wife, now his widow.  With the death of  her cousin, and five children left to raise,  wouldn’t it be best to give the baby to a couple who could provide not just love, but opportunity? A couple armed with college degrees, a home and pockets full of dreams? "Education," she says "is our only way out."

A month after the visit, the couple, Nanaan’s daughter and  her husband, welcome the baby into their home, their lives. 

Their child grows. They are proud and happy parents!

1969

"I have something to tell you." She is fifteen when her mother calls to her, but she already knows. She has joined the Secret Keepers and does not let on that she knows. Her mother brings out a picture of her first mother something she has never seen. She leaves the picture with her mother and goes back to her life.

1995

Within a year she loses both her mother and her father. She feels free now to don the hat of the first family. It does not fit right. She takes it off. 

2004

She tries it on again. This time it is way too tight. It hurts. She takes it off vowing to never again try.

2015

She begins her search. She must excavate this story that has found her, mine it and set it free. 

***click here to see media about productions of my plays, publications and other media: http://www.crosalindbell.net/blog/

ABOUT MY PERKS

These perks are the result of a collective life, the skills and insights and creativity learned through generations of my family, a history that began in Louisiana and continues thousands of miles away, today. For instance, these Collard Green Trees that can grow up to 10ft and withstand harsh winters are a perk I am delighted to share with you.

http://www.crosalindbell.net/blog/

   In uncovering, dislodging and revealing the “hush-hush” of secrets, layer upon layer of mystery is revealed. One door opens and then another and another. The secrecy of heritage includes my forebears who owned land, substantial acreage, beginning in the 1880s, when black people in Louisiana were doing their damndest  to beat back the crushing reality of the United States’ abandonment of hard won freedoms of the Emancipation Proclamation . The United States Constitution had failed them. The nine-year window of Reconstruction was shuttered, nail driven, shot through. Black people were alone, once again, without recourse against those who had fought just as hard to keep them on the other side of freedom.

  My name is C. Rosalind Bell. I am a writer living in Tacoma, Washington. I was born in Louisiana, and grew up thirty miles north of the Gulf of Mexico. 

  For me to tell this story, the parts I know for sure and the parts founded in discovery, for me to do it justice I have to commit first an act of betrayal against the two people I knew and loved most in the whole, wide world. Betrayal of the two people who loved me more than anybody had a right to be loved; my parents.

  I have had it with me from a long time now, this story. This story requiring betrayal. Carried it with me in my dreams and night sweats.

  The many doors of the story all begin with an index finger pressed against pursed  and worried lips; “a secret.” And that secret, the cause of the “hush-hush” was me.

The “A” word. Adoption. A word never spoken in our house. It did not exist; the concept, the notion. I belonged to the two people in the living room, in the kitchen,  in the Buick, in the hospital over nights when my tonsils had to go, taking me to piano lessons or to Brouses’ Toy Land, and that was the end of the story.  Inquiry into my origins was not on the table. I began and ended with them.  They wanted the best for me and above all else they wanted to protect me from any and all harm.

  1954 The couple enter their solidly middle class home with their 5 month-old baby girl. She is wrapped up in their dreams.  They fumble with the newness of this wide-eyed creature; giddy in the love they are pouring all over her and themselves. Her father scrapes the red dust of West Feliciana Parish country roads from his Pontiac. They have made it home.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

I ask for your financial help and support in my endeavor to discover, research and tell the stories of my ancestors and in so doing, tell the story of Louisiana before and after the Civil War, and unravel the secret of me.  How, in one of the most inhospitable to black life places in the whole wide world could both my progenitors have purchased land? My first mother’s grandparents bought over 700 acres starting in 1881. And how were they able to secure it in the face of documented racist treachery?  

But, more than anything my parents did not want the  secret of me revealed. It was their mission that no one speak on it. Or say its name.  I was theirs. I belonged to them. No questions asked. No questions allowed. And they were right, I am theirs. No questions asked. No questions allowed. But this? This is something I am compelled to do. I must open this box of secrets. Why was it so important that this secret me not be revealed? I must dig for bones.

click here to see media about productions of my plays, publications and other media: http://www.crosalindbell.net/blog/  ***

STANDING IN THE MIDDLE OF A SECRET is as much a research project as it is a writing project. I must scour microfilm, parish and state records, attics, books and people to get what I am looking for. I am seeking $29,000 to help cover this expedition:

•  Researching/writing for a year

•  Automobile rental/gas/insurance

•  Books, printing, copying old documents

•  Recording and interviewing

•  Travel to and from interviews

•  Travel to and from Louisiana

•  A place to lay my head

•  Research Assistant

•  Indiegogo and credit card fees

*** click here to see media about productions of my plays, publications and other media:   http://www.crosalindbell.net/blog/  ***

I thank you for considering me and my project.

"There is no greater agony," Maya Angelous once said, "than bearing an untold story."
http://www.seattlestar.net/2015/11/c-rosalind-b...

story:
We are a group of six people in Canada and the US who collectively publish Perspectives on Anarchist Theory,  the journal of the Institute for Anarchist Studies.  

Perspectives, published since 1997, with the current version published since 2010, has layout, art, and design by Josh MacPhee of Justseeds Artists' Cooperative.  Did you know that Perspectives is created almost exclusively with volunteer labor by our collective? That authors, editors, designers and sometimes even the printer donate all or most of their work to Perspectives?  About our current issue, CrimethInc. said, "this journal is setting out to do something different. It manages to present a wide array of nuanced and critical articles while remaining accessible, which is quite refreshing ... Perspectives on Anarchist Theory is well worth a read for anyone interested in insightful reflections on contemporary struggles from an antiauthoritarian viewpoint."

Our new issue focuses on anarcha-feminisms, and includes a wide variety of voices on the subject.  It will offer histories of anarcha-feminism, while also looking at ways anarchist feminism can move forward, what the relationship between anarchism and feminism is and the ways the anarchist movement falls short from a feminist perspective. We are turning to you to help fund the design, layout, printing and mailing costs for this issue.  With your help, we’ll be able to publish 1,000 copies and mail it to bookstores, distributors and people like you around the world.

Perspectives is printed in Portland, Oregon at Eberhardt Press, who often donate labor and do things like add color to pages without cost.  For this issue Josh MacPhee is not able to do layout because his partner just gave birth, so we are hiring a comrade to help.  Although he is reducing the costs for his work, it will still be $300 for layout and design, and then $2,750 or so to print, and then another $750 for mailing costs. So we are looking to raise $4,000 which includes an extra $200 for any unexpected expenses, which will go towards future issues if not used.

In exchange for your help in getting the anarcha-feminisms issue out, we can offer all sorts of perks, including copies of the issue when it’s ready, and many of our excellent back issues and copies of our Anarchist Interventions books, published in collaboration with AK Press.

We are turning to you to help make all this possible. Through your contribution we can get the new issue of Perspectives out to the world. 

The current Perspectives collective has been publishing issues of our journal for quite some time now, and we will produce an excellent issue with your help.  Please donate what you can, and spread the word about our fundraising campaign with your friends, family, coworkers and comrades!  Thanks.

story:
STRETCH GOAL #1

If we're able to raise €5,500 then we'll be able to create a professional audiobook, read by the author, and offer that to everyone who contributes to the campaign. So everyone will get a printed book, as well as digital and audio books!

Short Summary
 

I'm Ryan Millar, a 20-year improv veteran – as a student, performer, teacher, and workshop leader. As it happens, I'm also a professional writer. So I combined those pursuits by writing this book about improv. It contains a bunch of the ideas and insights I've collected over those two decades – especially the ones that resonated most with workshop participants.

It also has some first-person anecdotes as well as an assortment of games and exercises I've learned or created. My goal was to create a book that people could read cover to cover, or to pick up whenever they need a little inspiration or are feeling stuck. 

This book has taken years to write. Once that was done, it went through a rigorous editing, feedback and rewriting process. It's now being professionally proofread (Oxford comma or not?) and will then be laid out by the wonderful designer Eva Carp. I've even assembled a team of wonderful and supportive folks to help me see this through. So all the elements are in place.

All I need to know is how many copies to print.

Production & Timeline
 

As soon as the campaign is over, and the designs are finalized, I'll place an order with a local independent book printer in Amsterdam called Pantheon Drukwerk. It should take two weeks from that date until the books are ready to be shipped.

Then when the boxes of books arrive in our living room, the delivery team will put them in envelopes and mail them to you. The campaign has a few different perks, in case you want to spice up your order.

Because the project is ready to go, shipping is scheduled for early November.

The overall goal for this campaign is €4000. Which works out to 400 copies of the book. 400 copies, that's the magic number.

Why 400 copies? 
 

If I presell 400 copies via this campaign, I'll be able to afford to print 500 copies of the book, so I can have 100 extra copies to take to festivals, workshops and shows.

And those 400 copies (or €4,000) will allow me to

  • Pay the proofreader, editors, and designer (somewhat close to what they're worth)
  • Get an ISBN (so the book can eventually be sold on Amazon)
  • Pay for the various perks, like bookmarks, stickers and bags
  • Incidentals, like envelopes, printer ink, etc.
  • Break even on printing costs and all of the above

NOTE: In terms of getting my work out there, having 400 copies of my improv ideas sent out to improvisers and other interested parties around the world would be enormously satisfying

NOTE 2: Apparently, the average independently published book sells 250 copies over its lifetime. My goal is to beat that number (and just shooting for 300 copies seemed a little underambitious). Hence the magic 400.

NOTE 3: If the campaign falls short of our funding goal, but is close enough that I don't lose too much money on the printing, then it's still on!

If the campaign falls way short of that, the book won't get printed. And I'll also be miserable. Not permanently, but for a good while.

Why I'm doing this
 

  • FOR ME: Teaching improv workshops is a great passion of mine because they're fun, people find them useful and challenging, I give insightful notes, and I've picked up a lot of tips and experience in my travels – I love to pass that stuff on. But these days I don't go to festivals or shows as often as I used to, so this book is a chance to spread those teachings.
     
  • FOR YOU: You'll get a beautiful physical book full of great insights that you can immediately apply to your improv practice. You'll also be supporting a self-generated arts and media project.

Those are the two main impacts, and there's another one:

  • I'll be a (self-)published author, which is another dream of mine. I win, you win, improv wins.  So. Many. Wins.

Risks & Challenges
 

The biggest risk in this is that after pouring in all this hard work in order to get this book written, rewritten, rewritten, chopped, edited, changed and finally sorted (turns out writing and independently publishing a book is A LOT of work), I'm not able to get it printed, and thus fall short of the goal.

But if the campaign is successful there will be the organizational challenge of sorting, labeling and mailing 400 books. Luckily my wife Chiara, who is a master organizer, has volunteered to help with this. 

I've also got a small team here in Amsterdam to help me with the boxing, mailing, and moral support. So the biggest challenge at the moment is that it just doesn't get finished. I hate to leave things unfinished.

Order a copy and I get to fulfill this goal. And you get a book!

Other Ways You Can Help
 

The cheapest perk is a reasonable €10 plus shipping. But if that doesn't suit you, no problem. You can still help! 

  • Tell your friends, in person, via email, on Facebook or Twitter. You'll have my unending gratitude.
  • Go to www.ryanmillar.com and join my mailing list – maybe my next book will be more your speed!

That's all there is to it. Thanks!

The TAKE IT EASY™ team

 

Ryan Millar – Author

Ryan Millar is an Amsterdam-based writer, improviser, actor, communications trainer, and event host. He's also a playwright, storyteller, and copywriter. He loves words, learning new things, and making people laugh. He's bad at card tricks but good at skateboarding, and the obscenely proud father of a one-year-old.

Eva Carp – Designer

As a designer and copywriter, Eva Carp is literally a one-woman creative team. She's already been instrumental in getting TAKE IT EASY™ this far along: all of the concepts and designs are hers. She also recently bought a WiFi-free caravan to catch a breath from her busy freelance schedule.

Chiara Ferracioli – Manager

A systems sorcerer, Chiara juggles a high-stress job with being a doting mother to a one-year-old and a supportive wife to a guy who is always coming up with new and exciting ways to complicate their life. She loves yoga, freshly baked bread, and making sure stuff is organized properly.

Kiki Hohnen – Booster

Kiki Hohnen is a psychologist, communications trainer, improviser, and storyteller. She's been improvising for 13 years, performing and teaching in Ireland, Austria, Germany, and Australia. She also teaches soft skills to doctors. Kiki is excited for Ryan's book to reach a wide audience.

Ben Gras – Distributor

Ben's an improviser and sketch writer/performer (formerly of the now-legendary Big Ideas Show), who also happens to be a computer security expert. With an irrepressible positivity and an infectious smile, Ben always sees through whatever he's working on, from debugging complex software to nailing an Arnold Schwarzenegger impression.

Campaign thanks
 

These people have been super-helpful in producing the elements for this campaign. 

  • Shea Elmore for shooting the campaign video
  • Henk Raam for the extra video footage
  • Carlos Bouadi Padilla for the editing
  • Bone40 for the original TAKE IT EASY™ track
  • Trent Pancy for www.takeiteasy.tips
  • Olivier Valiente and Olli Heinanen for photos
  • Remko Keuter for video sound doctoring
  • Eva Carp for basically everything else

story:
¿Qué?

Los días es una dura narración acerca de la vida, de la aceptación de la naturaleza de esta, y de la transición de joven a adulto. 

Albert e Italo se conocen en París gracias a una beca Erasmus. Durante ese curso nace entre ambos una amistad indefinible. Dos años después Albert recibe un mensaje en México, donde vive temporalmente: Italo ha muerto. En ese país que le es extraño, Albert se sumirá en un profundo abismo de desolación que lo conducirá hasta el umbral de la locura. Para sobrevivir a la tristeza se aferrará a los recuerdos del año que vivió en París.

Escrito con la ternura con la que se recuerdan los momentos felices y la melancolía asombrada de quien ha sobrevivido a los malos, Los días capta la esencia del descubrimiento de la vida y del amor en la sociedad actual.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Alejandro Molina Bravo.

Licenciado en Comunicación Audiovisual por la Universidad Complutense, ha vivido en Madrid, París, Puebla (México) y Potsdam (Alemania), y ejercido la crítica cultural y cinematográfica para medios como Soitu y Culturamas, actividad que ha compaginado con la escritura. En 2007 escribió el relato «Hombre caminando sobre el mar (óleo sobre lienzo)» para el catálogo de la exposición antológica La inquietud de las cosas, del pintor José Ibarrola. En 2009 su microrrelato «Prólogo» apareció en la antología Cuentos para sonreír, de la Editorial Hipálage. Asimismo, ha publicado en las revistas La Espiral, Indias/Indies y Quimera.

Sus relatos han sido galardonados con la Mención Honorífica en el II Concurso «Los Hermanos» de Aldeas Infantiles; el Premio Absoluto en el XXV Concurso de Cuentos Noble Villa de Portugalete; el II Concurso de Relatos de la revista literaria Zenda (con un jurado compuesto por los escritores Juan Eslava Galán y Lea Vélez, entre otros) y el Premio Energheia España 2016 concedido en Matera (Italia).

En 2016 escribió y dirigió la obra de microteatro Término. Su último proyecto ha sido Carta al padre, exposición basada en su relato Afeitarse, comisariada por Andrea Perissinotto y con obras de la artista Anamusma.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Este es el libro que siempre quisiste escribir, como nunca quisiste escribirlo.
Esta es la primera página que escribes. Habrá una última, lo sabes.
Porque el libro ha empezado, tú lo has empezado.
Y todo lo que empieza acaba.
También este libro, que no querías empezar.
Porque no quieres que acabe»

«Nos hicimos una foto cuando llegamos al coche. Colocamos la cámara sobre un generador eléctrico y pusimos el temporizador. Tengo mi mano en su hombro y él la suya en mi cintura. Miramos la luz roja parpadeante, que parece que no se va a apagar nunca. Reímos. Hacemos otra foto igual. Volvemos a reír.
     —¿Estás más alto? —pregunté.
     —Yo creo que no, pero mis abuelos me dijeron lo mismo cuando volví de París.
     Montamos en el coche. Me llevó hasta otra plaza céntrica para que siguiera visitando la ciudad por mi cuenta. Paró a un lado de la carretera. Nos quedamos en silencio.
     Cabizbajos, nos lanzábamos breves miradas huidizas.
     Me invadía una sensación agridulce, de umbral no cruzado, de final antes de tiempo, de bella posibilidad irrealizada.
     —Bandrus —dijo Italo en voz baja, con la vista en el regazo.
     —¿Sí?
     —¿Yo hablo tan mal francés como la mujer que nos encontramos antes?
     —¡En absoluto! Tú hablas francés mucho mejor que ella, ¡pero mucho mucho!
     Italo sonrió, nos miramos, le revolví el pelo, nos reímos, nos miramos.
     —Addio —dije.
     Lo miré un instante más y salí del coche.
     No sabía si volvería a verle, si nuestra amistad perduraría, si el paso del tiempo nos volvería unos extraños como lo habíamos sido y todavía éramos en parte. Sólo sabía que le había conocido y que eso me hacía sentir bien.
     Caminé hacia la plaza sin volverme, aunque sabía que él me miraba marchar a través de la ventanilla. Entonces sentí que olvidaba algo. «El móvil», pensé. Me palpé los bolsillos, se me debía de haber caído en el asiento del copiloto. Di media vuelta y vi cómo el coche plateado comenzaba a alejarse. Corrí unas calles detrás de él, pero no logré alcanzarlo. Sudoroso y jadeante, le vi desaparecer a lo lejos. Me apoyé en los muslos. Noté el móvil en el bolsillo izquierdo. Miré la carretera.
     Fue la última vez que lo vi en persona»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Los días que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Alejandro Molina Bravo vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Tú hablas francés mucho mejor que ella, ¡pero mucho mucho!     Italo sonrió, nos miramos, le revolví el pelo, nos reímos, nos miramos.     —Addio —dije.     Lo miré un instante más y salí del coche.     No sabía si volvería a verle, si nuestra amistad perduraría, si el paso del tiempo nos volvería unos extraños como lo habíamos sido y todavía éramos en parte. Sólo sabía que le había conocido y que eso me hacía sentir bien.     Caminé hacia la plaza sin volverme, aunque sabía que él me miraba marchar a través de la ventanilla. Entonces sentí que olvidaba algo. «El móvil», pensé. Me palpé los bolsillos, se me debía de haber caído en el asiento del copiloto. Di media vuelta y vi cómo el coche plateado comenzaba a alejarse. Corrí unas calles detrás de él, pero no logré alcanzarlo. Sudoroso y jadeante, le vi desaparecer a lo lejos. Me apoyé en los muslos. Noté el móvil en el bolsillo izquierdo. Miré la carretera.     Fue la última vez que lo vi en persona»¿Cómo?Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 920€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.
Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.
Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Los días que saldría después a la venta.Además...Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Alejandro Molina Bravo vea publicada su obra.Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Hi. I wrote a book. It's chock-full of revenge and sapphic fun. You need more of that in your life. Let's make this happen, shall we?

~

Last November, I participated in NaNoWriMo.

That's something I've done every year for several now: prepare a deep cup of chai and/or other tea, hunch over my laptop, and start pounding away at the keys. From November 1st to November 30th, I write like a demon. It doesn't always yield fantastic results, but it always yields... results, at least. Either way, it keeps me off the streets.

This past Autumn, I think I hit on something good. Something not only of quality, but that will resonate with a lot of my people (by "my people", I mean many things: biracial people, WLW, nerds, geeks, feminists, and avid readers of supernatural fiction).  It turned out a lot better than I expected, and I think it's ready to be consumed. 

To be blunt, both with you and with myself, I've been sitting on this far longer than I should have. Several things gave me the swift kick in the glutes that I needed. My birthday reminding me that I'm another year older. The Orlando shooting reminding me that there are no guarantees you get another day to pursue your dream — especially when you're not a white straight cismale. Add onto those the wealth of other projects I want to start, and it seems the time has come to get this one out there for other people to enjoy and stop hoarding it to myself.

About "Bleeding For Eurydice"

Without giving too much away, this book is a dramedy/romance/supernatural story. More inspired by Dresden Files and Buffy than anything else as far as the supernatural aspects go, but I tend to weave a little of everything I've ever consumed into my work. I tried to represent a few different cultures and mindsets all throughout, keeping the focus on entertainment value even while sociopolitical issues are being dissected under the surface. I'd say it's a friendship-and-romance story foremost, a supernatural tale of revenge second, and then a piece of feminist literature. But it doesn't really work without all of those elements together, and you can't take one out without upsetting the balance.

General rating is a soft R, maybe a PG-13 from the late 70s. There's a lot of swearing and period talk, frank discussions about sex and nudity, a tiny bit of violence, blood. Plus some body horror moments that might leave some feeling a little squeamish. Not much in the way of "bedroom gymnastics", but that does come up. Basically, it's nowhere near Fifty Shades, but please don't read this as a bedtime story to small children!

Yes, it does have something to do with the Greek tale of Eurydice (yoo-RID-eh-SEE). No, I'm not going to tell you exactly how — but you can read and find out! (Apologies if that comes across as mean)

How much book are you getting for your money? In length, it clocks in at over 117,000 119,000 words. For those of you who aren't writers and would have no reason to memorise word counts, that means it's longer than Frankenstein, the third Harry Potter book or The Hobbit, just a hair longer than Twilight. So if you were worried about getting a thinnish YA novel that will only take you an hour or two to consume, worry no longer! Also, definitely nowhere near as lengthy as Moby Dick or Fellowship Of The Ring if you balk at long-term commitments. I didn't pad it with filler, nor did I trim out things where trimming was not needed.

Where You Come In

This Indiegogo is your chance to buy this book before it's widely available to the public on Amazon.com (EDIT: This will include an eBook option at that time, for those of you wondering). Take note that it will be marginally less expensive on there, but also won't be signed, and won't have any of the other perks available to you through this campaign. So if you're patient and don't care about autographs and such things, then rest assured, you will have another way to get the book! 

Once the Indiegogo campaign ends, I will continue to offer the basic perk of an autographed copy at an increased price, and the other perks will go away. So if you want drawings, or a copy autographed by the illustrator or any of the other goodies, you'd better stop stalling!

Now I realise that I'm more or less an untested and unknown author, and you may feel there's no incentive to fund this campaign now. No arguing with that. However, if the premise and/or aspects of this type of story appeal to you, I thought this would be an ideal way to provide more than just the book itself, and to get it to you a little earlier.

What I'm offering:

  • The opportunity to snag a trade-sized paperback of "Bleeding For Eurydice" before anyone else — and autographed.
  • Related rewards, such as getting your name in the book, t-shirts, or bonus drawings by Laura Knatt, the cover artist.
  • UNrelated rewards, such as me slipping in a random Pokémon card into your book. Just because.

To be clear: the near-final draft of the manuscript and cover art are complete. All that's left at the time of this campaign launch is a final editing overview and the ordering of a few proof copies to make sure it looks exactly the way I want it to look (plus adding the list of Indiegogo backers to the book, which I won't have until the campaign ends). I can't know the future so I don't want to lock down a date, especially since if I get a better response than expected, it could take me a while to sign all those copies. But rest assured that I project fulfilling every single order within the next few months. In time for Christmas!

NOTICE: ALL SALES FINAL. If you have a complaint, we will work with you to make it right, up to and including replacement of the merchandise if it is deemed necessary, but cannot refund your money. I'm not Walmart and I can't very easily "eat the losses".
ANOTHER NOTICE: All of the perks include US shipping. I realise now that I shouldn't have done it that way, because most people in the US expect the price to be the base price, and then shipping added on afterward. But too many rewards have been claimed for me to change it now, haha.

STRETCH GOALS

Uhh... really, the story is done, the art is done; there isn't anything to "stretch" for besides that, haha. However...

  1. If we hit the $500 minimum goal, I'll consider making a hardcover version available. This would be added as an entirely separate perk, and I'd have to figure out pricing first. OKAY COOL! Wow, I'm honestly shocked that we hit this one so fast; in the first 12 hours! Update: there's a Hardcover perk available now! Check the campaign updates for details.
  2. Maybe if we get over $2000, I'll find someone to record an audiobook? I wouldn't even know how to go about that, but I'm a smart cookie; I can do some research and get it done.

I'm Not Poor But I'm Not Rich

Some people feel more comfortable "donating" to a cause wherein they know the recipient is in desperate need of funds, for a life-saving operation or to pay rent or what have you. I'm not currently in a situation that dire; if your money is better placed with one of those people, then please give to them first!

On the other hand, I do have wants that are hard to meet with my current low-paying job. I'd like to have my own car instead of borrowing my grandparents' when they aren't using it. Being able to upgrade my phone would be great (it's literally the cheapest Android phone on the market, I come close to throwing it into the nearest pond so frequently it's no longer funny). I'd love to replace my technically-running laptop with a newer desktop that has more power (which will enable me to actually play my Steam games again, since that has been a pipe dream of late). There are other health-related and life-related needs I am less comfortable discussing, but they aren't urgent and I'll be fine for the time being.

As the title of this section states, I'm not poor, but I'm definitely not rich. Rest assured I won't be splurging on any gold toilet seats with your money; I'll be buying food and saving toward a reasonably-cheap car, or a PC I hope to last me several years. 

That's It!

Take a look through the perks I'm offering and decide if any of those sound worthwhile to you. If you fund me, thanks! If not... thanks for reading this far! Maybe you can pass the page on to a friend who you think will be a little more interested, or you'll pick the book up when it's available on Amazon. Anyway, have a good day and may the deity of your choice be with you (or not, if you're an Atheist).

<3
J.X.

story:
Summary

The grass roots demonstrations concerning Black racial justice, sparked by the death of George Floyd, have created an urgent, unprecedented response of support by CEOs and corporate leaders. These pledges total $8 billion as of July 20, 2020. and are designed to facilitate efforts that support racial justice, help activities that seek to empower, support, and accelerate immediate solutions to the crisis affecting Black people. We know, however, that when Black people start rising up, big money always starts coming to our organizations. So...we will also track how the money is used, not just where it's from...to see our original data, click here. (If you are under the age of 25 you can have access to the tracker for free, without making a donation, btw...just email info@creativeinvest.com.)

What Our Campaign Is About

We have created an online website tracker from our database of BLM promises and will, with your help, monitor corporate responses over the long term (hopefully). The website and app provides detailed information. This includes information on the corporations making the BLM pledge and the organizations receiving the money. We also provide contact information for both. (See diversityfund.net, minorityfinance.com or creativeinvest.com for some of our current websites...)

What We Need & What You Get

We will provide recurring, updated information on these pledges. Here is one image of what the website and app might look like....

The Impact

The corporations on our BLM response list earned $500 billion in 2019....and let’s not forget that these corporations are the primary beneficiaries of the Federal Reserve’s $6.7 trillion corporate credit facility,  an expansion in the Fed’s balance sheet specifically designed to help  large institutions. 

In a sense, this is, in actuality, why marches and demonstrations are required in the first place.

Risks & Challenges

The key risk is that we might miss a pledge/donation or two. Not to worry. Once we announced our intention to track these efforts, it seems people are more than willing to let us know if we left anything out. This is all good, and, in fact, is one of the benefits of this crowdfunding campaign. We welcome the help.

Corporations may hide their true activity, and it will be difficult to force them to reveal their actual behaviour. We have had a lot of experience in this.

We may need to ask you to send an email or two if we get any pushback.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • If you are under the age of 25 you can have access to the tracker for free, without making a donation, btw...just email info@creativeinvest.com.

And that's all there is to it.
