story:
The Long and the Short of It...

We've already funded, folks. But we realize not everyone had a chance to get on board.

eSpec Books is making magic! Five books have funded: Megan Mackie's The Devil's Day and Lucky Devil Libations, Michelle D. Sonnier's An Unceasing Hunger, Ty Drago's Dragons, and the upcoming anthology Horns and Halos.

The Devil's Day by Megan Mackie
(book 3 in the Lucky Devil series)

You can always find help at the Lucky Devil.

Rune Leveau—emerging Talent and one-time corporate prisoner—knew that better than anyone. She’d rebuilt her life at the Lucky Devil bar, with her Aunt Maddie’s help. Now, in her aunt’s memory, Rune continues that legacy.

But when it is time for the Devil to collect his due, Rune could lose it all…

With the days counting down until she must defend her claim to the House of Magdalene—including the bar—Rune and her partner, the cyber-spy St. Benedict, hunt for a way to defeat her challenger, the fire Talent, Abraxas. Instead, they uncover long-kept secrets. But do they hold the key?

No matter what, the Devil will have its Day…

Lucky Devil Libations by Megan Mackie and Olivia Kizior

An exclusive companion book to the author's series, featuring recipes for drinks and bar food unique to the Lucky Devil, as well as short vignettes featuring the patrons of the bar.

An Unceasing Hunger by Michelle D. Sonnier
(book 2 in the Evolution of Magic series, and sequel to The Clockwork Witch)

Shunned by her family her entire life for not living up to their expectations—or prophesy—Arabella forges her own path and attains her greatest wish: to join the Sisterhood of Witches. Doing so in a manner no one ever anticipated.

As the first-ever technomancer, the way before her is fraught with peril. Can she survive the machinations of her order, or be ground between the gears of reluctant progress?

More important yet, can she succeed at her first assignment:  find the root cause of the famine sweeping through Ireland? A task that already claimed two witches of the Sortilege line.

Her future hangs in the balance... or her very life....

Dragons by Ty Drago

Ask yourself, are you Kind?

For one young man and others of his Kind, they are taught their very existence is a long-held secret. Andy learns unexpectedly that it isn't a very well kept one.  

The race of Dragons is not what the wider world would expect, but the elite are well—if not fully—versed in what they are capable of. One ruthless faction is not above kidnapping Andy and whisking him across the universe to exploit his unique nature. 

To them, he is a means to an end. To Andy, they're playing with fire. 

Horns & Halos edited by Danielle Ackley-McPhail and John L. French

A collection featuring angels and devils, with stories by James Chambers, John Hartness, Jenifer Purcell Rosenberg, Megan Mackie, Michael A. Black, Michelle D. Sonnier, Russ Colchamiro, Danielle Ackley-McPhail, Robert E. Waters, Hildy Silverman, John L. French, Keith R.A. DeCandido, and Patrick Thomas.

One of the campaign exclusives we are offering is a 3D-printed "jade" coin featured in Megan Mackie's Lucky Devil series. The perk has been claimed, so we can't update the picture there, but here is the finished design:

What We Need & What You Get

This is just icing, folks. We've already secured the funding for our projects. This InDemand campaign accomplishes three things:

  1. Letting you know about these amazing books.
  2. Giving fans an opportunity to preorder the titles.
  3. Helps us to show more appreciation to the authors, who receive a profit share of all remaining funds once production costs have been met and rewards have been fulfilled.

You, on the other hand, get early access to these amazing books and an opportunity to secure campaign exclusives, such as custom Lucky Devil pint glasses.

The Impact

Indie publishing is suffering right now. Between cancelled in-person events where many of us make the majority of our sales and connections with fans and industry professionals, and the drop in third-party sales due to the shutdown, campaigns like this are the best way for us to get the word out there. It is also the best way for us to ensure we maintain a steady steam of income to our authors, who aren't seeing as much in the way of royalties right now.

All of that business stuff aside, we are creating magic, and right now the world needs more of that. Original fiction, original ideas, positivity and overcoming adversity. We need both an escape, and content that will lift us up and remind us that we have a voice and we can be a light in the darkness of this world we find ourselves in.

Risks & Challenges

  • This project is already funded and the books have begun production. What your support means is that we are able to pay more profit share to the authors involved.
  • eSpec Books has funded all new publications via crowdfunding and has a perfect record both for funding successfully, and always fulfilling those campaigns. To date, we have run sixteen campaigns.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Not in a position to pledge? No worries...we understand. There are still ways you can help, though:

  • Please share the word of this campaign either directly or using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Please subscribe to our YouTube Channel.

An Unceasing Hunger by Michelle D. Sonnier(book 2 in the Evolution of Magic series, and sequel to The Clockwork Witch)
Shunned by her family her entire life for not living up to their expectations—or prophesy—Arabella forges her own path and attains her greatest wish: to join the Sisterhood of Witches. Doing so in a manner no one ever anticipated.
As the first-ever technomancer, the way before her is fraught with peril. Can she survive the machinations of her order, or be ground between the gears of reluctant progress?
More important yet, can she succeed at her first assignment:  find the root cause of the famine sweeping through Ireland? A task that already claimed two witches of the Sortilege line.
Her future hangs in the balance... or her very life....
Dragons by Ty Drago
Ask yourself, are you Kind?
For one young man and others of his Kind, they are taught their very existence is a long-held secret. Andy learns unexpectedly that it isn't a very well kept one.  
The race of Dragons is not what the wider world would expect, but the elite are well—if not fully—versed in what they are capable of. One ruthless faction is not above kidnapping Andy and whisking him across the universe to exploit his unique nature. 
To them, he is a means to an end. To Andy, they're playing with fire. 
Horns & Halos edited by Danielle Ackley-McPhail and John L. French
A collection featuring angels and devils, with stories by James Chambers, John Hartness, Jenifer Purcell Rosenberg, Megan Mackie, Michael A. Black, Michelle D. Sonnier, Russ Colchamiro, Danielle Ackley-McPhail, Robert E. Waters, Hildy Silverman, John L. French, Keith R.A. DeCandido, and Patrick Thomas.
One of the campaign exclusives we are offering is a 3D-printed "jade" coin featured in Megan Mackie's Lucky Devil series. The perk has been claimed, so we can't update the picture there, but here is the finished design:


What We Need & What You Get
This is just icing, folks. We've already secured the funding for our projects. This InDemand campaign accomplishes three things:

Letting you know about these amazing books.
Giving fans an opportunity to preorder the titles.
Helps us to show more appreciation to the authors, who receive a profit share of all remaining funds once production costs have been met and rewards have been fulfilled.

You, on the other hand, get early access to these amazing books and an opportunity to secure campaign exclusives, such as custom Lucky Devil pint glasses.

The Impact
Indie publishing is suffering right now. Between cancelled in-person events where many of us make the majority of our sales and connections with fans and industry professionals, and the drop in third-party sales due to the shutdown, campaigns like this are the best way for us to get the word out there. It is also the best way for us to ensure we maintain a steady steam of income to our authors, who aren't seeing as much in the way of royalties right now.
All of that business stuff aside, we are creating magic, and right now the world needs more of that. Original fiction, original ideas, positivity and overcoming adversity. We need both an escape, and content that will lift us up and remind us that we have a voice and we can be a light in the darkness of this world we find ourselves in.

Risks & Challenges

This project is already funded and the books have begun production. What your support means is that we are able to pay more profit share to the authors involved.
eSpec Books has funded all new publications via crowdfunding and has a perfect record both for funding successfully, and always fulfilling those campaigns. To date, we have run sixteen campaigns.  


Other Ways You Can Help
Not in a position to pledge? No worries...we understand. There are still ways you can help, though:

Please share the word of this campaign either directly or using the Indiegogo share tools!
Please subscribe to our YouTube Channel.

story:
Story of My Book

My name is Marina Destinee Paul and I am the author of Becoming a Superhero. I wrote this book out of necessity because I didn’t know how to find a female mentor who I saw myself in. I wanted to know what made women successful, beyond a transactional leadership assessment, and dive deep into who they were as humans. When I discovered the essence of these women, apart from their formal role title, the only name that was fit to describe them was “Superhero."

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how you can become a leader in your life and elevate the lives of others . This book is an opportunity to help you understand leadership is rooted in owning your unique skillset and mind, and using it to help others believe in their own unique ability. My hope is for you to learn alongside local, national, and internationally-known Superheroes, like Entrepreneur Dr. Kristian Edwards, Fortune 50 General Counsel Maryanne Lavan, and Olympic Gold Medalist Jordyn Wieber. I want you to leave this book understanding the importance of practicing resilience every day, building deep relationships with individuals, and not being afraid to “go for it” - whatever “it” means in your life.

You will love this book if you are embarking on your professional career, are transitioning into a new chapter of your life, or are yearning for something more that will ignite your passions. This book is the toolkit to finding your superpowers and the pep talk to use them.

Becoming a Superhero appeals to women of all ages, no matter which phase of life they are currently in. They may be grappling with living in a "man's world", or feeling the weight of the preconceived world around them is not their destiny. They are gaining the confidence to break the status quo, hone in on their power, and ignite the world.

Ultimately, I hope that Becoming a Superhero inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
  • How do I unleash the superhero within me?
  • How do I make sure everyone on my team is seen and heard?
  • How can the power of sisterhood help solve racial justice?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing vulnerability, humility and failure, as well as leaving people better than we found them will change us all for the better.

The Book
The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 - In Part 1, I discuss what a superhero is and the history of superheroes.  Some insights you will learn are the power of representation and the rise and fall of female leaders.

Part 2 - In Part 2, I discuss key characteristics superheroes possess and their journeys to finding their super powers. One insight you will learn is the power of a sisterhood bond and how this bond can be used to combat systemic issues like racial justice.

Part 3 - In Part 3, I discuss how you can find the superhero in yourself and what you need to do once you find it. One insight you will learn is the primary importance of being a good teammate and how to leverage your relationship-building skills once you become a leader.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.

  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Marina Paul is a management consultant, marketer, and former collegiate athlete.

Her passion is to unite women of all backgrounds, and establish a connection where we see one another for who we uniquely are. With a lifetime of experiences being on sports teams, Marina knows how sisterhood-like bonds -- whether it is big sister, twin, or little sister — can transform lives for the better. She uses her own life experiences through sports, coupled with one-on-one interviews with incredibly successful women, to characterize an intensely raw and emotional path to leadership and being a Superhero.

Marina can’t sit still and always has to be doing something active — snowboarding, beach volleyball, soccer, yoga, trail running, attending a sporting event, or bouncing around a major city. She is someone who deeply cherishes her friends and honors loyalty, and is equally content being in a foreign city alone meeting new people. She lives for the adventure and excitement of what is unknown and the beauty of life she can uncover.

She’s taking her own book’s advice and finding one challenging or humiliating thing a week that she knows she might fail at, laughing at herself, and learning in the process.

Share your personal weekly challenge with Marina on social media! For more information, connect with Marina Paul:​
Email: marinadpaul@gmail.com
Instagram: @marinapaul
Twitter: @marinadpaul
LinkedIn: @Marina Paul

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #BecomingASuperhero and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Go unleash your super powers,
Marina Paul

story:
Excerpts from the Spring 2013 issue! 

Preview before you order! Selections from the Spring 2013 issue are now available online: 
 
"I am in my car, foraying into the lower city in search of life and books. Autumn storms loom gray over the city, twinging the air with the scent of ice-cracked winter. Rain makes an opaque smear of my windshield so I pull over." Paula by Court Merrigan
 
"Darkness fell like a soggy blanket, and the deluge had yet to let up. No moon, no stars, no lights in Arroyo Seco but the intermittent lanterns mounted along porches of the town’s finest establishments. A cold wind flickered their flames behind rain-spotted glass." - Harbinger of Arroyo Seco by Milo James Fowler

About Big Pulp

We're carving out an independent corner of the publishing world where story matters and writers get paid for their work. Got 20 bucks? You can help us out in a big way. 

Since 2008, Big Pulp has published some of the best genre fiction writers from around the world. Our zine is a modern version of the classic corner newsstand, where writers and readers could find pulp and popular fiction of all kinds - science fiction, adventure stories, horror, fantasy, jungle tales, mystery and true crime, romance, and super-hero sagas. Big Pulp has published long-time writers and award-winners, as well as new and emerging authors. Some of our writers have published hundreds of stories or poems, but many have received their first writing credit - and first payment - from Big Pulp. 

The Impact

Some of Big Pulp's funding comes from donations and advertising, but sales are our lifeline. Without sales, we would no longer be able to pay our writers, maintain our website or continue publishing. 

We strongly believe that writers deserve to be paid for their work. We also believe that offering payment significantly increases the quality of work that is submitted to us for publication on our site and in the magazine. 

We began Big Pulp as an online publication in 2008, launched a print version in 2010, and are expanding into short story collections and themed anthologies in 2013. We're no fly-by-night or vanity press! We've been at this a while and want your support to keep it going! 

What We Need & What You Get

$2500 buys a lot for a small press, including dozens of writer payments and a healthy print run for several books. 

All our editorial work - site maintenance, editing and proofreading, sales & events - is done pro bono. Every dollar raised through the campaign will go back into running the site, publishing the magazine, and paying contributors. No exceptions. 

We're not asking for you to give something for nothing! Depending on your funding level, you net a copy of Big Pulp, a 4-issue subscription, a copy of our LGBT-themed story collection Clones, Fairies, and Monsters in the Closet, an awesome hand-crafted Jankie by Phil Good, a thorough manuscript critique by Big Pulp editor Bill Olver, or a massive combo pack! Trust us - they are all awesome. 

No $$$? We're cool. 

We know that not everyone has dough to throw around. We've been there. But, it doesn't cost a dime to help spread the word! 

Can you help us find 50 new readers? Tell your friends! 

If you're a writer and want to help keep a paying market in print, make some noise! 

The sharing tools make it easy to help spread the word through e-mail, Facebook, Twitter or your own web site. Tell your friends!

story:
Places I Have Been Rejected From Have Accepted Me. Help me say "Yes, I will attend" to Bread Loaf & Byrdcliffe Artist Colony on the east coast. The life of a writer is riddled with rejection, but for some reason, this year, two wonderful things have been offered and I humbly ask for your help so that I may accept both opportunities to write, live and complete my next body of work. I'm going to channel my spirit animal, Amanda Palmer and ask for your help in sending me to the East Coast for both things. This campaign is a stepping stone. 

#1. I have been accepted to Bread Loaf Writers Fellowship. What the hell is that? It's a 10-day workshop where I will have the chance to be critiqued and throttled by my peers and guided by my illustrious and hopefully kind workshop leader at Middlebury College in Ripton, Vermont. I've been accepted into their prestigious nonfiction program and I have submitted scary new work. I have sent in my $300 deposit. Now they want the rest of the money for room, board and tuition.    


#2. I was chosen as an Artist-In-Residency at Byrdcliffe Art Colony for session IV: From September 2-September 28th where I will write in this crazy cottage/barn from 1901 on like 250 acres in the Catskill Mountains just west of the Hudson River where Isadora Duncan used to dance and where Chevy Chase used to live and Wallace Stevens and Thomas Dewey and other famous writers with similar last names have also worked. A reliable source has reported a ghost named Jane who bosses around writers and makes them produce every day. Between Jane, the wolf spiders and the foxes, I will batten down the hatches and hide in my dark chamber and write.  


I realize that making art and attending fancy pants workshops which feature hiking trails and cottages and Amtrak sound like frivolous things, especially when people are fighting cancer, losing their homes, losing loved ones, suffering in general, being beaten by cops or being drugged by Bill Cosby. But if I can take a little time off of my gazillion jobs to finish my second book, it would be a step in the right direction—away from stripping and towards the writing. 

I know I only get to do this once. 

I believe in writing as literature and writing as art. Because these two are connected, I must do both in order to have a full life. I have no husband with which to share my expenses. I rent. I live alone. And I've chosen to strip in order to carve out blocks of time for writing, but now the time has come to embark on a radical life change: a full-time job and a life of writing and teaching.

Writing a book-length manuscript demands a very different thing than writing for a couple hours each day. I need a quiet and deep stretch of time where I must get down on the dusty floor and write like a motherfucker. 

I'm asking you to send me away from Los Angeles—from the things and people I love the most. Help me leave my gazillion gigs, my high maintenance animals and my wonderful, supportive boyfriend in order to do this thing that I have to do in order to enter a new phase of my creative life. 

I am asking strictly for tuition, travel and housing expenses to both Bread Loaf and Byrdcliffe Art Colony

Here is the breakdown of where the money is going:

  • My rent for September: $1,083.00 (I cannot AirBnB because I am not on the lease and the manager lives upstairs).
  • Travel: $1,200.00 ( Approximate airfare to and From Vermont for Bread Loaf & to and From Woodstock, NY including Amtrak both ways and sharing taxi from the airport with some other kids from Burlington, Vermont)
  • Remaining Tuition: $2,750.00: Bread Loaf (3,000)  and Byrdcliffe: $500.00)
  • My car payment while I am gone + car insurance so I will still have my car when I return: $507.00
  • Utilities while I am away: $75.00
  • Food while in Woodstock: $300 (we have to buy our own food)
  • Cat Sitter while I am away (Scrappy has Hyperthyroidism and needs drops 2x day: $300

Writing in a magical ancient haunted barn will allow me to publish my next book and also help me to transition out of stripping. 

When I went to Akumal, Mexico with Michelle Tea's Radar Lab, I reworked the entire second half of my book and wrote a Rumpus Letter that was widely distributed and illustrated beautifully by Ariel Schragg.

Risks & Challenges

This is one of those times when I'm being challenged to take a giant leap of faith and to be entirely unreasonable by prioritizing my writing and trust the results. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, slather my campaign around and tweet me out. Help me just by making some noise. I graciously accept the efforts and promise to return the favor.

Food while in Woodstock: $300 (we have to buy our own food)
Cat Sitter while I am away (Scrappy has Hyperthyroidism and needs drops 2x day: $300    Writing in a magical ancient haunted barn will allow me to publish my next book and also help me to transition out of stripping.  When I went to Akumal, Mexico with Michelle Tea's Radar Lab, I reworked the entire second half of my book and wrote a Rumpus Letter that was widely distributed and illustrated beautifully by Ariel Schragg.   Risks & Challenges This is one of those times when I'm being challenged to take a giant leap of faith and to be entirely unreasonable by prioritizing my writing and trust the results. 
    Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute, slather my campaign around and tweet me out. Help me just by making some noise. I graciously accept the efforts and promise to return the favor.

story:
Hi. I'm Henry Reade.

When I was younger I had a hard time finding books I liked. What was available tended to be what adults thought I should read, not what my friends and I wanted to read. So I spent 5 years writing a series of humorous, irreverent books called The Pencil Bandits, about three brothers who try to become outlaws. I tested them, and discovered that kids loved them, and that these books got kids excited about reading. I now want to publish my second Pencil Bandits book, but I need your help. Please support my campaign to get more young people reading by giving them books that they find fun. Because who knows more about what young people want to read than a genuine young person? 

You can hit the "back it" button and contribute, or buy one of our fabulous perks. 

Also, please tell your friends. Just click one of the social media buttons to the right of the "Back It" button at the top of the page.

Thanks!

story:
Hey guys! My name is Patrick Noll and I am the author of the book TRICHOCEREUS: THE SAN PEDRO GROUP which we successfully financed through Indiegogo in 2016. Because of the incredible support of our community we were able to surpass all expectations BY FAR and delivered a wonderful hardcover book that is now in the hands of hundreds of happy owners! And now we´re back with the second volume called TRICHOCEREUS: SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS.

SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS will be a coffee table sized book (A4) with countless photos and descriptions of Trichocereus hybrids, clones and cultivars from all over the world. It contains hundreds of unique photos and information on a large number of Trichocereus clones, hybrids and cultivars. 

The Book Highlights

  • All books are extremely limited, hand numbered and personally signed by the author. It´s our way of expressing our gratitude towards our supporters and every single book will be signed. 
  • Extra large A4 coffee table type book with hundreds of photos
  • All color pages. This isn´t one of the books that is mostly black and white and only has a few color pics in the back. Pretty much all pages are in color and most of them have photos. 
  • Written in English, Self Published and not available in book stores. 
  • Hardcover edition.
  • Thread stitching. 
  • Featuring some incredible and never before published hybrids that will blow every Trichocereus Fan away. 
  • There is also a special edition that comes with an alternate cover and tons of additional stuff that was only produced for this campaign.  
  • SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS portrays crosses between Trichocereus pachanoi and other species, some of which resulted in completely unique and never before seen hybrids. 
  • This book also shows hybrids that are the result of intergeneric crosses between Trichocereus and more distant genera like Pseudolobivia or some of the clumping Echinopsis. 
  • SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS is a unique and one-of-a-kind book that could only be made because the author dedicated his life studying the genus Trichocereus while chasing around rare plants all over the world.  Almost all of the known and highly respected Trichocereus breeders contributed photos and knowledge for this book, which is why there is an incredible range of hybrids to be seen here. 
  • Contains crosses or clones involving Trichocereus pachanoi, Trichocereus peruvianus, Trichocereus cuzcoensis, Trichocereus terscheckii, Trichocereus bridgesii, Trichocereus validus, Trichocereus chalaensis, Trichocereus werdermannianus and many more. Including photos of the rare hybrids like the SAARLAND, SAARWELLE, LEICHTE FEDER, AMUN-RE and the new line of ZELLY hybrids, 

What is this campaign about?

To me, this campaign is not really about making a lot of money...I just wanna make the most beautiful Trichocereus book on the market (again!) and that´s why I need your help to cover the incredibly high printing costs. Without your help, we won´t be able to print this book. Period. We picked a goal that´s very doable and I am very positive we´ll reach it. In return you get a book that probably never would´ve seen the light of day if not for the amazing support of this community. The book is already written but we also need to bring in another editor to give the book a 100% professional edit. Editing is an almost as important part of a book creating process as writing and in the end it´s money well spent. With our last campaign we reached more than 15.000 Euro and this time we will knock the ball out of the park. 
Once again we urgently need your help to make sure we reach our goal again. We´ve been working the whole year in order to prepare this book and there is also lots of bonus content available for our supporters. Because we´re completely independent and self-publish our books, the prices are a little bit higher than the ones from the huge printing houses. Specialist literature is never cheap, and we just don´t have access to the resources that larger publishers have. By supporting us in this campaign, you will not only get some incredible perks like a beautiful book or Trichocereus related merchandise, but you also support independent book printing as a whole in your favorite niche. For self-publishing authors it becomes more and more difficult to come up with the printing costs, which is why it´s so important to have a community that´s standing behind them. We have a great project on our hands, but everything stands and falls with the community behind it. 

Who am I? 

I am the crazy Evil Genius behind sites like Trichocereus.net and a contributing part of the Trichocereus community for a good 20 years now. I am an upstanding guy that´s always trying to do the right thing. My word is of great importance to me and I am obviously not in it for the money. A few years ago, I felt like there was an urgent need for a beautiful coffee table book about the genus Trichocereus so I simply made one myself. The success of that book was the result of a lot of work and love for the subject and now I am back with an even more beautiful follow-up book titled TRICHOCEREUS: SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS.

I deeply care about this subject and with all the experiences made during the production of the first book the game plan is already laid out. If we meet our goal we´ll use the same printer that already printed our first book. The printer has many years of experience in the book printing business and helps us with every step of the production.  This new SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS book will be of these independent gems that you just can´t get from the mass market and I can only recommend everyone to get a copy. The edition is tiny and it´s completely uncertain if there will ever be a reprint. The number of available books will be VERY limited. So better get one of these discounted copies while you can. 

Perks - What you´ll get for your support!

- For 20 Euro you get the limited, signed and numbered Postcard Set 

- For 25 Euro you get the limited, signed and numbered SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS poster. 

- For 30 Euro you get one of our limited Trichocereus.net shirts made for this campaign

- For 65 Euro you get a signed, numbered and stamped hardcover book from the regular edit. You get a number between 1 - 999 Regular Edition Print Run (First come, first served). 

- For 85 Euro you get a signed, numbered and stamped hardcover book from the special edition with an alternate cover. These books will have numbers between 1-200 from the Special Edition Print Run.

- For 125 Euro you get the special edition of the book, a shirt of your choice and the limited postcard set. 

- For 135 Euro you get the book bundle consisting of both Trichocereus books in the hardcover edition. THE SAN PEDRO GROUP  (Price 88 Euro) + SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS (Reduced price, Regular Edition). 

- For 225 Euro you get the complete collection of our Trichocereus.net shirts, consisting of all eight shirts specially made for the campaign. 

- For 250 Euro you get the small SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS resale package consisting of a box of 5 copies of the new SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS book 

- For 482 Euro you get the large SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS resale package consisting of a box of 10 copies of the new SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS book  


1. Hardcover Edition

Pick this perk and get a hardcover copy of my new book SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS. All books are limited, signed, numbered and stamped. 300 A4 pages. Price: 65 Euro + shipping costs (taxes may apply). Numbers 201 upwards. 

 

2. Special Edition with Alternate Cover
(first 200 books)

With this perk you get the limited special edition of the book with an alternate cover and a number between 1-200 Special Edition Print Run. Only 200 books have the alternate cover. 300 pages, hardcover, signed, numbered, stamped. Price: 85 Euro + Shipping Costs (taxes may apply).
We´re still working on the final design of the special edition cover, so there might be changes to the cover before it goes to print. This Special Edition contains the same content as the regular book, but is more limited and comes with a very different cover. 

 

3.  1x Limited Trichocereus.net Shirt of  Choice


This perk contains one limited shirt of your choice. You can pick between 8 different designs and all are available in the sizes M, L, XL and XXL. 

Shirt 1 - Trichocereus (Only in Black)

Shirt 2 - Chemical Shaman (Only in Black)

+

Shirt 3 - Lophophora (Only in White​) 

Shirt 4 - Trichocereus Monstrose (Only in Black)

Shirt 5 - Trichocereus Flowers (Only in Black)

Shirt 6 - Trichocereus Cross (Only in White)

Shirt 7 - Trichocereus Art (Only in white)

Shirt 8 - Spider (Only in White)

4. Book Bundle Volume 1 + 2

This perk contains both hardcover books (Volume 1 THE SAN PEDRO GROUP + Volume 2 SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS). They will be shipped together as soon as the new book comes from the printer. Delivery time will be July 2018. 

5. Limited Edition Postcard Set


This perk contains our limited edition Postcard set specially designed for this campaign. Instead of having to buy them all separately you get all of them together in a bundle. All postcards are limited, signed, numbered and stamped. You get the following eight postcards as well as a bonus postcard. 

 

6. Special Edition Box Set 


This perk contains the Special Edition of the new book (the one with the alternate cover and a number from the first 200 books from the Special Edition Run), one Trichocereus shirt of your choice and the postcard set consisting of 9 different postcards specially designed for this campaign.  The cover of the special edition is still subject to change and the photo you see below is an example. We´ll probably use this one as base, but certain elements might differ in the final edition. 

 

7. SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS Limited Poster 

Get this perk if you want the limited SAN PEDRO HYBRIDS A2 poster. In this edition we´ll only produce as many posters as are ordered through the campaign, That makes these incredibly limited and rare. The posters look fantastic, both in regards to the design and the quality. 

 

8. Complete T-Shirt Set consisting of all eight shirts made for this campaign

By checking out with this perk, you´ll get all shirts that our various designers made for the campaign. All shirts will be the same size chosen by you. This perk will be shipped around April/May 2018. 

9. The 2 Book Gift Bundles

What will we do with the money?

 
  • We will use the money to pay for the printing costs. They are substantial and it´s the biggest part of the costs. 
  • We will pay for a professional editor that will give the book a professional editing. 
  • We will pay for the postage+shipping costs, shipping boxes, shipping material, etc. 
  • We will also use this money to pay for the shirts, postcards and other promo material. 
  • We will use the money to pay for things like tax declaration, etc. 

 

What will happen if we do not meet our goal?

  •  We have a very good community standing behind this book, so everything other than a big success would be surprising. To make it even more safe for our supporters we chose flexible funding. That means that even if we should not meet our goal, we will still be able to use the money we collected to print the book in the best possible way. We will do everything in our power to reach and even exceed that goal...but even if that wouldn´t be the case we have alternative route to get this book printed. If we´d not meet the goal we´d still honor and deliver the perks. We´d probably have to reduce the content/page count, but there´s no chance on earth that we´d not deliver this beautiful and amazing book. We already have customers standing in line getting it into their hands and we would find a way, even if hell freezes. 

 

Why we need your support and why this campaign is so important!

 
  • In times of the internet and the never ending availability of free content it´s become very difficult for self-publishing authors or independent publishers to print beautiful books about niche subjects. You find all kinds of mediocre cactus books on ecommerce sites, but there are very few special interest books such as this one about the genus Trichocereus and unless you help to make it happen, there might not be one ever again. By supporting this book, you are directly supporting the genre of specialist literature in niches not mainstream enough for the big publishers. There´s not a lot of money to be made with something like this...and that´s okay because  we love the subject and only want everyone to have a cool book in their shelf. Very few things beat the feeling of having a beautiful book in your hands, and this one will be particularly beautiful. Even though eBooks are a great thing to have, you constantly lose them on your drives and it´s just not comparable to having a printed coffee table book in your hands. If you sometimes feel like there should be more specialist literature about your favorite subjects available, now is the time to support it. 
  • With your support, you also help us to produce free content on our website. It took me years and thousands of hours of work and countless Trichocereus and Echinopsis photos to build the books and the website as they are today, and by supporting our projects you also help us keeping it great.  
  • Some of these photos were hard to come by and I don´t think someone will ever go through such lengths  to make a book of this kind again. It´s literally a miracle that we were given the chance to print the book in the form it is now and without your help it would not be possible. 
 

Risks and Challenges

 

With every project of this size there are risks involved. Below you find some of the things that could happen. 

 
  • The printer could take the money and not send the books. Well, that´s theoretically possible but very, very unlikely since we already worked with this printer before. One of the reasons I chose this particular printer is because we can pay him with Paypal. That way, we´re pretty much covered and it gives us security that he´ll ship our books. It costs a little bit more because of the fees involved, but it gives our supporters and myself the security we need.  
  • There might be certain quality problems with the book, eg a few minimal printing problems, shipping damages, something like that. However, the printer has years of experience in printing and shipping books worldwide. The first book arrived at my doorstep well packed and beautifully done. It can always happen that some books have minor problems, but I´ll  give every copy a strict quality check and only send out excellent books. We also make a test print to make sure it´s great quality. 
  • If we don´t meet our goals completely, we might have to make minor changes to the content, eg reduce the page count or certain parts of the book. However, it´s incredibly unlikely because we´ve got a great infrastructure that´s been screaming to get this book in their hands. 
  • The editing might take longer than expected.  On this second book we will bring in another professional book editor to work on the book. With the first book, the editing time was very long and I want to reduce it by paying for an additional editor. After having done this once before, I know that good editing needs time and under no circumstances will we rush that incredibly important part of the production process. That said, we´ll do everything in our power to ship all the books and rewards as soon as possible. I know that we all can´t wait to get this book in our hands and we´ll work day and long nights to make it happen asap. 

Timescale

Our campaign will end on March 1st. It will take a good couple weeks until Indiegogo will pass the funds on to me after the end of the campaign. As soon as that happened I will book another editor to work on the book for 2-3 weeks. At the same time, I´ll bring in another designer to do certain design tasks such as the final special edition cover. It always takes time to get a book to print and I expect that we´ll be printing in May. After the books are printed it will take 2 months for the books to arrive at my door step. They´ll come by boat, so shipping takes a while.
As soon as I got the books here I will unload the crates, check the quality of the books and start preparing the shipping of the books. Shipping so many books at once probably takes 3-6 weeks and I expect the shipping to begin around July. The date is not set in stone, but this book is already pretty much done and I don´t expect many delays somewhere along the road. It´s incredibly important to me that I send out a top notch product and I don´t want to bring a rushed book just to save a week or two. In the end, everyone will have a beautiful book and I swear it´ll be well worth the wait. 

Some other perks like shirts, postcard set and posters will ship around April/May. If you get one of the box sets that contains both the book and the other perks, we will ship everything together to reduce shipping costs. If you wish to get separate shipping (eg the Postcards in April and the Book in July) please send me an email to EG@trichocereus.net and I´ll let you know the additional shipping costs.  

Shipping information

I ship all books and merchandise from Germany with DHL in a registered parcel. The standard rate for one book is 20 Euro for worldwide customers and 7 Euro for buyers within Germany. The books will be well packed in special boxes and wrapped with bubble wrap to keep some certain Postal services from damaging the book. There will be a tracking number for everything I ship out and if there are problems you can always send me a message and I´ll be happy to track it, 

Other ways to help this campaign:

 

I know that some people are on a budget and if you can´t afford to buy the book, please consider getting one of the equally limited Postcard Sets or the Shirts. If you´re even to broke for that we´d greatly appreciate if you´d share this campaign on your social media profiles or tell your friends, family or fellow inmates about this book.

The link to this campaign is https://igg.me/at/trichocereus and every share helps. However, please don´t spam this campaign and make sure to ask the administrator of the groups/forums if you are allowed to share it if you post it in a group. Tell your friends about this project and feel free to send us a message to EG@trichocereus.net if you want to get a press kit.  

Thanks a lot to every supporter. It´s an honor that we can make these beautiful books for you and we´ll pay you back by making a beautiful book!

We will pay for the postage+shipping costs, shipping boxes, shipping material, etc. 
We will also use this money to pay for the shirts, postcards and other promo material. 
We will use the money to pay for things like tax declaration, etc. 

 
What will happen if we do not meet our goal?
 We have a very good community standing behind this book, so everything other than a big success would be surprising. To make it even more safe for our supporters we chose flexible funding. That means that even if we should not meet our goal, we will still be able to use the money we collected to print the book in the best possible way. We will do everything in our power to reach and even exceed that goal...but even if that wouldn´t be the case we have alternative route to get this book printed. If we´d not meet the goal we´d still honor and deliver the perks. We´d probably have to reduce the content/page count, but there´s no chance on earth that we´d not deliver this beautiful and amazing book. We already have customers standing in line getting it into their hands and we would find a way, even if hell freezes. 
 
Why we need your support and why this campaign is so important! 
In times of the internet and the never ending availability of free content it´s become very difficult for self-publishing authors or independent publishers to print beautiful books about niche subjects. You find all kinds of mediocre cactus books on ecommerce sites, but there are very few special interest books such as this one about the genus Trichocereus and unless you help to make it happen, there might not be one ever again. By supporting this book, you are directly supporting the genre of specialist literature in niches not mainstream enough for the big publishers. There´s not a lot of money to be made with something like this...and that´s okay because  we love the subject and only want everyone to have a cool book in their shelf. Very few things beat the feeling of having a beautiful book in your hands, and this one will be particularly beautiful. Even though eBooks are a great thing to have, you constantly lose them on your drives and it´s just not comparable to having a printed coffee table book in your hands. If you sometimes feel like there should be more specialist literature about your favorite subjects available, now is the time to support it. 
With your support, you also help us to produce free content on our website. It took me years and thousands of hours of work and countless Trichocereus and Echinopsis photos to build the books and the website as they are today, and by supporting our projects you also help us keeping it great.  
Some of these photos were hard to come by and I don´t think someone will ever go through such lengths  to make a book of this kind again. It´s literally a miracle that we were given the chance to print the book in the form it is now and without your help it would not be possible. 

 Risks and Challenges With every project of this size there are risks involved. Below you find some of the things that could happen.  
The printer could take the money and not send the books. Well, that´s theoretically possible but very, very unlikely since we already worked with this printer before. One of the reasons I chose this particular printer is because we can pay him with Paypal. That way, we´re pretty much covered and it gives us security that he´ll ship our books. It costs a little bit more because of the fees involved, but it gives our supporters and myself the security we need.  
There might be certain quality problems with the book, eg a few minimal printing problems, shipping damages, something like that. However, the printer has years of experience in printing and shipping books worldwide. The first book arrived at my doorstep well packed and beautifully done. It can always happen that some books have minor problems, but I´ll  give every copy a strict quality check and only send out excellent books. We also make a test print to make sure it´s great quality. 
If we don´t meet our goals completely, we might have to make minor changes to the content, eg reduce the page count or certain parts of the book. However, it´s incredibly unlikely because we´ve got a great infrastructure that´s been screaming to get this book in their hands. 
The editing might take longer than expected.  On this second book we will bring in another professional book editor to work on the book. With the first book, the editing time was very long and I want to reduce it by paying for an additional editor. After having done this once before, I know that good editing needs time and under no circumstances will we rush that incredibly important part of the production process. That said, we´ll do everything in our power to ship all the books and rewards as soon as possible. I know that we all can´t wait to get this book in our hands and we´ll work day and long nights to make it happen asap. 

Timescale

Our campaign will end on March 1st. It will take a good couple weeks until Indiegogo will pass the funds on to me after the end of the campaign. As soon as that happened I will book another editor to work on the book for 2-3 weeks. At the same time, I´ll bring in another designer to do certain design tasks such as the final special edition cover. It always takes time to get a book to print and I expect that we´ll be printing in May. After the books are printed it will take 2 months for the books to arrive at my door step. They´ll come by boat, so shipping takes a while.As soon as I got the books here I will unload the crates, check the quality of the books and start preparing the shipping of the books. Shipping so many books at once probably takes 3-6 weeks and I expect the shipping to begin around July. The date is not set in stone, but this book is already pretty much done and I don´t expect many delays somewhere along the road. It´s incredibly important to me that I send out a top notch product and I don´t want to bring a rushed book just to save a week or two. In the end, everyone will have a beautiful book and I swear it´ll be well worth the wait. 
Some other perks like shirts, postcard set and posters will ship around April/May. If you get one of the box sets that contains both the book and the other perks, we will ship everything together to reduce shipping costs. If you wish to get separate shipping (eg the Postcards in April and the Book in July) please send me an email to EG@trichocereus.net and I´ll let you know the additional shipping costs.  
Shipping information
I ship all books and merchandise from Germany with DHL in a registered parcel. The standard rate for one book is 20 Euro for worldwide customers and 7 Euro for buyers within Germany. The books will be well packed in special boxes and wrapped with bubble wrap to keep some certain Postal services from damaging the book. There will be a tracking number for everything I ship out and if there are problems you can always send me a message and I´ll be happy to track it, 

Other ways to help this campaign: I know that some people are on a budget and if you can´t afford to buy the book, please consider getting one of the equally limited Postcard Sets or the Shirts. If you´re even to broke for that we´d greatly appreciate if you´d share this campaign on your social media profiles or tell your friends, family or fellow inmates about this book.
The link to this campaign is https://igg.me/at/trichocereus and every share helps. However, please don´t spam this campaign and make sure to ask the administrator of the groups/forums if you are allowed to share it if you post it in a group. Tell your friends about this project and feel free to send us a message to EG@trichocereus.net if you want to get a press kit.  
Thanks a lot to every supporter. It´s an honor that we can make these beautiful books for you and we´ll pay you back by making a beautiful book!

story:
Que?

O caderno de erros  é un exercicio de estilo coas normas do xénero negro coma escusa para afondar en temas profundos.

A tráxica morte de Diego Cruz, O Tato, un dos mellores boxeadores galegos de todos os tempos, permitirá descubrir o seu avolto pasado para así comprender o seu comportamento violento e fuxidío.

Martiño Ferradás, un apoucado inspector de policía, farase cargo do caso e loitará contra vento e marea para esclarecer as causas da morte do puxilista . Ninguén confía nel, nin el mesmo. Namoradeiro, sentimental e un tanto desgraciado intentará poñer luz na escuridade a unha morte que envolve á cidade de Vigo. Os sentimentos son o seu peor inimigo e por iso acabarán pasándolle factura para facer terapia axudado polo seu caderno de erros.

Quen?

Do Peirao é unha editorial con vontade de cambio, de dar a alternativa a autores que non a atopan noutro lugar, con novas e refrescantes ideas como é o empregar unha campaña preventa para valorar a aceptación e viabilidade de cada título.

Deste xeito es ti, agora que te estás expondo como colaborar, o que decide se a obra que che presentamos verá a luz pasando a formar parte do noso catálogo... porque consideramos ao lector parte fundamental do proceso.

Hoxe presentásenos a Cándido Paniagua.

Nacín en Xinzo de Limia, terra chairega e de grandes lendas. Amante das letras dende pequecho, decidín estudar unha carreira humanística, rematando con premio extraordinario fin de carreira no grao de estudos de galego e castelán (antigas filoloxías). Na actualidade vivo en Vigo e exerzo como profesor de ensino secundario transmitíndolle ás novas xeracións a importancia da palabra para crear historias.

Voraz lector, especialmente da novela negra, comezo a escribir na adolescencia ata converterse nunha actividade diaria na miña vida. Escribo novelas e relatos curtos, que devecen por saír á luz. Este ano gañei o  3º premio do Xuventude Crea 2017 polo relato «Fado: 0103».

Por que?

Por aquí un fragmento do texto como mostra:

«Quero presentar as miñas desculpas, mais non sei como facelo. Non sei nin por onde comezar. Andan a buscarme, intentando cargarme un morto do que eu non son culpable. Non busco que me comprendan, tan só quero escusar o meu comportamento infantil, propio desta situación que me desacouga e non me deixa durmir.
     Quero poñer un pouco de luz neste túnel escuro no que andamos metidos todos. Os meus días están contados, sei demasiado, sei o que non debería saber, sei o porqué da morte de Diego, do meu Diego. Mais antes só lle quero pedir unha cousa, por favor, protexa as únicas persoas que me quedan, Pepe e Carme.
     Sabía que o coñecía dalgo. Non aparecera porque si, o seu interese non era o disfrace que nos quixo amosar. Coñecíao. Sabía que coincidiramos anteriormente. Alí, onde sempre brilla máis o sol, onde comezou todo, onde...»

Como?

Para arrincar o proxecto fixámonos como obxectivo 880€; esta é a cantidade que recadariamos se ao redor de cincuenta mecenas se fixesen, cada cal, cun exemplar desta primeira edición.

  • Tendo acceso ás galeradas de edición.
  • Recibindo un exemplar semanas antes da saída ao mercado da obra.
  • Aínda que, tamén poderías ver o teu nome nos agradecementos achegando un pouco máis.

Os fondos recadados utilizaranse como axuda para sacar adiante esta primeira edición de O caderno de erros, que sairía despois á venda.

Ademais...

Sabemos que son tempos difíciles, tamén nós os sufrimos, e é posible que non esteas en disposición de apoiarnos co teu mecenado nestes momentos... pero agardamos que se isto te chegou á alma, mesmo se talvez coñeces en persoa ao autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-orella... ) para que academos a nosa meta e Cándido Paniagua vexa publicada a súa obra.

Grazas polo voso tempo.

story:
The law effects our daily lives in innumerable ways. It stands to reason, then, that it also has an impact on the world's game. From a penalty denied, to the surface upon which a tournament is played, to the wages a player is paid, to the ability of a player to determine where he or she will ply their trade, to what a fan can and cannot say inside a stadium: there is a law, regulation, or rule governing that. Yet so few journalists are able to discuss these matters with the depth or detail they require: perhaps because they lack the capacity to do so, perhaps because their editors would prefer to publish clickbait over commentary, or perhaps simply because they cannot be bothered.

Enter Ballon d'Order: a website and podcast, the first of its kind, dedicated exclusively to the intersection of the law and the beautiful game, authored by two footie fans who made the unfortunate choice to become attorneys. 

There is a real demand for this type of coverage. We conducted a survey, wherein we asked football fans and non-fans alike their thoughts about a hypothetical site exactly like Ballon d'Order intends to be. We asked where they got their news from, why they would be interested in such a site, and why they would be willing to support such an initiative. Here are the highlights:

  • Only a handful of respondents, when asked to name journalists, bloggers, or social media personalities they trusted most to deliver accurate football-related news/commentary, were able to name attorneys or other individuals with actual knowledge of the law.
  • 64 percent of respondents stated they would be willing to pay for access to a site similar to Ballon d’Order.
  • Of these would-be patrons, 66 percent felt it important to support independent content creators in a time of flux and uncertainty in the industry.
  • 52 percent of respondents expressed the value of “legal analysis by someone who actually went to law school”.
  • 44 percent of respondents were just “sick of all the middle-aged white dudes who dominate the industry, tbh, and just want to hear another voice”.

More specifically, here's what the Internet had to say on the subject:

“Soccer is frequently tangled with the law (as most things are), and I really want a go to source to have legal analysis as soon as possible. Sometimes, you don’t even get analysis straight from lawyers, and while it’s obviously not impossible for non-lawyers to read and understand legal situations, I would really enjoy experts running a website like this.”

“Especially as it has to do with USSF v NASL, there’s a lot of law-adjacent talk out there with bloggers and journos, and it just seems like a lot of hot takes. I’d like a more educated discussion about the why’s and how’s, especially since soccer in US/Canada seems to be finding its footing.”

“It would fill a void for an under-served area of soccer coverage.”

“...it doesn’t exist now, football and the law interact on a daily basis, and we need smart people to write about it to provide FACTS not speculation.”

“As much as some would like, football does not exist in a vacuum and is shaped by the laws that govern it. And just like any other enterprise, a lot happens in that grey area of the law, and as someone who knows little to nothing about it: there be dragons, and that intrigues me.”

Who's Behind Ballon d'Order?

Ballon d'Order is the brainchild and passion project of two football fans and friends, Elizabeth Cotignola and Gabe Lezra. Chances are, if you’re here, you already know them (ciao, amici!) For those who don't:

The trilingual Elizabeth Cotignola, who you may recognize as @LaDiavolina on Twitter, is an attorney in Montréal, Québec. Born and raised the child of Italian expatriates in ‘la belle province,’ where she earned a degree in Political Science from McGill University, she began her legal career as a litigator in Chicago, where she graduated from the Loyola University Chicago School of Law. Since her return to the True North, she’s advised two of the world’s leading aerospace innovators on compliance with export controls and economic sanctions, and now puts her skills to use for Europe’s largest bank, where she ensures the bank’s corporate and institutional clients are not engaging in money laundering or terrorist financing. When she’s not lawyering, she enjoys yelling about Milan, the Montreal Impact, and her beloved Azzurri to anyone who will listen. Occasionally; she writes something other than tweets; she has previously contributed to Unusual Efforts, A Football Report, Kickette, Futbolita, Soccer Gods, The Soccer Wire, SB Nation, and XI Quarterly.

The American-born, Madrid-bred Gabe Lezra, aka @ElEzrah, is a graduate of Wesleyan University in Middletown, Connecticut, and of Georgetown Law (cum laude, natch) in Washington, DC. Like Elizabeth, Gabe sold his soul after law school for the glitz and glam of corporate law; unlike Liz, he has since returned from the Dark Side and now represents the public interest. Gabe founded SB Nation’s Real Madrid blog, Managing Madrid, and when he’s not fighting the good fight, he spends most of his free time hosting and producing his two podcast babies,  Managing Madrid and Let’s Fix Football. He lives in Washington with his fiancée and their puppy, who by all accounts is a Very Good Dog (because they’re all good dogs, Brent.)

Why Do We Need Money, Though?

Quality content is expensive to produce, as the spate of layoffs across the industry in recent years have made painfully clear. At the very least, we’d like enough to cover the costs associated, in our first year of publication, with:

  • website hosting and domain name registration;
  • a trademark application;
  • a Getty Images license;
  • a PACER account; and
  • access to LexisNexis or Westlaw, in order to ensure we can provide the best possible analysis backed by the most thorough research possible.

As traditional journalism goes quietly into the good night, and as new media becomes increasingly dependent on clickbait to survive, we intend to provide our audience the insightful, analytical - but always irreverent - commentary they desire and deserve. We firmly believe there’s an audience that wants this, and the results of our survey reinforce that belief. As football fans ourselves, we know that football fans today are more educated and informed than ever before, and they seek an authoritative voice, a deeper angle, and an understanding they won’t get from the major outlets. We intend to fill that void.

story:
The Digital Plan

 

My mission: Creating good strategy to use websites, social media, email, design, and video for positive change. This is my passion and I've helped create hundreds of plans for organizations and political candidates over the last eight years, including:

  • The 2008 and 2012 Obama campaigns, focusing on battleground states as Digital Training Director
  • Senate, Congressional, and Governor's races
  • Credo's SuperPAC
  • Presidential Inaugural Committee’s National Day of Service
  • Rainforest Action Network and allies

I frequently get asked by friends and allies if there is a template for digital plans. This book is designed to help folks understand the right questions to ask to create the plan they need.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need your support, because I find my time pulled by active campaigns I'm working on and finding that time to get this book finished is always illusive when there are active campaigns to work on. I'm asking you to support because I want to make this an active campaign to help others. 

  • Reaching $2,500 will get the start up needed for copy editing and first round prints. 
  • Funders like you get mentioned in the book!
  • And we get practical guidance in the hands of more people running progressive campaigns. 

The Impact

Right now as we speak there is a project or progressive campaign that won't get the momentum it needs or they'll find themselves paying too much to consultants for too little digital strategy and output in return:

  • I don't want to have to tell another campaign for good in the world there isn't a great template.
  • I don't want to see another good campaign pay too much to a consultant when they could answer some of their own questions after $20 for this book and a few hours reading. 
  • Having written and coached others on hundreds of plans I want to get that knowledge to more people. 
  • This is about empowering others with knowledge to run good campaigns, launch beautiful projects, and win on progressive issues!

The Challenge

Here's the real story. I've been working on a few drafts of sections over the last 3 years. But it's hard to set aside the time for this passion project when my team at work or a side client needs me. I need you to be my client, I need you to chip and be part of the community I'm accountable. 

  • All of what the book needs are the tactics I've coached on. 
  • I need the support and a little acountability pressure from you.

The Digital Plan
 
My mission: Creating good strategy to use websites, social media, email, design, and video for positive change. This is my passion and I've helped create hundreds of plans for organizations and political candidates over the last eight years, including:

The 2008 and 2012 Obama campaigns, focusing on battleground states as Digital Training Director
Senate, Congressional, and Governor's races
Credo's SuperPAC
Presidential Inaugural Committee’s National Day of Service
Rainforest Action Network and allies

I frequently get asked by friends and allies if there is a template for digital plans. This book is designed to help folks understand the right questions to ask to create the plan they need.
 

What We Need & What You Get
I need your support, because I find my time pulled by active campaigns I'm working on and finding that time to get this book finished is always illusive when there are active campaigns to work on. I'm asking you to support because I want to make this an active campaign to help others. 

Reaching $2,500 will get the start up needed for copy editing and first round prints. 
Funders like you get mentioned in the book!
And we get practical guidance in the hands of more people running progressive campaigns. 


The Impact
Right now as we speak there is a project or progressive campaign that won't get the momentum it needs or they'll find themselves paying too much to consultants for too little digital strategy and output in return:

I don't want to have to tell another campaign for good in the world there isn't a great template.
I don't want to see another good campaign pay too much to a consultant when they could answer some of their own questions after $20 for this book and a few hours reading. 
Having written and coached others on hundreds of plans I want to get that knowledge to more people. 
This is about empowering others with knowledge to run good campaigns, launch beautiful projects, and win on progressive issues!


The Challenge
Here's the real story. I've been working on a few drafts of sections over the last 3 years. But it's hard to set aside the time for this passion project when my team at work or a side client needs me. I need you to be my client, I need you to chip and be part of the community I'm accountable. 

All of what the book needs are the tactics I've coached on. 
I need the support and a little acountability pressure from you.

story:
Endorsements


The greatness of a person is that he is able to grow and accomplish in all circumstances. I have personally known the author and admire how he has grown through all his challenges.

- Rabbi Shmuel Kamenetsky, Rosh HaYeshiva (Dean), Talmudical Yeshiva of Philadelphia

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Moe's story is one of resilience, growth and inspiration. He shows us the steps he took to overcome his challenges and inspires us to push harder to overcome our own.

- Charlie Harary, Esq., Co­-Founder & CEO, H3 Capital LLC

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Facing challenges is what life is all about and Moe s story will resound with all readers who at some point in their lives will face challenges. 

- Jane Fraser, President, The Stuttering Foundation of America

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Moe' story is one of triumph, challenge and re-discovering freedom; penned with an authentic, personal spirit and raw vulnerability. All of us are endowed with greatness. For those of us seeking tools and inspiration to unlock our potential, to overcome our challenges, and to become GREAT, Moe's book offers a unique perspective with universal value.

- Uri Schneider, MA, CCC-SLP; Co-Director, Schneider Speech

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Moe Mernick is one of the most inspiring individuals I have been privileged to meet. His story and his accomplishments reset the bar for us all.

- Rabbi Lawrence Kelemen, Author, To Kindle a Soul: Ancient Wisdom for Modern Parents and Teachers
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Short Summary

Over the last 10 years, I have taught on numerous Jewish educational programs in the US, Canada, Central Europe, Israel and Australia. I completed an International MBA, worked at Deloitte as a Strategy Consultant and trained senior-level executives on their presentation skills. Currently, I work at a cool Israeli startup, mentor budding entrepreneurs at a technology accelerator and teach classes in the Tel Aviv area. I am married with three children, and I am living my dream.

While I was growing up, though, none of this seemed remotely possible... because I had a crippling stutter. 

It started when I was three years old. My parents were encouraged to ignore it, as most speech impediments disappear by the time a child is five. Mine, however, did not. It just got worse. And it was a nightmare.

I was ridiculed. I could not say my own name. At times, I could not even say the word "hello" when answering the phone! My future seemed bleak...and I was miserable.

What changed? How was I able to break out my shell? Where did I discover the courage to begin to public speak? Most importantly, what enabled me to transform my adolescent anger and frustration into inner-serenity and true happiness?

The answers to these questions (and much more) can be found in my upcoming memoir, The Gift of Stuttering (working title). The book describes my quest for meaning and purpose, notwithstanding my severe stutter. Through the use of stories and anecdotes, my book will bring you on a journey through my life, the ups and the downs, the highs and the lows. It narrates how I came to ultimately embrace my stutter, appreciate myself and become a happier person as a result.

As we all undergo adversity, it is not the adversity itself that defines us; rather, it is our response to it that truly shapes us. Therefore, regardless of the challenges you are currently facing (be it stuttering or otherwise), I am confident that you will gain refreshing and relevant insights by reading my book.


Allocation of Funds

The highly professional and experienced team at Mosaica Press is enthusiastic about my book. They say that there is nothing like it in the Jewish world. Not only would it be the first culturally sensitive book to address stuttering, but it is also a vulnerable first-hand account of a personal challenge. And while there are many wonderful books available that address the topic of adversity, only a handful of them are structured in a narrative, first-person format. As such, Mosaica is proud to bring this to market. 

Transparency is important. Therefore, I'd like to share with you the details of where the raised funds will be allocated (all numbers are approximate):

  • 50% --> Content edit, copy-edit, proofread, straight-read, interior design, cover design and project management.
  • 30% --> Printing the first 1,000 copies of my book and coordinating their distribution to bookstores worldwide.
  • 10% --> Perk fulfillment, such as shipping your book directly to your home.
  • 10% --> Campaign fees, including credit card processing and platform costs. 


Project Risks 

You should feel comfortable knowing that there is very limited risk associated with this project. My book is nearly complete, an experienced publisher is committed to the project and many people have expressed interest in my story. 

The project is moving forward...  Nevertheless, please note that your contribution will help determine its overall impact.


Ways You Can Help

  1. Choose one of the featured perks.
  2. Share the campaign with your friends by using the Indiegogo share tools.
  3. Give me feedback on how we can make this campaign ever more successful.


Thank You

It is truly a privilege to partner with you on this rewarding and exciting project. I am confident that many people will lead more meaningful and happier lives as a result of my book. And as such, thank you very much for helping make that a reality.
