story:
¿Qué?

La isla de la fama efímera es una fábula actual, rabiosa y sin concesiones, en la que se pone en duda el actual sistema de vida, el establishment, a través de los ojos y las vidas de cuatro personas (que no personajes) tratando de no perder lo poco que les queda de aquello que alguna vez se llamó humanidad.

José es un redactor cansado de escribir frases vacías que sus jefes deforman hasta hacerlas irreconocibles; Jennifer, una ejecutiva agobiada por las exigencias de clientes caprichosos, está agotada por el esfuerzo vano que realiza día a día para complacer a todos en su equipo; Ane desea demostrar que, a pesar de ser solo una becaria, es mucho más capaz que sus compañeros; y Rafael, diseñador y mujeriego, enfrenta su primera crisis moral al obsesionarse con una joven publicista. Estos cuatro empleados de una agencia de publicidad digital de Caracas se enfrentarán a la inminente pérdida de su cliente más importante y todo lo que esto conlleva.

Lo que parece un simple problema laboral se anuncia como una crisis que destruirá el delicado orden que estos personajes, y sus compañeros de oficina, han construido. Mientras el equilibrio se viene abajo, José, Jennifer, Ane y Rafael buscan encontrar algo que les devuelva el sentido que creen haber perdido. Las conversaciones en los pasillos, la música y el sexo parecen ser los únicos puntos de contacto para estos cuatro personajes que, aunque no dejan de buscarse, son incapaces encontrarse los unos a los otros.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Nacho Alarcón.

Nacido en Caracas en 1987, estudió Filosofía en la Universidad Católica Andrés Bello de Venezuela y, para compensar, un máster en Literatura Comparada en la Universidad Autónoma de Barcelona donde oficializó una de sus más viejas obsesiones: Woody Allen. Actualmente, cursa estudios de doctorado en la Universidad de Alcalá. Ha publicado en revistas culturales, como la Revista Borrador y Contrapunto. Publicación de crítica e información literaria, así como en revistas y libros especializados en Teoría Literaria.

Músico de cañerías y paisajista de callejones, se dedica, de a ratos, a escribir sobre las cosas absurdas que le apasionan (literatura, cine, televisión y todo lo relacionado con la cultura pop). Si tuviera tiempo libre, lo invertiría en aprender japonés.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de La isla de la fama efímera que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Nacho Alarcón vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

La isla de la fama efímera es una fábula actual, rabiosa y sin concesiones, en la que se pone en duda el actual sistema de vida, el establishment, a través de los ojos y las vidas de cuatro personas (que no personajes) tratando de no perder lo poco que les queda de aquello que alguna vez se llamó humanidad.
José es un redactor cansado de escribir frases vacías que sus jefes deforman hasta hacerlas irreconocibles; Jennifer, una ejecutiva agobiada por las exigencias de clientes caprichosos, está agotada por el esfuerzo vano que realiza día a día para complacer a todos en su equipo; Ane desea demostrar que, a pesar de ser solo una becaria, es mucho más capaz que sus compañeros; y Rafael, diseñador y mujeriego, enfrenta su primera crisis moral al obsesionarse con una joven publicista. story:
Story of My Book

Life is Fair is about leveraging Awareness, Self-knowledge and the Power of your Mind for Success and Happiness. This is a book that will give you the personal empowerment and freedom to be, do and have anything.

My name is Tommy Ajayi and I am the author of Life is Fair. I wrote this book because of Millennials and Generation Z. Research has now revealed that this group are the most stressed generation in our society today—they are depressed, unhappy and scared about the future. I had a similar dark night of the soul experience in my life. And came out victorious.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what makes your heart sing and soul dance. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement in you that I have for Life is Fair. And then, ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you discover your own personal empowerment and freedom to choose the reality you desire.

In this book, you'll learn about using Awareness, Self-knowledge and the Power of Your Mind to choose a Successful and Happy life:

  • Awareness - When you take a good look at what is going on in your outside world and then you do an inventory of what is going on in your inner world, chances are both worlds are the same. If there is fear, struggle, or anger inside you, it will show up in your outside world.
  • Self-knowledge - Our origins are rooted in nature, and what we do to nature we do to ourselves. When we poison the oceans and rivers, we still have to drink the same water; when we contaminate the air, it is the same air we will breath; when we infect the soil, we still have to eat the food that comes from the soil because it is the soil that nourishes and feeds us.
  • You live in a Fair World; a world that doesn’t favour a culture or race. It doesn’t speak French, Hindi, Spanish, Mandarin, Arabic, or English; it only speaks energy and favours only one race: The Human Race.
  • Power of Your Mind - Whether you aware or not, your body and mind are close friends that are entangled in a conversation all day - in the shower, in traffic, at work, during your drives, during lunch, during dinner. Every moment of the day, the mind is constantly chatting up the body, and asking it on a date.

You will love this book if you crave a lifestyle of inner success and happiness

Life is Fair is a non-fiction book that speaks to Millennials and Generation Z who are looking to create a lifestyle that allows them personal empowerment and freedom for the first time.

The Book - Life is Fair

The book is written in 3 Parts

Part 1 contains the introduction + Chapter 1-7. This part focuses on why we crave external validation and blame others. Then, we will explore mind science and what it takes to create your own reality.

Part 2 contains Chapters 8-11. The section examines the basic principles of a “Life is Fair” mindset.

Part 3 contains Chapters 12-15. This section looks at how to apply a “Life is Fair” mindset in all areas of life: high school, college, university, early in career, and later in life. Together, we will look at the cheat codes to the game of life and help you realize that the cards are truly stacked in your favour once you start your engines.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Tommy Ajayi discovered writing at the age of seventeen as a way of escaping reality when he was battling depression and loneliness. He found so much solace in writing that he was able to write himself out of pain and into satisfaction. Tommy now spends his time looking for opportunities to inspire others in his day-to-day life which led him to share his writing with others. His debut book was inspired by Wayne Dyer, who was regarded by many as the father of motivation. When Tommy isn’t writing, you will find him dancing or performing salsa.

I was inspired to write this book because of Millennials and Gen Z. I had a similar dark night of the soul experience - Prior to enrolling in college, I was depressed, sad and scared about the future. And it wasn’t until I took a break from college to meditate and go within for 3 months that I was able to create a change and transformation in my life. This inward journey allowed me to gain awareness, self-knowledge and develop my mind. And this book is going to take you on a similar journey - it is a call for hope and change. You will be inspired to develop the personal empowerment and freedom to be; to do; and to have anything.

When am not writing, you will see me on the dance floor - busting one or two moves.

For more information you can connect with Tommy at tommy.ajayi@gmail.com and facebook @piooajayi; twitter @piooajayi; instagram @piooajayi; linkedin @ooajayi

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #personal-empowerment #freedom #success #happiness and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Tommy Ajayi

story:
Author

While I was born and raised in India, I left India in 1997 to pursue an MS in Electrical Engineering in the U.S.  I chose a career in IT and had worked in the corporate world until 2014. After 16 solid years in the industry, when I thought my life was set, I had a spiritual awakening that changed my future forever in ways that I could not fathom. While contemplating career alternatives, I was led consciously to leave the corporate world with no regret and without a plan of action. In my heart I knew I needed time off to pursue my spiritual journey and contemplate what was next for me.  My awakening led me to channel the text ‘The Lion’s Wisdom’.

Campaign

This campaign is to facilitate the publishing of the book in its entirety. The monies from the campaign are to further the book in every aspect, ranging from promotions to printing. The goal is to get the book in as many hands as possible. Given the plight of Mother Earth, the message in the book is urgent in its nature to nurture the planet and the world we live in.

Cause

By funding this project, those who contribute will be supporting a cause that is larger than us. The contributors are funding a movement; the movement is to conserve all of Mother Earth’s inhabitants. This book is a vehicle which has opened minds and changed view points. Per the book, if we do not awaken now, we will be forced to witness the devastation of the beauty that is innately present.  

We are setting up a non-profit organization to foster this book, as well as the books to follow, that have already been channeled. The Lion's Wisdom is the first book in a series. 

Cost

    We need $6000 to cover the initial expenses of printing and promoting the book.  This breaks down as follows:

    $    500 -  Initial printing of galley review copies

    $ 3,000 - Promotion

    $ 2,500 - Printing for the Book Release on September 10, 2019

    The proceeds of this book will be used to fund the mission of a pending non-profit organization, "Pawsitively Yours" that will exist to promote wilderness protection.  "Pawsitively Yours" is one of the Chapters in The Lion's Wisdom.

    The Impact

    The short-term goal is to produce this book. The long-term goal of this book, and therefore the value, is to raise awareness of the way we treat plant and animal life. The reason we treat them as such is because we have set aside the innate connection that exists between all forms of life. Therefore, we decide who is better and who is not. This mindset has contributed to the extinction of animal and plant life and the devastation that is currently occurring. Our goal is to educate as many people as possible to understand the havoc we have created and restore the abundant nature of life. Unless we respect the plant and animal species, we are marching towards a world, which will likely be uninhabitable.

    This project is only the beginning of what is to come. We are fierce in our intention to serve the world we live in through publishing and education. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that not everyone can contribute. We have been in a similar position. What we mostly need is spreading the word about The Lion's Wisdom.  We are grateful for all forms of help, which include word of mouth, social media etc. 

    From The Lion's Wisdom,  "I am glad you listened to my dad (The Lion). He is full of wisdom. Little does he realize, we sense his energies. Yes, we are furry little things, but we’re full of wisdom just like him. Mother Earth created us just like she did my father—full of wisdom. We have joined the army and are reaching out to you with our tiny paws. They are soft to touch, and we are easy to cuddle, unlike my father. We are the future generation that will continue the legacy. We are calling out to all little ones on Mother Earth to come and join our army. We play, we laugh, we love, we cry in this army. We are filled with emotions of joy, love and peace. We offer you our paws. Aren’t we cute? Aren’t we cuddly? Aren’t our paws soft as a cushion? Won’t you play with us? Look at my eyes, big and bright? Would you like to see the glow in my eyes stay forever? If you would like to see the light in my eyes grow brighter, please hold my paws and march with me towards paradise. We are creating a legacy. We want you to be part of this legacy. It is a legacy that we are meant to carry forward together."

    "We are holding paws, hands, trunks, noses, wings and fins, and marching towards paradise so it will not be forgotten. We are innocent. We have no baggage. We only ask you to jump into this quiet, serene paradise, created for all of us—for you, for me and everyone."

story:
Remotely Exceptional - A Playbook for Companies & Their Remote Workers

My name is Kelsey Yurek, and I am the author of Remotely Exceptional. I wrote this book because I began to see a disconnect in my own productivity and a mandated office space. I believe that there's a more fulfilling way for workers to get their work done and for companies to aid them in increasing their productivity. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how remote work can benefit you, whether you're an employer or an employee. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for working remotely in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you implement this source of freedom in your own life. 

In this book, you'll learn about remote work from both the employer and employee point of view:

  • How remote work can better serve employees and how you can pitch it to your employer
  • How remote work can be effectively implemented by employers
  • How remote work can ultimately lead to a better workplace

You will love this book if you are a potential remote worker—someone who might benefit from a flexible work schedule for personal or professional reasons. You may also benefit by reading if you're a potential employer—they want to learn more about how to implement this strategy effectively in their workspace for talent acquisition as well as employee retention and benefits. 

Remotely Exceptional is a non-fiction book that speaks to anyone who wants to change their current work situation and HR professionals who are looking at how they can implement better working arrangements for higher productivity. 

Remotely Exceptional is written in three parts...

Part 1 contains the introduction + 4 additional chapters. These chapters are aimed at remote workers, how they can make their work environments serve them and their productivity and how they can build a pitch to their employer. 

Part 2 contains Chapters 5-7. This section is for the employer who sees the benefit of implementing a remote work model for their employees but also wants to combat obstacles that may arise. It's all about building a remote work culture that works. 

Part 3 contains the final chapter. This section discusses how all of these above strategies come together (employer and employee) for a better workplace. 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2019
  • Cover design - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • Layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy and eBook formats)
  • The copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer
  • When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a special, acknowledgments section of my book (“with special thanks to”)
  • Early access to the 'Introduction' of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Kelsey Yurek is currently a senior at Georgetown University, majoring in Government, minoring in Women's and Gender Studies, and graduating in May 2019. During her undergraduate career, she's spent time as a New Student Orientation coordinator ensuring that 1,800 news students and their family members were oriented to the Hilltop. Her favorite semester at Georgetown was the semester she spent time abroad at King's College London. 

Kelsey wrote Remotely Exceptional as a way to explore post-grad options that kept her life open and exciting in the years before (and after) she goes back to law school. She hopes to work in women and children's advocacy while always saying 'yes' to the next opportunity. Outside of writing, Kelsey enjoys traveling, bartending, skiing, freelancing, and scuba diving. 

For more information, you can connect with Kelsey at ky164@georgetown.edu. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #RemotelyExceptional and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Kelsey Yurek

story:
Story of My Book

Party Pooper: Growing up with Anxiety is all about my own personal struggle with anxiety starting at the young age of four, and how I handled and learned to cope with it. 

My name is Grace Ehlers and I am the author of Party Pooper: Growing up with Anxiety. I wrote this book because I want people to see my own story, and see that if I was/am able to learn and grow from my hardest battle, anyone can. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what it is really like for someone to have such a long-lasting mental health battle. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for mental health in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you learn that all you really need in life is a little determination, a few laughs, and a whole lot of faith.

In this book, you'll learn about what anxiety can really look like from a young age to a young adult's perspective and how I, myself, learned to cope through different phases of my life including:

When I was in elementary school, I cried more days than not on my way to school, simply because I was always anxious. It didn’t help when in my second grade year I had a strict teacher, and I began to really struggle with some of her ways. I got in trouble for things like not eating all of my lunch and another time for saying “ew” during a lesson where raisins were compared to chocolate chips. I began to stress out more due to the fear of possibly getting in trouble over something minor, and my parents started to notice my stress getting worse. So, they switched me to a different teacher, and to put it “nicely”, I was outraged. I didn’t like change, and I was scared to start over with a new teacher. My parents told me if I could just get through one day with my new teacher then I might like her and may feel at least a little better about going to school. I cried on the way to school like always, but I was determined to get through the day. I ended up loving my new teacher. 

After I had begged for a baby sister for what felt like ages, I was eight when my parents announced to me and my two older siblings that we were going to adopt a child. I was almost nine when we were put on a waiting list for a baby girl from Ethiopia, Africa. I was nine when we decided to host a nine and a ten year old girl from Ukraine for three weeks in the summer. The three weeks flew by, and my heart was crushed at their departure. About a month later, I was told that we were only approved to adopt either the baby or the girls. A couple of months later, my family and I flew to Ukraine to finalize the adoption of the girls we had fallen in love with back in the summer. Our family would end up facing many struggles, and faith would teach us how to survive it all. 

When the time came for me to go to high school after being homeschooled for a few years, I freaked out. It was like one mental breakdown after the next. At one point during my eighth grade year, I refused to leave my room for three months. One mental breakdown in specific will always stand out. During one summer evening before my freshman year of high school, my parents were talking to my oldest sister in their room when I came flying in and threw myself on the floor. I was screaming at them, and telling them they absolutely could not send me to high school. Once I gained some composure, I was told to go and watch Frozen. I needed to be distracted from the overload of anxious thoughts about high school, and I needed something to make me laugh. If I’m laughing, I’m not crying. Olaf was my weakness, and I calmed down very quickly while watching the movie. I would watch Frozen many more times leading up to high school. 

You will love this book if you struggle with anxiety or worrying to any degree, or just want to learn more about people who struggle with their mental health.

Party Pooper: Growing up with Anxiety is a non-fiction book that speaks to those struggling and those that want to learn more about those who are struggling by looking at what anxiety can really look like from a young age to a young adult’s perspective and how I, myself, learned to cope through different phases of my life.

 

The Book - Party Pooper: Growing up with Anxiety

The book is written in 4 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + Chapters 1-5. These chapters are about my elementary school years. I discuss the very start of my anxiety which came about because of a nightmare I had of my older brother throwing up on me in the car. I also discuss the adoption of two of my sisters, as well as emphasize what my anxiety was like traveling to Ukraine. 

Part 2 contains Chapters 6-11. These chapters are about my middle school years. I discuss, not only my family deciding to adopt two more children from Ukraine, but also, my struggle with confidence and comparing myself to my sisters who are very close in age to me. I also discuss my huge downfall with anxiety in my eighth grade year. 

Part 3 contains Chapters 12-15. These chapters are about my high school years. I talk about the anxiety I faced when I switched from being homeschooled to attending a public high school, and how despite it all, I ended up loving it. I also discuss my high school relationship that ended up lasting the entirety of high school. 

Part 4 contains Chapter 16-19. These chapters are all about my life now. I discuss my breakup after dating the same guy for four years, and all that I was able to learn and take away from it. I discuss what my anxiety is like today, and whether or not, I still see myself as a party pooper or not. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer


When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

And more...

About the Author

Grace Ehlers is a full-time nanny that also enjoys blogging on the side, and attending church and bible study weekly. Her blog covers her day-to-day personal life, beliefs, mental health, Christianity, etc. She believes that by going to church and Bible study weekly, this helps her not only on a daily basis personally, but in understanding more about her faith to help teach and encourage others. 

I wrote this book in the hopes to encourage others by sharing my own story, and being as vulnerable as possible with my readers. One of my biggest passions in life is to encourage others, and make them feel like they have a place here on earth no matter what life throws at them. 

I am just a regular nineteen-year-old girl, who loves little kids and will laugh at just about everything. It’s the little things in life that always bring out my most joyful side. Just watch me drink some iced coffee, and hear the absolute craziness that flows from me due to my “caffeine high”. 

For more information you can connect with Grace at gracekehlers@gmail.com and Instagram @newkindofliving.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #PartyPooperGKE and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Grace Ehlers

story:
Our Story

Last year I found myself in an interesting position. Although a poet since 1987, I'd taken a 10-year break from creative writing to raise a family and pursue urban photography in my home city of Philadelphia. I had just begun to re-ignite my involvement in poetry when I was approached by one of the editors at Lucky Bat Books, who saw the value in combining my poems and photographs in a single book. The ebook, Far from Luck, was published in August, followed in October by the print edition. Despite single works being published in over 100 literary journals, this is my first full-length collection. A portion of all proceeds (20%) go to Project H.O.M.E. in Philadelphia, PA. Project H.O.M.E. is a nonprofit advocacy organization committed to ending homelessness.


The Impact

This campaign will allow me to have my book professionally marketed, using both traditional and online marketing. This will not only mean increased revenue for my family, but for Project H.O.M.E. as well. An additional goal is to improve society's view and treatment of homeless people, whose ranks have been enlarged by the Great Recession. 


What We Need & What You Get

I would like to hire a professional PR person to help me market, promote, and garner more professional reviews of my book, Far From Luck. The more I raise, the more promotion and marketing I can do. If I don't make my full goal, I will still be able to do a moderate amount of marketing. At this point I have no other funding sources (I wouldn't be here if I did). I plan on bringing out a second book in 2012, and by marketing my current book, my hope is to get my name out there as an author, poet, and photographer in order to garner more book sales, both for Far From Luck and my next book.


As I walk the streets of Philadelphia, I frequently meet and talk with the homeless. I've found that an easy way to help is to purchase gift cards to a pharmacy or restaurant chain and to hand them out to those in need. I've documented this in my photography project, Everyone Has a Name, which highlights that homelessness is not just a social issue, but a very personal issue. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in this project as much as I and my publisher and editor do, please, spread the word. Use social media, talk to friends, or use some of the share tools here at IndieGoGo. Everything is appreciated. Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

I have always served as an advocate for the underdog, but even more importantly I've always tried to find ways to help others make a better life for themselves. As the previous Executive Director of a local therapeutic horseback riding facility, I saw the power of the equine/human bond up close and know families who had lost all hope find progress and success. And by success I mean a child of six who never spoke asking her horse to "walk-on” Another young child with disabilities who was not able to walk without falling down now RUNNING without falling... and I have hundreds of other stories just like these. Most importantly, I believe in the power of therapeutic riding and know what a great opportunity a book on this topic would be to raise awareness and promote this type of therapy... to reach other families who have lost hope and desperately need to find something that will bring them respite as well as progress.

Need:

$6,000.00 is what I need to get this book done within the next 12 months. It will allow me to focus on the project, commit to the stories, and work with a publisher to get it on the shelves and into the hands of those for whom it will make a difference. 
 
This will be my salary for an entire year, but it's all I need to be able to conduct all the interivews for every story and get the entire project to my publisher by this time next year. I have identified 10 stories and will pick up more if necessary.
 
Anything over $6,000 will go for editing, photography, and book promotion. This project has the potential to change the lives of thousands throughout the country. I already have PATH, International willing to help promote the book to it's 800-center and 43,000-member constituency.
 
We will raise awareness in the communities that house therapeutic riding and will get information out to local clinics, doctors, physical therapists in order to ensure that folks in need will know of this option.
 
If the goal is not met, I will continue the project through completion regardless. All funds will go toward that end and every penny will help me to reach the end project as soon as possible.
 
Be a part of a project that will give a hand up, not a hand out! Your contributions WILL make a difference to those in need. If you believe in the power of the human/animal bond, this is the project to support!

What makes me think I can successfully do this?

Most importantly it's because I know how this works and I have seen the miracles it has produced, both in physical results as well as internal growth and change. I also know I can do this because I started writing over 20 years ago, have completed and published a graduate thesis, numerous academic articles, more than a dozen articles published online, a recent article published in Arts & Understanding, not to mention the hundreds of technical writing projects and grants funded.

The Impact

Huge.

The key factor that keeps folks in need from this kind of treatment is that they simply do NOT know it exists. This book will compile the story of 10 - 20 riders who now have hope... who now know what successful treatment is all about... who faced their fears and now know what courage can bring to their lives. These are stories are about children who speak their first words on a horse, adults who are able to go back to work because they now have the core strength to sit up all day, and teenagers who learn to control their anger and have now developed healthy coping mechanisms. All of these stories are about how therapeutic horseback riding changed their lives for the better. This book has the power to potentially help thousands of people in need connect to a therapy that will improve their lives and the communities in which they live.

There is no amount of money better spent that working to help people help themselves.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word about this campaign!!!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
**PLEASE NOTE: Unlike a "Kickstarter" campaign, all the funds will go to Sabrina / The Lupus Foundation of America even if the stated goal is not met.**

A Bit About The Book:

It started on Twitter, when the many of us who have been recipients of Sabrina's support over time found out she needed jaw surgery that her insurance company wasn't willing to pay for. Because a great number of her friends are authors who are--pretty much by definition--short on cash but long on imagination, when we got to trying to figure out what we could do to help all we could come up with was to write something.
 
The anthology will include stories by:
  • Ellie Anderson
  • Laura Benedict
  • Stephen Blackmoore
  • Joelle Charbonneau
  • Laura K. Curtis
  • Hilary Davidson
  • Neliza Drew
  • Chad Eagleton
  • Jenny Gardiner
  • Daryl Wood Gerber
  • Kent Gowran
  • Chris F. Holm
  • Dan O'Shea
  • Ron Earl Phillips
  • Thomas Pluck
  • Chad Rohrbacher
  • Linda Rodriguez
  • Johnny Shaw
  • Josh Stallings
  • Clare Toohey
  • Steve Weddle
  • Chuck Wendig
  • Holly West

What We Need & What You Get

Sabrina needs surgery--that's where your money goes. None of the authors in this anthology are getting paid for their stories. All proceeds are going directly to the cost of the surgery. We don't expect to raise more than we need, but if we do, the extra will go to The Lupus Foundation of America (www.lupus.org).

If you buy one of the print copies, part of the money will go to printing the book. The shipping is currently being donated.

If you buy one of the signed copies, you will have our MOST PROFOUND THANKS and part of your money will go toward shipping the books around so the authors can sign them.

If we do not raise enough money this way, we may put the anthology up for sale as an ebook, but it will be considerably more expensive at that point, so getting it now will be both quicker and cheaper!

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can’t contribute financially, that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • Please let others know about us! Twitter, facebook, blogs, we want to get the word out!
  • Invite any of the authors to blog on your site about the project. We're all blabbermouths!

story:
Android Phones - watch video on YouTube here

 

It’s been nearly three years since we first found out our daughter is really our son. But it was years before that when a suicide attempt introduced us to a world of struggles, with innumerable sleepless nights, endless fears and lots of tears. Our child did not wake up one morning and profess that he was a boy, not a girl. Rather, he endured depression, anxiety, bullying, and torment before he could put words to his inner struggle and understood that his gender identity was the source of his pain.

We confided in few people at first, then slowly surrendered our insecurities to instead arm ourselves with knowledge. The decision to embrace, rather than reject, our path transformed our lives. We supported our teenage son’s transition from female to male. Over the years, our family has transitioned along with him.

Many transgender people and their families went before us sharing their stories and helped us understand what it means to be transgender. Through their courage and insight, we learned how to best support our son and help save his life. Now, we want to give back and share our story.

We're Terri and Vince Cook from Central NY. Our memoir is written, and has been professionally edited. It will be published this summer. We have invested almost $10,000 and over 1,200 hours directly on the book. But we have a big plan and need your help. We want to raise at least $5,000 to finish publishing and promote the book. So, we're reaching out to our strongest supporters to ask for contributions. In exchange, we're offering to include you in our journey to raise awareness. Your contribution will get you a copy of our book and help us share our story.

Our son's struggle to understand, accept, and simply be who he is nearly cost him his life.  He had a family that loved and supported him, and yet it has been (and continues to be) a difficult journey.  Many of the fears and difficulties of being transgender (or having a transgender loved one) are compounded by the lack of awareness and acceptance in our society.  For this reason, we've decided to share our story ... with the hope of increasing awareness and bringing about change. We have come to understand that most people (including us at one time) have no idea what it means to be transgender or the challenges faced by transgender individuals.

This book is more than just a mile walk in our shoes because our son is transgender. It’s a story about how a young, middle-class family discovered how much they didn’t know. Our ignorance translated into fear, desperation, and pain. With a lot of help from others we learned the truth. We think everyone will benefit from the allies and angels in our life.

The poet Maya Angelou says, “When you know better, you do better.”

We hope that our story, and all of our efforts to publicize it, will help people to know better. We do believe in humanity, and we have no doubt that people will do better when they know better—regarding transgender people and all other marginalized populations.

"Allies and Angels has an urgent message, but it does not tell you what to think—instead it shows, through the powerful, heart-wrenching narrative of a loving family, what a difference individuals can make in the lives of transgender youth.  I hope it becomes the go-to book for the parents of such kids, and that it inspires the same kind of compassion and respect shown by Drew’s family. It should be required reading for all who work with children and young adults of any gender. I’m a little older than Drew, but also grew up in the suburbs of Syracuse, New York and also came out as transgender in my teens. I faced many of the same issues, from big things like bullying and suicidal depression to so-called little things like the pain of school dances and old family photos. Although few struggles compare to being a young man in a female body, there still is little guidance available for these boys or their loved ones.  I wish such a book had existed for me and my parents during those difficult years and I hope this helps such families realize they aren’t alone. It will definitely improve, and most likely save, many young people’s lives."
—Elliott DeLine, Author of Refuse
and I Know Very Well How I Got My Name

 

"As someone who came out only six months ago at the age of 22, and whose parents are in the early stages of understanding and acceptance, this book was very emotional for me.   The Cook family’s story is so inspiring and heartfelt.  Thank you for making yourself vulnerable and writing this story so that others may find hope and come to better understand the experiences of trans* people and their families.  I can only imagine what my life would be like now had I had the strength, courage, and support that Drew had, in particular from his family and the Q Center, to come out at a younger age.  A great book for anyone to read – whether you’re trans*, you have family or friends that are, or you just want to learn a little bit more."
—Al Forbes, Syracuse University graduate student

 

“Live authentically.” “Find your passion.” “We are all connected.” These are familiar concepts to those of us in the self-help, life coach, and spirituality realm.  I’ve read a lot about these ideas, but it’s a whole other experience to watch the Cook family live them every day.  Now with their new book, Allies and Angels, others can benefit from their enduring story of love and acceptance.  This book is a real life example of how living authentically, finding your passion, and realizing that we are all connected can bring more love, joy and compassion into your life.  The knowledge and understanding gained by reading this book will make you an angel in someone else’s life.  In my mind, there is no greater gift that you could give yourself and the human experience.
—Gloria Ierardi, Life Coach

If you can contribute financially, it is most appreciated. However, our hope is that you will also help share our story. It is just as appreciated when you tell others about our story or recommend our Free eBook Campaign (see below). We’re trying to create awareness and compassion. Here are a few specific ways to help:

  1. Contribute now and when you get our book, read it and share it. Help raise awareness in your circle of influence.
  2. Share* this campaign and our story with your family and friends regardless of whether they know someone who is LGBT. Just telling somebody helps to spread awareness of the issue.
  3. Share* our Free eBook Campaign with your guidance counselor, social worker, therapist, or LGBT organization. We really want to get our book into the hands of people who touch many lives, and we’re willing to give it away to do so. Encourage these people to contact us now, so that we can help them help others. See our Free eBook Campaign for more information.
  4. Share* this campaign and our story with the human resources department where you work. We have a whole chapter on the precious ways our employer made a huge difference, helping us save our son’s life.

* Share by telling or emailing people you know. You can share via Facebook (or other social media) or simply provide a link to this page or our website. Here are the links …

  • Indiegogo Campaign (http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/allies-angels-memoir)
  • Allies  & Angels Book (http://alliesandangels.com)
  • Allies  & Angels Free eBook Campaign  (http://alliesandangels.com/free-book)

For those that don’t know what Indiegogo is … it’s a means to fund projects by reaching out to the public, called crowdfunding.

Our project seeks funds to pay for publishing and publicizing our book, Allies & Angels. In return for your contribution, you have our sincere appreciation and you can choose from a list of perks. The perks vary from an eBook copy to a signed hardbound copy and beyond.

For Everybody

We were so inspired by the song How to Live that we included it in our video and our book. You visited our campaign and heard our pitch. So, we want you to have this complimentary copy of How to Live.

$10 Gimme an eBook

Get an eBook (pdf, epub, or Kindle) copy of Allies & Angels and a free download of the song, How to Live.

$20 Gimme a Paperback

Get a copy of Allies & Angels paperback including shipping in the US, and the song, How to Live.

$35 Count Me In

Get a signed copy of Allies & Angels paperback including shipping in the US, and the song, How to Live.

$45 Count Me In

Get a signed copy of Allies & Angels hardcover including shipping in the US, and the song, How to Live.

$150 Show My Support

For any contribution of $150 or more, we will acknowledge you in our book—anonymously if you choose. Also get a signed copy of Allies & Angels hardcover including shipping in the US, and the song, How to Live.

$1200 Please Come Talk

Terri will speak at your event anywhere within the US. Presentation can be tailored to your audience and needs. You will receive 10 copies of the book, which you can sell, raffle or give away. Receive group discounts for additional book purchases.

 

The Q Center is the LGBTQ youth center that helped save our son's life. We love the Q Center and are proud to support it. A dollar or more from every book sold will be donated to the Q Center.

story:
Who am I?

My name is Tomeka M. Winborne. I am an author and filmmaker. My first novel entitled, Where My Strength Comes From, was published in 2005. In between working on my first book and sophomore novel, I Love Him But… I began self-studying the art of filmmaking. I later realized that I love creating but more importantly I love the art of storytelling.

Outside of the arts, I sell real estate. I also love volunteering in the community. I am very vocal about equality and justice for all people. Although, I think our political system is broken I still believe that we should all exercise our right to vote because that is our voice. However, I’ve decided instead of continuing to have useless debates; I will use my creative juices to voice my opinions through my art forms going forward.

I am passionate about many things but most important to me is showcasing women in a positive light. I often pray that if my work helps one person then I know its worth all the sacrifices that I’ve endured as an artist.

What's it about?

I LOVE HIM, BUT… is a dramatic novel that delves into the personal life of the main character, Cynthia Davis, who is by all standards a happy wife and a doting mother of a set of twin boys and a daughter. As the children are getting older and begin investing in their own lives, she realizes that much of her value was in them. This realization embarks her on journey to discover herself. Although her husband Tony is an amazing man, during a tragedy in Cynthia’s life his business caused him not to be there to support her. While navigating through and around her emotions, she reconnects with an easygoing acquaintance that offers support that lightens the weight of a heavy situation. Cynthia bonds with two of her childhood friends as they initially covet the others marriages although each has a different conclusion to the sentence I LOVE HIM, BUT... The ladies share support as they each travel down a rocky road to find happiness and love again. Cynthia finally reaches the point of balance and peace in her life, but not before all hell breaks loose.

How's the book coming along?

The book is complete! I’ve finished several rewrites and I’m definitely pleased with the outcome! Next, my editor and friend, Sarita Scott, had me go through another round of rewrites after her notes. We were both pleased with the final outcome of this novel. This is has been a long journey but it is important to me that if you liked Where My Strength Comes From, that you would love I Love Him, But…

More importantly if I Love Him, But… is your introduction to my work, I want it to be a great read for you.

What are you trying to do?

After several financial setbacks, I was advised to try Indiegogo. Writing a book similar to birthing a baby without the physical pains. Surely, this process takes you through an emotional journey. However, I’m extremely excited about sharing this book with the world. Although I’m excited about the advances in technology (because when I published Where My Strength Comes From e-books weren’t an option, I still love holding books in my hands. Therefore, I want to offer I Love Him, But… in print and digitally.

My editor and cover designer worked on my book on credit because they believed in me as an author and my work. So additionally to raising money to have books printed, I want to pay them for their services. There are a few other vendors that I will need to get this book published. So below I will list what the money is going towards:

1.  Printing - I’ve narrowed my choices down to two printers but I will make that final choice once I raise the money. The book will be perfect bound paperback (dimensions) and off white paper.

2.  The cover art is by Leah Ponds!

3. Typesetting by Dan Robinson

4. ISBN#'s and Barcodes

Who am I?
My name is Tomeka M. Winborne. I am an author
and filmmaker. My first novel entitled, Where My Strength Comes From, was
published in 2005. In between working on my first book and sophomore novel, I
Love Him But… I began self-studying the art of filmmaking. I later realized
that I love creating but more importantly I love the art of storytelling. 
Outside of the arts, I sell real estate. I also
love volunteering in the community. I am very vocal about equality and justice
for all people. Although, I think our political system is broken I still
believe that we should all exercise our right to vote because that is our
voice. However, I’ve decided instead of continuing to have useless debates; I
will use my creative juices to voice my opinions through my art forms going
forward. 
I am passionate about many things but most
important to me is showcasing women in a positive light. I often pray that if
my work helps one person then I know its worth all the sacrifices that I’ve
endured as an artist. 
What's it about?
I LOVE HIM, BUT… is a dramatic novel that delves into
 the personal life of the main character, Cynthia Davis, who is by all 
standards a happy wife and a doting mother of a set of twin boys and a 
daughter. As the children are getting older and begin investing in their
 own lives, she realizes that much of her value was in them. This 
realization embarks her on journey to discover herself.  Although her 
husband Tony is an amazing man, during a tragedy in Cynthia’s life his 
business caused him not to be there to support her. While navigating 
through and around her emotions, she reconnects with an easygoing 
acquaintance that offers support that lightens the weight of a heavy 
situation. Cynthia bonds with two of her childhood friends as they 
initially covet the others marriages although each has a different 
conclusion to the sentence I LOVE HIM, BUT...  The ladies share support as
 they each travel down a rocky road to find happiness and love again. 
Cynthia finally reaches the point of balance and peace in her life, but 
not before all hell breaks loose.
How's the book coming along?
The book is complete! I’ve finished several rewrites
and I’m definitely pleased with the outcome! Next, my editor and friend, Sarita
Scott, had me go through another round of rewrites after her notes. We were
both pleased with the final outcome of this novel. This is has been a long
journey but it is important to me that if you liked Where My Strength Comes
From, that you would love I Love Him, But…
More importantly if I Love Him, But… is
your introduction to my work, I want it to be a great read for you. 
What are you trying to do?
After several financial setbacks, I was advised
to try Indiegogo. Writing a book similar to birthing a baby without the
physical pains. Surely, this process takes you through an emotional journey.
However, I’m extremely excited about sharing this book with the world. Although
I’m excited about the advances in technology (because when I published Where
My Strength Comes From e-books weren’t an option, I still love holding
books in my hands. Therefore, I want to offer I Love Him, But… in print
and digitally. 
My editor and cover designer worked on my book on credit because
they believed in me as an author and my work. So additionally to raising money
to have books printed, I want to pay them for their services. There are a few
other vendors that I will need to get this book published. So below I will list
what the money is going towards:
1.  Printing - I’ve narrowed my choices down to two
printers but I will make that final choice once I raise the money. The book
will be perfect bound paperback (dimensions) and off white paper.
2.  The cover art is by Leah Ponds!

story:
I'm turning to you because I need your help to complete the project I'm working on, documenting the hardships that African people face in the State of Israel, and compiling them into a full-length book. I've been reporting on this topic for the last three and a half years, probably more than anyone else in the country. But no one has yet published a full-length book about this issue. Publishers are hesitant to fund a book like this, partly because so many books have already been written about Israel and Palestine. But not about this issue, which is almost unknown outside of Israel. And that is scandalous! Because it is a shocking story.


According to its own national narrative, Israel was founded to provide a safe refuge to people fleeing political persecution and ethnic cleansing. And yet, when political persecution and ethnic cleansing force millions of Africans to leave their home countries, countries with much poorer populations take in huge numbers of refugees, but Israel refuses to allow almost any to stay in the country. For those who have managed to make it into the country, the government won't let them work, incites racism against them, criminalizes them, jails them, and expels them back to the horrors they fled from.


For decades, Israeli governments have claimed that the country is a democracy, that it doesn't discriminate on the basis of race or religion, and that there is no peace with the Palestinians because of decades of bad blood between the two peoples. But there is no history of conflict, no bad blood between Jews and sub-Saharan Africans. The government doesn't want any African refugees in the country partly because they're poor, partly because they're not white, but mainly, because they're not Jews.


Is that a legitimate reason for a country to refuse to open its gates to asylum-seekers? Because the people applying for asylum are not of the same ethnicity or the same religion as the majority of the country's citizens? If it is, then all of the Christian-majority countries of the world that refused to permit entry to Jews fleeing the Holocaust 75 years ago were well within their rights. When Israel rounds up and deports African refugees, it makes a mockery of the millions of Jews who died during World War II because no one would grant them shelter.


This story has huge implications for the Israeli-Palestinian conflict. Because if Israeli policy is not based on equal treatment regardless of ethnicity, but on ensuring that as few as possible non-Jewish people remain in the country, then that would go a long way towards explaining Israel's actions vis-a-vis the Palestinians for the last 66 years. Perhaps the source of the conflict isn't Arab anti-Semitism, or even competing land claims, but as distasteful as it sounds, a drive by Israeli political and religious leaders for racial and religious purity.


The American media tends to report news narratives that conform with American foreign policy. Because the American government is such a staunch advocate of the Israeli government, the American media has all but ignored Israel's treatment of African refugees. And yet, if any of the government measures and grassroots attacks on African refugees that I have been reporting on had occurred in the United States, they would surely have rocketed to the top of the news cycle. Book-length coverage of the issue could force the media to grapple with the topic.


I'm calling upon you to support me, which will allow me to focus my efforts on this project and produce a professional document that will catalogue the abuses that African refugees are being subjected to on a daily basis in Israel. Because only by shining a light on these shameful stories can we hope to have a conversation about how to improve the situation. Ultimately, I live here, and I want to live in a country in which the majority treats the minority as if it would want to be treated if it was the minority.

story:
Let's create a series with frightful crimes solved by wisdom vs. muscle, age vs. brawn

I'm at the leading edge of the Baby Boomers, the greatest population explosion of our time. As a whole, we are an enormous group who still loves to read.

This should be a prime target for writers. Yet, I find it difficult to locate books with compelling protagonists who are older but capable.  In fact, no segment of the population is more falsely represented in ads, the arts, and the media than senior citizens. We're either portrayed as too cute, too feeble, or too active (seriously,  climbing rock walls is not our goal regardless of what those prescription med ads tell you). That image needs to change. Let's work on it together.

How I'm doing my part to change that image

  • First, I wrote a book entitled Fun House Chronicles (available on Kindle) which began the story of seniors compelled to enter a nursing home. The book deals with the hard truths of loss, illness and institutionalization, but the characters kick administrative butt, triumph over physical woes and find new ways to conquer life.
  • Now these characters are back in the Bear Jacobs series of mysteries. Retired P.I. Bear - plus his eWatsons Lily, Eunice and Charlie - live in adult care and spend their time solving crimes that slip beneath the notice of law enforcement. 
  • In Bear in Mind, the first of the PI Bear Jacobs series, the group investigates the case of Charlie’s missing wife. At first they think she’s a heart breaking bitch who abandons her hubby. But Bear learns that women in the community are disappearing at an alarming rate … and to no place good. Is a madman attacking older women, a la the Boston Strangler? Is a local crematory burning up the evidence? It’s a dangerous and twisted trail that Bear follows toward a surprising conclusion.

What I request from you

The funds I request will allow me to complete and market the first three books in the Bear Jacob series:

  •  Bear in Mind is brand new and online now as an Amazon Kindle Select book. I have put myself on the financial line to fund its release as best I can. It is not enough.
  • Hard to Bear is half done and Bear at Sea is in synopsis form.
  • Your financial support is for the cover art and file conversions necessary to sell the books online. 
  • It is also for marketing the novels via social media and ebook promotions.
  • And if financial support is out of the question, I will certainly value your efforts to get the word out through your own social connections.

Providing this series in paperback will be another project if sales of the ebooks live up to that potential.

Why Linda B. Myers, you ask

Others could do this series, sure. But I'm the one you've got, and my credentials are top notch:

  • I've already mentioned that I'm older than the average writer. And I write what I know. 
  • Both my parents and my husband passed away in adult care facilities. I know a whole lot about the trials and triumphs of staff, caregivers and residents. I spent years observing it in action. That knowledge makes these books work.
  • I spent my whole career in marketing before writing novels; I know how to sell. 
  • I have had two books traditionally published (one of them in Turkish which is a whole other story). And I have self-published two more.
  • My reviews have been all 4 or 5 star.
  • If  you would like to read samples, my website is www.lindabmyers.com There you will find blog posts and excerpts from all my books. I suggest you take a look to know if your partner in this venture lives up to your standards.
  • www.facebook.com/LindaBMyers and www.twitter.com/lindabmyers are other locations to find me building an audience for my books. "Like" and "subscribe" and "follow" to help the potential audience for our investment to grow.

Risky Business

Writers fail more than they succeed as business people. I could, too. But I've never lost anybody's money yet (other than my own from a few wild hunches).

Know I will treat your investment with the respect such a gesture deserves. I will write about a society of seniors who may have lost a step physically but whose brains are sharp as bear claws. You will be proud of what your money has made possible.

story:
About our Book

Contemporary Vermont Fiction: An Anthology is a 240-page collection of short fiction by established Vermont-based writers, each rendering their own unique and diverse perspectives on the cultural and physical landscape of the Green Mountain State.

Featuring a foreword by John Elder and stories by Howard Frank Mosher, Annie Proulx, Wallace Stegner, Megan Mayhew Bergman, Castle Freeman, Jr., Laurie Alberts, Ellen Lesser, Joseph Bruchac, Jeffrey Lent, Suzanne Kingsbury, Miciah Bay Gault, Robin MacArthur, Bill Schubart, Peter Gould and an original story written for the book by Julia Alvarez, this book will be released in early November of this year by Green Writers Press.


Why We Are Reaching Out to You

Thanks to the immense generosity and support of our contributors (and their publishers), we have been able to get this far without accruing many expenses. For us at Green Writers Press, this has been a labor of love; we have not paid ourselves a cent for our time editing, designing or promoting this book. But a book does cost money to put on the shelf; though most of our authors generously donated their work, we do have licensing fees to pay, as well as printing and publicity costs. As our publishing date approaches, we are now seeking funds to support those needs. Half of the $3000 we are asking for will support our printing and licensing costs; the other half will support our publicity campaign and Vermont book tour. The $3000 will by no means cover all of our expenses, but it will help us along the way!

Why We Think This Matters

Call us dreamers, but we consider this collection not just an ode to a specific place, but a book about how places shape and are shaped by the people who inhabit them, how writers interpret places differently, and about the power of fiction itself: how stories are a means of engendering empathy, illuminating interconnection, prompting new ways of imagining and living, and by doing all of these, help birth cultures of conservation.

Be you a Vermont resident, a visitor to our state, someone who has always dreamed of living here, or someone merely fond of place-based literary fiction, we believe you will find this collection compelling, engaging and illuminating. (And need we mention, again, the names of all those amazing writers?!)


What We Need & What You Get

Again, we are hoping to raise $3000 to help cover our printing and licensing costs and support our widespread publicity campaign.

By supporting this project via this fundraising campaign you will:

  • Provide us with the needed upfront funding to get these books on the shelf!
  • Receive your own hot-off-the-press copy of Contemporary Vermont Fiction
  • Give a higher percentage of your dollars directly to Green Writers Press
  • Support 350.org and the other environmental campaigns that Green Writers Press Supports
  • Support an independent press with an environmental mission (www.greenwriterspress.com)
  • Help foster Vermont's literary community, literary history and literary vitality
  • Help promote the work of the authors included in this book
  • Receive other perks, depending on how much you are able to give (see "Perks" for details).                                                

A Little More About Us 

Green Writers Press is a new Vermont-based, global publisher whose mission is to spread a message of environmental activism through the words and images we publish.  Printing on demand (POD) in the US and using only FSC-certified paper, we are committed to preserving and protecting the natural resources of the earth and, to that end, donate a percentage of our proceeds  350.org and other environmental organizations. 

Robin MacArthur, the editor of Contemporary Vermont Fiction, is a third-generation Vermonter from Marlboro who has been studying Vermont-based fiction (and writing her own) since she left for college at eighteen. She has an MFA in Fiction from Vermont College of Fine Arts; her essays and stories about Vermont have appeared in Orion, Shenandoah, Hunger Mountain and Alaska Quarterly.

You can read more about Green Writers Press at www.greenwriterspress.com


    Feeling Broke, But Still Want to Help? 

    Believe us, we understand. And yes, there are still ways you can help!

    • Ask your local libraries to order copies
    • Share this campaign with your friends via word-of-mouth or social media (see easy links below)
    • Check a copy of the book out of the library when it arrives, and enjoy!

Green Writers Press is a new Vermont-based, global publisher whose mission is to spread a message of environmental activism through the words and images we publish.  Printing on demand (POD) in the US and using only FSC-certified paper, we are committed to preserving and protecting the natural resources of the earth and, to that end, donate a percentage of our proceeds  350.org and other environmental organizations. 

 Robin MacArthur, the editor of Contemporary Vermont Fiction, is a third-generation Vermonter from Marlboro who has been studying Vermont-based fiction (and writing her own) since she left for college at eighteen. She has an MFA in Fiction from Vermont College of Fine Arts; her essays and stories about Vermont have appeared in Orion, Shenandoah, Hunger Mountain and Alaska Quarterly.
You can read more about Green Writers Press at www.greenwriterspress.com

  Feeling Broke, But Still Want to Help?  Believe us, we understand. And yes, there are still ways you can help! 
Ask your local libraries to order copies
Share this campaign with your friends via word-of-mouth or social media (see easy links below) Check a copy of the book out of the library when it arrives, and enjoy!

story:
The most import think about a book is its cover.

People always say don't judge a book by its cover. With everything else in life we try to hold onto that mantle except when it comes to actually judging a book, and then we always judge a book by its cover.
This year I will be entering NaNoWriMo for the third time. I have two 'wins' under my belt and hope to do the same again this year. 
The hardest part in writing a book, for me, is the cover design. I just can't do it and therefore I need some help.
That's when I came up with the idea of asking for £1. If 500 people gave me £1 each I could get the cover of my dreams.
Wouldn't you like to make an author's dreams come true just for £1?

story:
Who is the author?

Suresh Rao (alias KrsnaKnows) is a Spiritual Master who teaches about Self-discovery and the Supreme Divine Consciousness. We are a group of his students from all around the world, all from different walks of life, who have decided to come together to publish his teachings on the Spiritual in this book called 'The Flute of Truth'. 

We want to share his teachings with a greater audience and this book is the ideal way to do so. 

What is the Book about?

Who are you? What are you here for? What is the reason for your birth? What is the meaning of life? All these questions and many more have dogged ever human being from time immemorial. This book gives answers to these questions which trouble you.

From learning how to get by in the material world and get past all the trials and tribulations that come along with being worldly, to learning how to recognise your Helmsman (Spiritual Teacher) who will steer you across the Oceans of worldly life and take you to the shore of knowing your True Self and attaining every lasting bliss - his teachings constitute profound esoteric knowledge. 

He teaches of fulfilling the purpose of this singular human birth through self-effort and discipline of the mind, body and soul.

Page length: 302 pages

Size: 6” x 9”(Standard)

Book status: Ready for publishing

An excerpt

Why, God, Why? When was it that your questions got some answers? Too many unanswered questions! How many of you face failures every single day? You guess almost all. Yet, you all hope and pray that you will get it right. But destiny always ditches you at the last minute. God, if there is one, you say, always plays hokey with you. Never allowing you to win ever.
So then where is the question of belief in the invisible? Someone you haven’t seen or heard at all? Why do you need to give so much of importance to that someone or something when things don’t go right? It is beyond logical thinking, why people have so much of dependency over this unknown one?
You can see your parents, so you depend on them for any help during childhood. As you grow up, your teacher or friends work alongside. Later, your spouse is the prop and colleagues. The bosses and workplace mentors help you. For other assistances you seek for professional guidance. Your health or wealth is monitored by the various professionals. Old age by superannuation benefits and old age homes. Your health by the doctors and medical care workers. Your funeral by funeral homes and directors.
All this is easily made available if you can provide for that. Money becomes the oil in the smooth running machinery. The oil lubricates your pathway to progress. So tell me where does god enter..?

Our Chapter Titles

This section gives you a glimpse of the flow of the book through the Chapter Titles. Each section contains a series of anecdotes and teachings relevant to the main title. 

Chapter 1: Notes on Spirituality

Chapter 2: Notes on the Guru or Master

Chapter 3: Notes on the Journey in Spiritual

Chapter 4: Notes on Karma and Destiny

Chapter 5: Notes on Knowledge (the Divine and Material World) Part 1

Chapter 6: Notes on Knowledge (the Divine and Material World) Part 2

Chapter 7: Notes on Faith, Love and Devotion

Chapter 8: Notes on Saints, Sages and Mythology

Chapter 9: Notes on the Mind and Body

So why crowd funding?

We began funding this book but have managed to hit a road-block. This funding intends to supplement the shortages.

Whether you wish to contribute $10 or $100, we will be grateful for any contribution that you give to us so we can bring these wonderful teachings into the world! 

Our Motivation:

We wish to share this with the world and know that his teachings will bring both joy and peace to those who have the experience of reading and hearing it! Please do help us get this book published as it will help encourage more of the author's works to be published. 

Our Plan for the Funds Raised:

We thank you for reading this far into the post and for all the support you have given to us! Below we have given an exact break up of where the money that you contribute will go and what you will receive for all the contributions you make.

Costs of Self-Publishing: $3000

Marketing: $1700

US Copyright and LCCN Registration: $300

Total: $5000 (USD)

We need the total of $5000 in order to be able to get the books in all reputable stores. If we are unable to meet the target we will have to find another way to fund-raise for it and will utilize whatever little we get to set the ball rolling. If we over-exceed the target then the money will go into publishing more books and arranging for more book launches all over the world.

A Thank You for your contributions:

And no matter how big or how small your contribution whether it is $10 or $100 we will be extremely grateful for all your support in helping us make this project a success and dream-come true.

P.S. Don't forget to share this with all the people that you know! We really do need all the help we can get! Thank you, once again!
