story:
I will publish, when this project is completed. I wish to have a polished book. It will happen with your help.

                                           Lovers Lies and Lilies

     “Calvin isn’t breathing.” Sarah cried into the telephone, “I think I may have killed him. I…”

     Carol stopped her, “First. If he is dead; I am not sorry. Second. I will not miss his abusive, worthless ass. Third. You did not cause his death. You did not have control of the situation. You were not responsible. So get a grip on reality and be calm. It is not your fault. I’m going to call for help and then come over. If anyone comes to your house, except medical help, keep them outside until I get there to take care of everything. It will not be very long. I have to locate Jack and tell him what has happened and where I’m going to be. Settle down. Just stay calm and I will see you in a few minutes.”

     Sarah's life changed from the control she had endured while married. Freedom to act as she wanted, dress as she wanted, go where she wanted, even laugh when she wanted. It moved from trying to hide and stop anger and jealousy directed at her in violence, to the simple act of choosing a brightly colored dress and applying make-up to shop at the grocery for food. Returning home without fear of another outburst of cruelty. 

     Meeting Jon Bartleaux brings sexual awakening on a scale she had not experienced while she was with Calvin. Exciting, viberant, tingling, rewarding, unknown sex. Not the sex that gave gratification to only Calvin in a puritanical, repetitive single act, but imaginative, creative and enjoyable. Different in each act and experience.

     Her sheltered life of physical and mental abuse ended with the passing of her abusive husband. She finds previously unknown personal freedom and sexual experiences with Jon, a wealthy businessman. He gives her freedom to act herself and expand her horizons. His medical advice affords her the capability to help a friend and her children gain freedom from abuse and the threat of contracted murder.

     Sarah's relationship with Jon ends with his death and her life is changed when his wealth becomes hers. Love comes again with Richard Taylor and her sexual education continues to evolve. Her plan to free Twyla is accomplished and she accepts a new challenge, to relieve the suffering and danger in another woman's life.

                                                      Reviews            

Review by: Donna Kattner on May 26, 2014 : (no rating) 
This was a fast moving book from the start. Many can relate to the topics covered. The book was very erotic and sexually stimulating. The author left the ending as one where the reader wanted to see what happens next.
(reviewed within a month of purchase)

brilliant book, great transaction, ready to view immediately, easy to download to kindle. 
book: from the beginning didn't want to put the book down, brilliant start to book and throughout :) very happy
cant wait to read the next one by Ronald good author x
(reviewed the day of purchase)

Review by: Teresa Preston on April 21, 2014 : (no rating) 
This is a great book. It grabs your attention from the very beginning. The storyline is one that everyone can relate to. The abuse of a wife by her husband is spell binding. I cannot put it down. I am spell bound cannot weight to see the ending.
(reviewed the day of purchase)

Review by: Leo Janowick on April 18, 2014 :  
Love the book, kept my interest, this Author is one to watch, look out Dan Brown, and Tom Clancy, you have competition coming your way. Ron, Plz keep up the good work, and I'm waiting for your new one. Best to you
(reviewed the day of purchase)

Review by: tandygraves on April 06, 2014 : (no rating) 
Loved this story. I can not describe the anticipation I have for the next novel titled Summer Help wanted. When will Lovers be out in paperback.. I will buy it and keep it on the nightstand.. Thank you for working so hard to entertain us

                                          *******
     My dear, sweet mother is gone from me and I miss her every day.

 Her life was not what it could have been if she had been born into a family with even a small degree of privilege and her husband had been nurturing, but she had a world of humor and lived every day to the best of her ability. She was a proud person and resisted, even refused help.

     Dad is gone and I miss him for a totally different reason. He was an abuser, a controller, a belittling, accusatory person,  using mental and physical abuse to dominate. Sometime small, almost imperceptible, almost harmless and progressed to beating and breaking.

     Lovers Lies and Lilies is a story of fiction about two men like him and the just rewards for each of them. One by accident and one by cunning, design and chemistry which one woman caused. It chronicles her life in a rebirth. I wish Mother had been reborn and helped as Sarah was.

      Even if you personally weren't the victim of abuse, you probably know someone who has been.  My books are meant to inspire and educate and hopefully make a difference in a world filled with abuse.
                                                              ********
     Lovers, Lies and Lilies is a completed manuscript, that needs a little help to reach readers. I believe everyone deserves a professionally packaged book and that means paying for editing, cover designing, publishing tools like ISBNs, formatting.
     I will have Lovers edited and proof read and formated to the three book requirements. The cover will be done as required in the two formats both Paperback and Hard cover. Plus ISBN purchases and Hard cover set up.
     It will be published in several self publishing styles. Particularly Createspace and Lighteningsource and others.
                                                           ********
     I have three novels finished and I will publish another book titled Summer Help Wanted after Lovers. Summer Help is based on my experiences in my youth (with license) It is a work of fiction also.
     As I am retired and funds are limited as my time remaining is limited. To see my work enjoyed by others was not my goal when I started writing. It was more a means to have a release from those old memories.
         Lovers Lies and Lilies is an inspiring and entertaining novel. So I have been told. My editor wants to see it in print and that is a very personal endorsment for me.
      Your help will give me the means to do that and you will have a valuable return when each of my books are available. 
     Lovers Lies and Lilies will be out this summer followed shortly by Summer Help Wanted and Jewella Crossing. 
    My goal in writing is to not be one dimensional and have a book everyone can enjoy.
    You can help even if it is not by donating money... Tell others and share. That is the purpose of my books. Sharing

Look at my website ronaldwalkerauthor.com for coming books

story:
I am NiAmbi` Agent, a Fall 2014 graduate from Arizona State University. I received my Bachelor of Arts degree in Communication, Technology and Society and I am Media Relations Officer for National Association of Black Journalists, a member of the NAACP and the Alliance for Women in Media. I have a passion for writing and encouraging our youth. I have written a children's book, Gentle Waters and it's something I would like to share with our young people. I knew I could and would write when I was 8-years-old and when I wrote a short story, the class was interested about the characters and the ending of my story.  I still remember how some of the kids were asking questions about it.  Throughout high school, I excelled in English with my writing abilities and I decided that I would write a book for children. The book will be self-published by The Melody is Heard Publishing, illustrations by artist Kris Rhymes and book cover will be designed by Ozone Graphics. Gentle Waters is an amazing story and when reading the 22-page book, the children will embrace the illustrations and remember the names of the characters while feeling peaceful, happy and soothed... something like the flow of gentle waters.

I am asking for a small contribution of $5000 to complete my first children's book. Editing, design, illustrations, printing and marketing are the expenses that warrant the contribution requests.  For contributions of $50, $100 or $200, there are great perks to show how much I appreciate the assistance that will help me create words that can change the lives of children.

We have drugs, bullying, murders and suicides effecting the lives of our children as early as 6-years-old.  I was once 6-years-old and I personally never thought of or experienced any of those ills that plague our society but I know others who have. I'm just 21-years-old and all of this breaks my heart.  There is power in words and I want to start with what I know; writing words that are positively powerful with concepts and foundations based on love, happiness, joy and family.  Words that are an easy read for children, who I once was and not too far removed from them. Gentleness soothes the spirit and right here, right now is where I want to start and contribute something that I know is needed and works, being loved and empowering the gentle spirit that is in each of us.

have. I'm just 21-years-old and all of
this breaks my heart.  There is power in words and I want to start with
what I know; writing words that are positively powerful with concepts and
foundations based on love, happiness, joy and family.  Words that are an
easy read for children, who I once was and not too far removed from them.
Gentleness soothes the spirit and right here, right now is where I want to
start and contribute something that I know is needed and works, being loved and
empowering the gentle spirit that is in each of us.

story:
Short Summary

Young Writers Project is an independent nonprofit dedicated to the idea that writing is essential for learning, expression and creativity. Hate to write? We'll help with that. Think you're lousy at it? No problem; we'll show you the way. Think it's not important? We suspect you have something to say.

We work with kids online, in person and in schools; we publish their best work in 22 newspapers and on Vermont Public Radio each week; we hold events where they can present work live; we partner with anybody if we can get youths more audience for their fine work. And we work with hundreds of teachers to help deepen their students' engagement in writing.

YWP recently moved to the most economically challenged and diverse neighborhoods in Vermont to work with youths most in need of our help. We also believe these youths have stories to tell that must be heard.

Your support will help us:

  • Buy 10 laptops for our North by North Center -- it's a digital world and we need a few more work stations ;
  • Pay honorariums to area artists -- writers, musicians, digital storytellers, photographers, performers -- to lead vibrant exciting sessions for youths -- they need to live, too; and
  • Allow us to go out into neighborhood schools -- at no charge -- to work with teachers and students -- nothing breeds collaboration like the words, 'no charge.'

What We Need & What You Get

All of our work is done with intention: We want to help youths create work that is worthy of publication -- in newspapers, online, on stage, on radio or in our annual Anthology. We are going to focus on several projects aimed at helping youths write their stories in text, with images and other media or in a form that can be presented live. We anticipate several community presentations that will be streamed live online and will be recorded for viewing from anywhere.

Here's the breakdown of how your donations will be spent:

Computers. We will buy 10, last-year or refurbished Mac laptops for use in our North by North Center and for us to transport to other locations -- $7,500; 

Honorariums. We would like to pay each artist $100 per two-hour session, including prep time. This hardly covers their true cost, but it helps. We will use these funds to match an anonymous donor to fund 30 weeks of workshops. $3,000 will be derived from this fund as a match; and

School Days. Your funding will help defray the costs of working with one school -- approximately 12 teachers and 400 students -- throughout the year -- our own digital platform for digital classroom space; ongoing mentoring of teachers; in-class workshops and support via phone, email and carrier pigeon when we can't make it to the school right away.

What you get out of this is tremendous satisfaction. OK. I hear you. But really, your donations will help us reach hundreds of youths to show them the power of their words, their stories.

And you will see their words. You will hear their voices. You will see their faces. And you will understand what it means to them.

We will have videos, live streams, Internet radio shows, pieces in the newspaper. You will see their work in our annual Anthology. And if you live nearby, you will meet them in person. And maybe, just maybe, for a few of them, you will say in 10 years, 'Well, I knew them when ...'

You will also get a tax deduction; they're nice, too.

The Impact

There will be a real impact in what we do. Many of the youths we are serving are new arrivals, as they say. These kids were plunked down in the middle of winter from Kenya, Tanzania, Somalia, Congo or Sudan, from Vietnam or Tibet or Indonesia, from Bosnia or Pakistan or India. Imagine for a moment; imagine if you were flown to Rwanda, with no knowledge of the language, no connections to the culture, few family members and not much money and each day you were asked to go to school and learn in a language that you didn't understand. Imagine. And imagine if you got to Rwanda via a four year journey that had you walking 1,000 miles on foot and living in refugee camps in three different countries with three different languages. And imagine, too, if you arrived in Rwanda and you could not really talk with anyone.

We hope that what we do is give voice to many of these youths and help them learn skills and create stories that have eloquence and power. We want those who read these stories, hear these stories, to understand.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that many of you don't have the money to give to our organization. We understand. And that is why we never charge youths for anything we do. But we'd love your help in other ways:

  • Spread the word. Send this link to your friends. Perhaps they can chip in.
  • And keep in mind this outfit here has all sorts of digitally acute ways of spreading the message; take advantage!
  • Suggest some ways we can give audience to their work other than what we are already doing.
  • And if you live in Vermont, give us a call and help us at the North by North Center -- help encourage some youth to participate; offer to give them some transportation to make it to our center; or just ask them to tell you their story.

A special word to you who made it this far...

My name is Geoffrey Gevalt. I founded this organization after a 33-year career in journalism. Two things about that: One, I had a whole lot of help getting this started -- a bunch of business and education leaders gave me the seed money and lots of advice to get it started and hundreds of people have helped out since. Two, I always felt that in my career as a journalist, people who made it to the end of the story always deserved something extra. A little nugget, perhaps. So here it is.

I work 60 hours a week at this crazy job running YWP. On a good week, I stretch that out to seven days. On a not as good week I reach 60 by Friday. But I love every minute of it. Well, actually, not every minute. But darn close. Imagine how much fun it is to get kids to write and tell stories.

Thanks for listening. And thanks for your support.

Geoffrey Gevalt

youngwritersproject.org

story:
About SaraEve:

Born and raised in North East New Jersey, I would have run away with the circus a long time ago if things were different, but instead have found myself a calling in performance poetry and advocacy.

I attended my first open mic in 2009 and never stopped.  A long time “page poet”, I self-released my first poetry anthology, Everyday Life’s Inspiration, through lulu.com the same year.

In 2012 I was the Jersey City Slam Women of the World Poetry Slam Representative Runner Up.  That year I was also in the 2012 Jersey City Slam Finals.

I am currently the co-slammaster of Jersey City Slam, along with Ben “Broken English” Figueroa.  I also conduct the weekly Poetry Workshop For Women hosted by the Poetry Guild of Union City.

I consider my writing ‘oceanic’ and often use my performance as a vehicle to deal with body issues, feminism, and ableism.  I hope to make you laugh, cry or at the very least see things a little differently.

I am proud to announce that I am the 2013 Jersey City Slam Women of the World Representative, giving me the opportunity to compete against 80+ female poets from around the world, bringing my voice and poetic mission to a wider audience. 

Why $1500 dollars?

This year's WoWPS (Women of the World Poetry Slam) is being held in Minneapolis, MN.  I currently reside in Union City, NJ.  This is roughly 1,200 miles from the competition.  This is also the part where I tell you that I have epilepsy, which prohibits me from driving.  I am also on a strict regiment of medications that drain my monthly funds.  $1500 sounds like a lot, but that is because I have to pay for the following:

  • A round trip plane ticket
  • Registration as a Poetry Slam inc. member
  • Registration to compete in WoWPS
  • Lodging

Even if I do not reach my goal every cent will go towards me getting to Minneapolis.  It has been my dream for the past three years to be a WoWPS representative and now that I have earned this opportunity I will let nothing stop from getting there.

Furthermore, if I reach my goal of $1500 and realize that I have exceeded my expectations in fundraising, I will donate all excess funds to the Epilepsy Foundation (www.epilepsyfoundation.org), a foundation that has helped me as well as countless other people afflicted with epilepsy through their network of resources

story:
What Is This?

Podcoast will be a collective of creative, independent musicians, comics, artists, and so much more, coming together to create high quality, entertaining programs. The main goal of the group will be the creation of a streaming internet radio station, with a variety of shows and a wonderful showcase of local music. From there, the possibilities are limitless, as we've seen with groups like Nerdist, Smodcast and Earwolf, there are truly so many places to go. A few specifics might be the creation of a Youtube channel to showcase the many talented BC film makers, and so much more. 

What's The Money For? 

The help we need from you is to get us set up permanently in the small studio space that has been provided with mics, a mixer, a digital recording device, and all of the basics required for recorded. That aside, we will need to be able to pay our monthly bandwidth fees  to stream live, and we will also need to be able to pay for web hosts, some content, and so so so many more things. While the goal-funds is high, it's really just the 'ideal' amount. What we really need is any form of help and support you can possible offer. 

We will be offering some strange, funny, and interesting perks showcasing the shows, as well as local British Columbian musicians and artists!  

The Impact

A free and independent network based in BC would be an amazing thing for artists, musicians, and really any creative person. As well, as the people who are looking for new and interesting media and new and interesting music. Your help to this will filter down to help out everyone involved. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I do understand that these days, money isn't exactly a free-flowing wave for anyone, but if you are interested in helping this project, there are so many other ways you can help. 

 - Gear donations. IF you have recording equipment that you would be willing to donate on a permanent or semi-permanent basis, PLEASE let me know.

 - Bandwidth/Streaming donations, if you happen to be someone who streams internet radio from your huge beautiful servers and would be willing to put out the signal, I mean, WOW. 

 - Share this with the people you know! Awareness is so helpful and so beautiful. 

 - Well wishes & affection are always deeply appreciated too! 

If you can think of another way to help, or want to help with these things, or just want to chat with me, please send any e-mails to thebarleyshow@gmail.com!

story:
• What if every soul came to earth with a specific purpose? 
  • What if we chose our parents in order to fulfill our mutual destinies?
  • What if the spirit world was just as real and tangible as the physical world? 
  • What if we all came here upon our own choosing and selected the people and conditions that would be the most advantageous to the evolution of our souls?

The novel "BORN!" touches on all of these possibilities in a creative and captivating way. The story is told in the first person by a narrator – the invisible soul of a boy who chooses his future mother and does everything in his power to be born. 

This book is significant. It inspires young women to think about many considerable things like the fact that the life of the baby is important even before he/she is born.

My name is Nadezhda Serebrennikova, I'm an author of "BORN!"
I hope with your help we can translate this book into English and many young women and men will be able to read it. This book is poignant and thought-provoking and opens people’s eyes to seeing life and birth in an entirely new light and context.

Everybody can believe in magic with "BORN!" Believe and realize that there is so much more out there than eye can see. 

Here are some reviews from people in Russia who have read my book.
Right now I have just 8 pages in English and raise this amount to pay for translation and editing (I already have the professional translator who can do it). But I hope you can appreciate the idea if you start to read...

***
How many people actually ask the question “Where do babies come from?”…This book provides an absorbing, fascinating and surprisingly vivid and truthful answer to this question! I totally agree that these tiny spirits, which come closer when we are on the right track, and sometimes disappear when we let routines, doubts and rationality dominate over love, manage our lives.

I’m leaning how to orientate myself on this feeling… I believe it’s better to change life without loosing it, then to stay in the rut and never know what is miracle – when the baby finds you and makes you better, that he or she can be born… I would recommend this book to all future mothers, no matter when this future will happen to them.

  • Oxana Bistrova, Chelyabinsk

It's a great book, without any excessive moralizing, without needless pain, but with a lot of joy. There is such indiscriminate forgiveness and such love, that the soul is starting to laugh. Thank you! 

  • Ksenia Orlova, Saint Petersburg

After I heard only several phrases from this fairytale novel, I wanted to read it right away. This novel exceeded all of my expectations! Surprisingly enough it is easy to read and captivates with a fast-evolving plot. Most importantly, I was surprised that it is possible to write like this, in achildish naive way (clearly in a good way). I was penetrated with the frankness and sincerity.

By virtue of this book I believed in myself. I believed that everything is possible and there is no need to stick to some certain rules, that it is possible to create new genres in literature, just don’t be afraid and do it sincerely. Thank you for “Born!”.

Anastasia Senchenko, Voronezh

***

BORN!

- The baby is coming by himself, by himself! - it was the first thing I heard. And straight away I could smell something. And my eyes opened – they were open slightly because I was very tired and through this tiny slit I saw the light and two creatures in blue. They were quick at helping me to get out of my sanctuary and putting me on something warm. Or rather on someone warm. This someone, I laid on, was curiously examining me. There were red veins as narrow as threads in her eyes and on her face.

- Hi there – she addressed herself to me and slightly touched me with the point of her finger, as if she wanted to make sure I was real.

Well it looks like this is my mother, I thought to myself, while her eyes were scanning me. But why does she hardly remind me of that young woman I chose to be my mom when I was still flying? It might be that humans are changing. Giving birth is not an easy thing to do, I guess. Well it was hard for her… It’s ok, she’ll get some rest and fix herself and will become the most beautiful mum in the world. My Mother! Anyway I am supposed to love her just the way she is.

- It’s two minutes after midnight – claimed those in blue clothes.

And then she talked to someone else standing next to her head.

- What does your watch say? - she addressed him. I couldn’t see yet who was there.

- Midnight and thirty seconds – man’s voice replied – Already thirty three seconds.

And then mother started to argue. I remember, she liked to argue when I was inside as well. Here we go again! It seemed like the precise time was important for her. She drew her attention away from me, and it was a little insulting.People in blue gave up quickly and put down what she was insisting on, then I was lifted and carried away somewhere. And my mom was left there… They were still doing something to her, and I got worried that maybe she was still in pain. I kept thinking of her. And – oh dear - I forgot her name. It seems to me that I actually forgot a lot, after coming into the light.

I had been washed for a long time; they scrubbed the muck of my belly for some reason, weighed me, and tied a tag with a note “Vorobyeva. Boy. 05/27. 00:00, 53 sm. 3650 grams”, then they swaddled me tightly and left me alone. But pretty soon someone in black approached me and pointed at me with a strange thing with round glass. I didn’t know what it was, but to be on the safe side I squinted. It was still hard to open my eyes. And then the man in black said in a low voice that I look like a tumorous old lady. I could hear that and got mad at him. Some kind of a fool he was. You are an old lady. Just wait, I’ll show you!

- So that is what you are: Danya, Phedya, Stepa… - mused someone in black.

No, that’s not my father, I thought. I know my father. And you are definitely not he. Well I did recognize my mom. So I would recognize my father as well, since I chose them, a long time before today.

Anyway, finally I was born. And it was entire and permanent. Now I have to live here. There won’t be warm water all the time, in which I stayed and sucked my finger, no more feeling of complete protection, no more opportunity to eavesdrop on adults’ conversations safely. And the saddest thing is that I will never fly again. I felt so sad at that moment that I wanted to cry. And I cried. But I was so tired that it came out as indistinct sob. No one understood that I’m crying because I’m sad. Apparently newborns are supposed to cry to let the world know about their birth.


***

When I saw my mom for the first time she looked completely different. Although I didn’t look like anyone at all and for sure didn’t look like anyone’s grandma. But mom had ginger, copper-gold and curly hair. A really happy girl! Tanned, wearing blue jeans and a bright yellow top. She was laughing a lot. Together with some young man they were in the boat and chatting. The patches of sunlight were chasing each other on the water next to them. I was flying by with my friends, with other souls belonging to nobody. Our goal was to find those who will become our parents. I was looking for happy people, who loved each other. And all of a sudden I heard her laughter,

- That’s it, guys, go on without me! – I shout to my friends and sat dawn on her shoulder. She scratched it right away like she felt something. I probably tickled her although I was invisible. Human beings can feel such things from time to time. Our tickles for them are like a little bug creeping on a cheek. I looked into her laughing brown eyes and saw some warm and joyful feeling in it.

- It might be love and I’m on the right track then, am I? – Then I thought to myself. 
- So where are those monkeys,Victor? It seems that we are lost… - she said to her companion. 
– Don’t worry, Ginger, we are going to find them now!

They were looking for some island. I decided to stay with them and observe.
They took turns rowing the boat.

- Take a picture of me, please, while I’m rowing. Am I beautiful – yes? - she laughed and leaned a little bit back. She was actually (or it was the way I saw her) very beautiful. It seemed that the flow of amazing sunny energy that was coming from her went right through me. I felt as if I looked like a sunbeam too. I might even become visible at that moment.

- I want you to be my mother – I whisper in her ear, and she scratched it. – Got ya!

I stayed with them that night. They finally found an island with monkeys, brought to the Central Park of Recreation and Leisure in the summer of 1999. After hand-feed the monkeys and turned back the boat thee laid on the grass for a long time, drinking beer and talking. I found out that girl’s name was Lera and that she lived not far from the subway station in Saint Petersburg called “Dibenko”. The name of the young man was Victor. It had been 2 months since they broke up, but a couple days ago he brought by Lera’s request some forgotten stuff from the apartment where they lived together. When they hadn’t seen each other, both started new relationships, but their reunion won’t let them become serious.

- Ginger, in fact you are practically my wife… - looking at her with love, he said and I could see that she was incredibly pleased to hear that. – We’ve been through so many things together! You were the only one who visited me in the hospital when I broke my spine and almost one month laid motionless… Yeah, everything was there!You know, I saw you last week andI haven’t been myself since then.I can’t concentrate on my work, I’ve beenniggling with one agreement for several days, my colleagues ask me what’s wrong with me… And yesterday I realized, that it’s love, Ginger! – He patted her curly hair. In spite of his words, I didn’t like Victor. I wouldn’t want a dad like him. He looked like a caveman with a strange shape of head and large ears. His face reminds me of a dwarf – evil, or kind depending on the expression of his eyes. But it wasn’t even about the way he looked. I felt something cold and cruel in his eyes, and couldn’t find any definition of that… It seems like it had a second face. I must help my future mom to find someone else. I wonder whom she was dating when this “caveman” called on her again? I would like to look at this other man.

***

95TH of July. It’s impossible, I knew it for sure. Nevertheless, it was folded with wooden cubes on the bookshelf in the room of my future mother, when I got in her apartment for the first time. Well, it looks like, she was an extraordinary girl, and I was about to experience different unusual events.

She was reading a book so enthusiastically that she didn’t even feel how I slightly tickled her behind her ear. It was just one of the ways to let her know about me. We can also send people messages, - the ones, that when they see it they shake their heads and say – it’s a sign! I sent it to my future mom recently on her way to work in the morning, when she was thinking about her relationships with Victor. Lera was looking out of the bus’s window, and I was reading her thoughts: “Why did we start it again... It wasn’t worth it: a broken cup will remain cracked. We are just following an old pattern –she sighed and snuggled her cheek to the windowpane, leaning on her hand – Who’d suggest what to do, would say for sure, if he is my man or not. The bus was just passing next to the huge billboard with headlines “Not yours!” Although it was just an antismoking social ad – but isn’t that a sign? And most importantly – truly, that’s I knew for sure. And she had felt the same way for a long time already. I noticed how suddenly the look in her eyes changed: from thoughtfully sad to surprised.

We also can come in a dream. When my future mom was carried away by the book she was reading and didn’t notice my touch, I got upset and decided to come in her dream. I will have to figure out which image I will appear.

I don’t have a name yet. I am a small light, like a breath of the air, soul,and the time has come to find my incarnation on Earth.I don’t remember my previous lives and don’t know if I had any at all. It’s just time to live among people, and for this purpose I have to find those who will become my parents. My number is B-04041999. “B” means that I have to be born as a boy, numbers – a date when I start to search for my parents.According to the rules, at the beginning boys choose their mom, and girls -dad. Besides me, thousand souls have exactly the same number and they got the same task on 4th of April 1999, but I already lost them. How long my search will last and when I will be born, as a baby boy is unknown.

Sometimes we have to arrange the first meeting of our future parents and take care of them so they don’t get lost before the main reason they met happen – conception. And sometimes we have to do vice versa: separate those who don’t match. As it was in my case. What can be done for family happiness! I was determined to help Lera to find the one who will be different. How? It cannot be predicted. Generally speaking, the one with whom she will have it all.

***

Lera’s been wanting a child for a long time now. I found out about it when she was talking to her girlfriend over the phone. She was pregnant when she was 18 years old, but having a baby on her first year of college with someone with who she couldn’t have serious relationship was too much for her.

Together with her friend, a medical student, being young, she tried to solve the problem with the help of some hormone injections, but it didn’t help. So, with the advice of another girlfriend who had just experienced the same situation, she went to gynecologist and told him everything. Gentle blue-eyed professor treated her as a daughter, petted her hair and told her to come next day with slippers and robe.

- I’m afraid that the anesthesia is not going to work – the last thing she remembered saying when she was pregnant, and a smile of the anesthesiologist with wide shoulders in a reaction to her words.

Everything happened really fast and the soul of her daughter who recently found her shelter ended up being rejected. Trying not to look at the process of withdrawing her body she flew away to her friends. She had to cry out her broken hopes – she already fall in love with this young gay girl who even found out about pregnancy on the April Fool Day. At first the father of the future baby took this news as a joke. But when it turned out to be tough joke, the soul of her daughter had to admit that she didn’t make a right choice, at least she did it too early for her mother. For this kind of failure she had to wait another two years before choosing parents again.

At first when Lera saw babies she wanted to cry. Several times a little girl with ginger hair and grey eyes came to her dreams. Later, she felt this loss when she was holding her friend’s kids. While she was living with Victor, she wanted to be a mother so badly. The same year her friend became the mother of a baby boy, and according to her words, she saw him in a dream and he told her to give him the name Roma. Before his birth Lera visited her exactly on the 1st of April and as a joke told her to give birth on 17th, because it was her favorite number. It came as a big surprise when he was born on 17th.

–Now you know who has be his Godmother, don’t you? – She asked laughing

– Without any doubt. – Her girlfriend smiled - Once he grows up we will baptize him.
– He will be my second godson. Someone told me recently that once you’ve become a godmother of a boy your life will change for the best. And I have 2 of them already!
Then for sure it will be better from now on! – Anna said with confidence.

When the future Godmother, for the first time took one-month old Roma, and just for a second, imagined it was her baby – we got her request at the “celestial chancellery». And my soul, which was in search for two months, replied to this request right away.

This kind of requests usually happens when a woman sees a baby she likes. Something happens inside of her that is hard to explain – excitement, admiration that turns into a wish to have a baby. This signal is caught by the soul, who’s trying to incarnate on Earth, and from that moment they establish their own energy connection. I found Lera so naturally without even knowing that she was the one.

Coming back from her future Godson, the girl told Victor about her emotions. But their wishes were different. Victor, who was married once before and didn’t sign all papers yet, was 7 years older then his second civil wife. He considered himself experienced and practical, while Lera was young, naive and over emotional. Victor was generous, joyful and sometimes a joker, as well as cynical and despotic.

Lera thought sometimes that he had two persons inside of him: lighthearted joker, whom she loved, and practical cynic with the look that she truly feared. If astrology is to be trusted for Gemini this kind of bifurcation is normal. That second one considered Lera a little bit careless and a bad housewife; he didn’t plan to merry her and as a result didn’t want a baby. Point-blank. But since the first, bright half of his personality truly loved her, there was nothing left but to put up with this situation.

***

By the middle of the May, exactly when I felt that there is someone I need and that someone needs me, Victor and Lera’s relationship was close to the end. It wasn’t light and romantic any more, they were only dealing with everyday problems: what to buy for dinner, how small to cut onions, and during meal they only talk about work. There was no warmth. When it became absolutely intolerable, Lera packed her stuff while Victor was with friends. At the entrance she bumped into her former loved one and he silently followed her to the elevator.

One day later at the editorial office of the newspaper where she was working, a new cute young journalist Artem Golubkov has come, he was introduced to the team. The chief editor was showing the confused employee to all of the team members and asking them to be nice with the new colleague.
– Sure we will! - Lera couldn’t hold herself from making a comment, noticing embarrassment of the new journalist. He was completely her type: middle height, grey eyes with a sweet squint and sexy lips, like Bred Pitt. Moreover he was very shy, it’s a big advantage too, she liked to confuse people. – We are very nice people, aren’t’ we, Artem? – She made him blush.

Artem smiled coyly and left the room as soon as possible. He цфы attracted to Lera immediately. He always liked girls with ginger hair but they were unfortunately not in his league. He got himself together and came onto the office again in ten minutes.

- Does anyone want to go to the “DDT” concert tonight? I have a spare ticket. – Artem announced to all of them but looked directly at her.

- Lera, you should go, you like Shevchuk. – One of her colleagues answered.

- Shevchuk? I respect him, but I like Zemfira.

- You can got to Zemfira next time. You should go, since you promised to be nice – giggled colleague.

- Well, if only for that purpose … – Lera picked up – Ok, I will join you, Artem.

It was very crowded, but for some reason they didn’t let people inside, so when they opened the door, the crowd tore inside, and young people were pushed against each other. But they didn't feel uncomfortable. Artem even thanked in his thoughts all the fans of Shevchuk for that, since he wasn’t ready to make that move by himself. Shevchuk was at his best. After the concert the crowd moved to the underground. Lera and Artem stood in the train face to face and both felt strong physical attraction.

“So strange - Lera thought then – only yesterday I wanted to cry and one day later I am next to another man who is obviously attracted to me. And he is actually very cute, although it wouldn’t hurt him to shave …“

- Why did you grow such a funny beard, you are only 23 years old? - Without any offence she asked him - We are almost of the same age by the way. You see I don’t have any beard.

- I thought I would look more distinguished with it. It didn’t work?

- No, it didn’t. Shave it!

- I’ll think about it

- Yes, you should think about it. Think about it and shave it!

– Your tongue is sharp! – Artem said with admiration.

– Yes, as sharp as the blade that you need to shave your beard with. – She laughed.

Not knowing what to answer, he didn't find anything better then slightly pull her hair. Where was I at that moment? Why wasn't I around them? It was that perfect moment when everything could go either direction. No one was there to tell Lera that he was the one, and like it says in one song 'just don't let him go away'. No one was there to warn her that she shouldn’t discourage him. The guy was still as green as grass and she could make anything out of him. With the right approach he could become my real beloved dad. But Lera wasn’t a sculptor by nature, it wouldn’t hurt to polish herself a little bit first. And the material that this guy was made of would crack after the first burn. That’s why everything went wrong between them from the beginning …

They went out several times after work in the company of their colleagues, trying to get to know each other. Lera started to have some feelings, but Artem being timid decided to go after her friend Julia, who coincidentally was with them that day. Lera was watching how the couple separated and after a few minutes he was already kissing Julia under the Lenin’s monument next to the Finland railway station.

It wasn’t clear to Lera, what Artem was trying to get with this sort of behavior. Young guy with beard was trying to make her jealous that way and even share with her how he felt good about that kiss. Nevertheless the result was the opposite – Lera shrugged her shoulders and cross him out in his mind. And this spontaneous flirt with Julia was only one for Artem.

***

I was in Lera’s room and was watching how she looked at two pink stripes on thin piece of paper. I could feel her confusion and heard her thoughts. I wasn’t myself. I couldn’t understand how that happened, because I wanted Lera to understand before conceiving me that Victor is not her match. Now everything turned to be really complicated.

“Dear God… what is Victor going to say when he wakes up? He will say that I rigged it, since he didn’t want ...”

I watched as he slept peacefully, gently putting his big ears on the pillow. For me, this legally savvy Mr is not a pleasant sight not only when awake, but when he is asleep. I could not understand how Lera didn’t feel that due to the duality of his nature relationship between them can turn 180 degrees at any time.

Victor was that guy who Lera was riding a boat with when I saw her for the first time. I would glad left him on that island with monkeys.

He himself was dreaming about having a daughter and even knew that he would name her Kate – the name of the girl he was in love with in school. And I knew it would be that way, but not now, not with Lera. There was some kind of mistake, I knew I was supposed to be born as a boy, so he couldn’t be my father! I felt that everything that was happening was not my life. But I made a mistake once. А really big mistake.

It was a sunny hot day in July and I just don’t know how it happened, I probably – I guess, the sun baked my nonexistent head.

We are always attracted by strong feelings between our future parents, and that day Lera and Victor definitely had it. When in the morning they went of the theatre, fully in love again, they didn’t remember what the movie was about, because they were kissing on the last row. And on the way back home hold hands. Victor suddenly has changed. As if he was replaced: that cold feeling in his eyes that I saw has disappeared, like it wasn’t there at all. Their feelings were real, so I couldn’t control myself. I was sucked in the funnel…

Everything went in the wrong direction in Lera’s fate; she shouldn’t take that direction at all. That intimacy between them defined my fate. Not only mine actually.

- You can have a baby with anyone except me – the first thing Victor said when he saw two stripes.

They were at the kitchen. I felt that everything inside my mom clenched, and she was holding herself from breaking down in tears.

- But we were talking about Kate, I also want daughter with that name

- No, Ginger, I think we shouldn’t keep a baby, you’d better see a doctor.

- I will but only together with you

The doctor was that blue-eyed professor. He recognized Lera and at her request he tried to persuade the young man to keep the baby.

- It’s about 5 weeks now. The uterine wall is too thin, abortion can negatively affect the future pregnancy, do you understand that? - He said to the future father in the hall after the checkup. Victor shook his head as if he did understand everything. The doctor winked at Lera as if he was saying that he hope everything would settle. She also wanted to believe it.

What if every soul came to earth with a specific purpose? 
What if we chose our parents in order to fulfill our mutual destinies?
What if the spirit world was just as real and tangible as the physical world? 
What if we all came here upon our own choosing and selected the people and conditions that would be the most advantageous to the evolution of our souls?
The novel "BORN!" touches on all of these possibilities in a creative and captivating way. The story is told in the first person by a narrator – the invisible soul of a boy who chooses his future mother and does everything in his power to be born. This book is significant. It inspires young women to think about many considerable things like the fact that the life of the baby is important even before he/she is born.My name is Nadezhda Serebrennikova, I'm an author of "BORN!" I hope with your help we can translate this book into English and many young women and men will be able to read it. This book is poignant and thought-provoking and opens people’s eyes to seeing life and birth in an entirely new light and context.Everybody can believe in magic with "BORN!" Believe and realize that there is so much more out there than eye can see. Here are some reviews from people in Russia who have read my book.Right now I have just 8 pages in English and raise this amount to pay for translation and editing (I already have the professional translator who can do it). But I hope you can appreciate the idea if you start to read...***How many people actually ask the question “Where do babies come from?”…This book provides an absorbing, fascinating and surprisingly vivid and truthful answer to this question! I totally agree that these tiny spirits, which come closer when we are on the right track, and sometimes disappear when we let routines, doubts and rationality dominate over love, manage our lives.I’m leaning how to orientate myself on this feeling… I believe it’s better to change life without loosing it, then to stay in the rut and never know what is miracle – when the baby finds you and makes you better, that he or she can be born… I would recommend this book to all future mothers, no matter when this future will happen to them.Oxana Bistrova, ChelyabinskIt's a great book, without any excessive moralizing, without needless pain, but with a lot of joy. There is such indiscriminate forgiveness and such love, that the soul is starting to laugh. Thank you! Ksenia Orlova, Saint PetersburgAfter I heard only several phrases from this fairytale novel, I wanted to read it right away. This novel exceeded all of my expectations! Surprisingly enough it is easy to read and captivates with a fast-evolving plot. Most importantly, I was surprised that it is possible to write like this, in achildish naive way (clearly in a good way). I was penetrated with the frankness and sincerity.By virtue of this book I believed in myself. I believed that everything is possible and there is no need to stick to some certain rules, that it is possible to create new genres in literature, just don’t be afraid and do it sincerely. Thank you for “Born!”.Anastasia Senchenko, Voronezh***BORN!- The baby is coming by himself, by himself! - it was the first thing I heard. And straight away I could smell something. And my eyes opened – they were open slightly because I was very tired and through this tiny slit I saw the light and two creatures in blue. They were quick at helping me to get out of my sanctuary and putting me on something warm. Or rather on someone warm. This someone, I laid on, was curiously examining me. There were red veins as narrow as threads in her eyes and on her face.- Hi there – she addressed herself to me and slightly touched me with the point of her finger, as if she wanted to make sure I was real.Well it looks like this is my mother, I thought to myself, while her eyes were scanning me. But why does she hardly remind me of that young woman I chose to be my mom when I was still flying? It might be that humans are changing. Giving birth is not an easy thing to do, I guess. Well it was hard for her… It’s ok, she’ll get some rest and fix herself and will become the most beautiful mum in the world. My Mother! Anyway I am supposed to love her just the way she is.- It’s two minutes after midnight – claimed those in blue clothes.And then she talked to someone else standing next to her head.- What does your watch say? - she addressed him. I couldn’t see yet who was there.- Midnight and thirty seconds – man’s voice replied – Already thirty three seconds.And then mother started to argue. I remember, she liked to argue when I was inside as well. Here we go again! It seemed like the precise time was important for her. She drew her attention away from me, and it was a little insulting.People in blue gave up quickly and put down what she was insisting on, then I was lifted and carried away somewhere. And my mom was left there… They were still doing something to her, and I got worried that maybe she was still in pain. I kept thinking of her. And – oh dear - I forgot her name. It seems to me that I actually forgot a lot, after coming into the light.I had been washed for a long time; they scrubbed the muck of my belly for some reason, weighed me, and tied a tag with a note “Vorobyeva. Boy. 05/27. 00:00, 53 sm. 3650 grams”, then they swaddled me tightly and left me alone. But pretty soon someone in black approached me and pointed at me with a strange thing with round glass. I didn’t know what it was, but to be on the safe side I squinted. It was still hard to open my eyes. And then the man in black said in a low voice that I look like a tumorous old lady. I could hear that and got mad at him. Some kind of a fool he was. You are an old lady. Just wait, I’ll show you!- So that is what you are: Danya, Phedya, Stepa… - mused someone in black.No, that’s not my father, I thought. I know my father. And you are definitely not he. Well I did recognize my mom. So I would recognize my father as well, since I chose them, a long time before today.Anyway, finally I was born. And it was entire and permanent. Now I have to live here. There won’t be warm water all the time, in which I stayed and sucked my finger, no more feeling of complete protection, no more opportunity to eavesdrop on adults’ conversations safely. And the saddest thing is that I will never fly again. I felt so sad at that moment that I wanted to cry. And I cried. But I was so tired that it came out as indistinct sob. No one understood that I’m crying because I’m sad. Apparently newborns are supposed to cry to let the world know about their birth.***When I saw my mom for the first time she looked completely different. Tanned, wearing blue jeans and a bright yellow top. She was laughing a lot. Together with some young man they were in the boat and chatting. The patches of sunlight were chasing each other on the water next to them. I was flying by with my friends, with other souls belonging to nobody. I probably tickled her although I was invisible. Human beings can feel such things from time to time. Our tickles for them are like a little bug creeping on a cheek. I looked into her laughing brown eyes and saw some warm and joyful feeling in it.- It might be love and I’m on the right track then, am I? – Then I thought to myself. - So where are those monkeys,Victor? I felt as if I looked like a sunbeam too. I might even become visible at that moment.- I want you to be my mother – I whisper in her ear, and she scratched it. – Got ya!I stayed with them that night. You should go, since you promised to be nice – giggled colleague.- Well, if only for that purpose … – Lera picked up – Ok, I will join you, Artem.It was very crowded, but for some reason they didn’t let people inside, so when they opened the door, the crowd tore inside, and young people were pushed against each other. But they didn't feel uncomfortable. Artem even thanked in his thoughts all the fans of Shevchuk for that, since he wasn’t ready to make that move by himself. Shevchuk was at his best. After the concert the crowd moved to the underground. Lera and Artem stood in the train face to face and both felt strong physical attraction.“So strange - Lera thought then – only yesterday I wanted to cry and one day later I am next to another man who is obviously attracted to me. And he is actually very cute, although it wouldn’t hurt him to shave …“- Why did you grow such a funny beard, you are only 23 years old? - Without any offence she asked him - We are almost of the same age by the way. You see I don’t have any beard.- I thought I would look more distinguished with it. It didn’t work?- No, it didn’t. Shave it!- I’ll think about it- Yes, you should think about it. Think about it and shave it!– Your tongue is sharp! – Artem said with admiration.– Yes, as sharp as the blade that you need to shave your beard with. – She laughed.Not knowing what to answer, he didn't find anything better then slightly pull her hair. Where was I at that moment? Why wasn't I around them? It was that perfect moment when everything could go either direction. No one was there to tell Lera that he was the one, and like it says in one song 'just don't let him go away'. No one was there to warn her that she shouldn’t discourage him. The guy was still as green as grass and she could make anything out of him. With the right approach he could become my real beloved dad. But Lera wasn’t a sculptor by nature, it wouldn’t hurt to polish herself a little bit first. And the material that this guy was made of would crack after the first burn. That’s why everything went wrong between them from the beginning …They went out several times after work in the company of their colleagues, trying to get to know each other. Lera started to have some feelings, but Artem being timid decided to go after her friend Julia, who coincidentally was with them that day. Lera was watching how the couple separated and after a few minutes he was already kissing Julia under the Lenin’s monument next to the Finland railway station.It wasn’t clear to Lera, what Artem was trying to get with this sort of behavior. Young guy with beard was trying to make her jealous that way and even share with her how he felt good about that kiss. Nevertheless the result was the opposite – Lera shrugged her shoulders and cross him out in his mind. And this spontaneous flirt with Julia was only one for Artem.***I was in Lera’s room and was watching how she looked at two pink stripes on thin piece of paper. I could feel her confusion and heard her thoughts. I wasn’t myself. I couldn’t understand how that happened, because I wanted Lera to understand before conceiving me that Victor is not her match. Now everything turned to be really complicated.“Dear God… what is Victor going to say when he wakes up? He will say that I rigged it, since he didn’t want ...”I watched as he slept peacefully, gently putting his big ears on the pillow. For me, this legally savvy Mr is not a pleasant sight not only when awake, but when he is asleep. I could not understand how Lera didn’t feel that due to the duality of his nature relationship between them can turn 180 degrees at any time.Victor was that guy who Lera was riding a boat with when I saw her for the first time. I would glad left him on that island with monkeys.He himself was dreaming about having a daughter and even knew that he would name her Kate – the name of the girl he was in love with in school. And I knew it would be that way, but not now, not with Lera. There was some kind of mistake, I knew I was supposed to be born as a boy, so he couldn’t be my father! I felt that everything that was happening was not my life. But I made a mistake once. А really big mistake.It was a sunny hot day in July and I just don’t know how it happened, I probably – I guess, the sun baked my nonexistent head.We are always attracted by strong feelings between our future parents, and that day Lera and Victor definitely had it. When in the morning they went of the theatre, fully in love again, they didn’t remember what the movie was about, because they were kissing on the last row. And on the way back home hold hands. Victor suddenly has changed. As if he was replaced: that cold feeling in his eyes that I saw has disappeared, like it wasn’t there at all. Their feelings were real, so I couldn’t control myself. I was sucked in the funnel…Everything went in the wrong direction in Lera’s fate; she shouldn’t take that direction at all. That intimacy between them defined my fate. Not only mine actually.- You can have a baby with anyone except me – the first thing Victor said when he saw two stripes.They were at the kitchen. I felt that everything inside my mom clenched, and she was holding herself from breaking down in tears.- But we were talking about Kate, I also want daughter with that name- No, Ginger, I think we shouldn’t keep a baby, you’d better see a doctor.- I will but only together with youThe doctor was that blue-eyed professor. He recognized Lera and at her request he tried to persuade the young man to keep the baby.- It’s about 5 weeks now. The uterine wall is too thin, abortion can negatively affect the future pregnancy, do you understand that? - He said to the future father in the hall after the checkup. Victor shook his head as if he did understand everything. The doctor winked at Lera as if he was saying that he hope everything would settle. She also wanted to believe it.

I am passionate about change and with knowledge change is possible.

We are already inspiring others with the "Nobody's Girl Book " Facebook Page - here we give hope and inspiration & it's growing daily check out the impact of those that are eager to read the book!!   $25.00 PRE-ORDER THE BOOK


We have seen how we make connections and positively impact those who hear and read our personal stories of overcoming sexual abuse, PTSD,  and addiction.  We give our readers a feeling of knowing they are no longer "alone"!

Nobody's objective is to create a powerful emotional response; to evoke with this authors talent and propel change. She believes with knowledge we can change the way we think and with that, the way we live; and have fuller happier lives.

  • Sharing a Voice - "Your not alone". 
  • Telling our stories,helps others resonate to find their own path to freedom.

    BEST CROWD FUNDING  website  : Press release please share !! Thank you!!!

story:
HELLO, AND WELCOME TO MY CAMPAIGN PAGE!

I’m an award winning writer and poet from Toronto, Canada. I have worked in the humanities for the last five years. In 2012, I was a juror for the Ontario Arts Council's Writers' Works in Progress competition.

READ MORE ABOUT ME AND ABOUT MY WORK:

From Vallum Magazine

From Drunken Boat

From ditchpoetry.com

From The Antigonish Review
 
From the anthology, Navigating Customs

ABOUT MY PROJECT:

My poetry manuscript What Was Monumental in Us (WWMU) focuses on five sites of the Mughal period (16th century to the 18th century) which are situated in present day Lahore (inner city). The work looks at how 21st century locals live amongst and interact with monuments that have been passed down to them. How do locals deal with the lineage of conquering invaders who may have shared some kind of faith with them, and most of territory? The buildings under discussion are massive in scale and their exteriors have changed as visitors have touched them, toyed with them, and in some cases desecrated them. The buildings' purposes have been altered not once but many times. Sites have been converted from elaborate sleeping chambers to administrative offices, from places of holiness to that of plunder. I am interested in examining how a person’s encounter with a building changes the building, and how a building’s encounter with a person changes the person. The people accommodating ancient structures in their midst, the city around the buildings changing, these are some of the preoccupations of the manuscript.

Lahore is a vibrant and joyous city and you can read more about some of its landmarks HERE.

You can also read about some of the aesthetic, architectural and social concerns of the manuscript on my personal blog.

WHY POETRY? WHY LAHORE?

I was born in Lahore, Pakistan and moved to Toronto, Canada at age sixteen. In 2012, I was provided funding by the Ontario Arts Council to work on a project set in Lahore, Pakistan. I spent the summer of 2012 in inner city Lahore, researching, photographing, and talking with locals in order to figure out how best to shape my poetry manuscript  Since my return to Toronto in Fall 2012, I have produced sixty pages of writing and a blog about my experiences from the Summer. The written material so far does not suffice as a full-length manuscript. In fact the material is only the beginning of a larger exploration and creative process. This campaign attempts to raise funds towards the goal of doing something for the love of it: for the love of writing and for the love of a city I left long ago but am beckoned by once again.

As to poetry, thought esoteric by some, it certainly is an interest of mine. Further, the sites under discussion lend themselves wonderfully to thinking about a poetic milieu. It was under the Mughal administration of India that poets were patronised at the royal courts. Some of these poets went on to become founders of Classical Urdu poetry. Royal patronage having been made obsolete a long time ago, what better way for a modern day poet to raise funds than with the help of the driving machine of our time, the internet?

GOALS:

In order to view how the city changes through the cycle of seasons and to fully immerse myself in the culture of the place I plan to be in Lahore for ten months starting June, 2013. I estimate the cost of living and working for ten months at $10,000. I am initially attempting to raise approximately $4,000 through Indiegogo. I may be able to supplement the $4,000 with another arts grant, or with income saved between now and June, 2013. I will also be paying approximately $2,000 dollars for round-trip airfare which is not part of the estimated cost of living in my budget. If I raise only part of the funds I still plan to go on the trip but will have to shorten the duration of the trip. All contributors will receive perks as stated. Estimated completion date for a full draft of the manuscript is April, 2014.

To sum up, this campaign aims to generate funds which will:

1. Allow me to complete my first full-length poetry manuscript.

2. Allow me to begin an informal process of documentation of oral and public histories by interviewing locals of the inner city neighbourhoods I have been working in since early 2012.

The first goal is a personal goal and your support will allow me to present a full artistic rendering of what I have observed and encountered in my exchanges with architecture and with history.

The second goal is public, and in the long run perhaps its impact more significant than that of the first goal. I aim to document and create an archive of the locals’ stories and how they remember the history of buildings and neighbourhoods around them. Several of the buildings I refer to are listed on the UNESCO World Heritage Sites list as being crucial for cultural preservation. On an informal level no one knows about these buildings better than the people who continue to live with and around these buildings on a daily basis. Often the locals’ stories are overlooked or not considered important in official histories and surveys done by administrative departments at the government level. Although no one has commissioned me to take this side project on, this work is very important in order for us to have a documented history of a city which was built and re-built many times in the last thousand years. The impact of this work can be far reaching and I am determined at least to make a start so as to begin the process of research gathering via oral and collective means. To do this work is not a digression from my own project as I will simply be taking notes, listening, asking questions and observing in both cases.

I thank you for reading about my campaign and for being a potential supporter.

If you can’t contribute financially please consider spreading the word by sharing a link to my campaign page with your social media contacts. I appreciate all the support I can get!

WHAT YOU GET:

Below is a summary of perks offered through my campaign:

1. For a $10 contribution your name will be listed in the acknowledgements section of my published book. I will be happy to declare in print that some of the work completed was made possible with your financial support.

Get your name out there as a supporter of arts and culture!

2. For a $25 contribution I will send you a 6*8 high quality print of a scene from vibrant Lahore. The photo will be taken just for you and will be UNIQUE for each recipient. An electronic copy can also be mailed to the recipient and I am open to input on your choice of subject for the photo. Some examples of photos taken by me can be viewed at the campaign gallery.

Who doesn’t like getting a snail mail package from faraway? Especially one for which I may have dodged trucks, cars or possibly livestock just to have captured a rare image for you.

3. For a $50 contribution I will send you a unique print as described in perk #2. This print will come with an original text of minimum one paragraph. The text will be composed by me either in the shape of a poem or as a descriptive prose paragraph elaborating on the scene of the photograph. Again, the writing will be unique for each recipient.

Who doesn’t like getting a snail mail package from faraway? Especially one which contains an arresting photo and a tailor-made composition written just for you.

Again, thanks for reading and please consider supporting me.

UPCOMING:

Please check for updates updates on my blog.

P.S. the drawings in this pitch are scenes from city and village life, Pakistan, made by me at age 9.

story:
My Story

My name is Joanna Penn Cooper, and I'm a poet and writer of short fiction and essays.  I moved to New York City almost four years ago for a three-year teaching fellowship at Fordham University. During my time in New York, I have made friends in the local literary community, have published my creative work in literary journals, and have connected with an inspired Brooklyn press whose editor is working with me to shape my first book of lyrical shorts (think prose poems meet micro-fiction).  My full-time teaching position is now over, and for the past several months, I have been writing, applying for jobs, sending out my work, and patching together part-time teaching and freelance work, including a job as part-time researcher for the novelist Paula McLain.  

Here's the good news and the part I'm asking for help with:  I have been accepted to Vermont Studio Center, a well-known artists' colony, for a four-week residency starting May 13th, which will give me time to do final revisions on my book manuscript, tentatively titled How We Were Strangers.  So, I'm asking for help to fund this opportunity to revise my book in the enriching residency environment, surrounded by nature and by other artists.  Your donations will allow me to focus in a deep way on writing and revision, and will help me see my first full-length book into the world!     

To give you a sense of the voice in the book, you can watch the video above or read another piece here:

http://joannapenncooper.blogspot.com/2012/04/piece-from-my-current-manuscript.html
 

What I Need & What You Get

From Vermont Studio Center, I have received an Artist's Grant plus Work Exchange Award to off-set the cost of the residency, and after paying a $300 deposit, the remaining amount owed is $1,900.  I could also use help funding travel to the residency and off-setting the cost of my rent back in New York.  I'm asking for $2,700, as after fees, if I reach my goal, I would receive $2,511 of that.  If I reach that goal, I will pay back residency costs, and put the remainder toward my travel and living expenses.  If I reach a portion of the goal, I will pay for part or all of the residency costs.  

 

More information about the Vermont Studio Center can be found here:

http://www.vermontstudiocenter.org/intro-video/

 

For donating certain amounts, you may claim the perks listed on the right (my writing services or copies of my creative work).  You may also donate without claiming any of the perks.  Even $5 will be met with my sincere gratitude!   

 

The Impact

This will be my first full-length book, and the work I do in Vermont will go a long way toward seeing the manuscript to its final form.  The pieces in the book explore the liminal spaces between the prose and poetry, between the lyrical and the surreal, ultimately seeking to honor that which we share as human beings—mystery, humor, existential struggle, and a desire for understanding and love.   

My writing has received much positive attention in the past few years.  In December 2010, my manuscript was a finalist for the Kinereth Gensler Award from Alice James Books, and I have also been nominated for a 2012 Rona Jaffe Award for emerging women writers.  Publishing my book will widen my opportunities for full-time teaching positions.  And, basically, after years of hard work and development as a writer, I would love the opportunity to bring my work to a larger audience.        

In addition, time at the Vermont Studio Center will also enable me to do what every artist longs to do-- immerse myself in the work and make connections with other artists.  Two Distinguished Visiting Writers I admire will be in attendance during my time at VSC, Bernadette Mayer and Donald Revell, and I'll get the opportunity to discuss a short manuscript of my work with them.  In addition to revision of my existing manuscript, I will also work on new pieces for my second book of prose poems and lyrical prose, tentatively titled Vita, which will expand on my first book's themes of nomadicism, an appreciation for the absurd, and exploration of origins.   

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a position to contribute financially, believe me, I UNDERSTAND.  If you would like to contribute in other ways, I ask that you send good vibes my way, and that you pass along my campaign to others as you see fit on Facebook, blogs, Twitter, etc.   

Thank you!
story_txt:
My Story
My name is Joanna Penn Cooper, and I'm a poet and writer of short fiction and essays.  I moved to New York City almost four years ago for a three-year teaching fellowship at Fordham University. During my time in New York, I have made friends in the local literary community, have published my creative work in literary journals, and have connected with an inspired Brooklyn press whose editor is working with me to shape my first book of lyrical shorts (think prose poems meet micro-fiction).  My full-time teaching position is now over, and for the past several months, I have been writing, applying for jobs, sending out my work, and patching together part-time teaching and freelance work, including a job as part-time researcher for the novelist Paula McLain.  
Here's the good news and the part I'm asking for help with:  I have been accepted to Vermont Studio Center, a well-known artists' colony, for a four-week residency starting May 13th, which will give me time to do final revisions on my book manuscript, tentatively titled How We Were Strangers.  So, I'm asking for help to fund this opportunity to revise my book in the enriching residency environment, surrounded by nature and by other artists.  Your donations will allow me to focus in a deep way on writing and revision, and will help me see my first full-length book into the world!     
To give you a sense of the voice in the book, you can watch the video above or read another piece here:
http://joannapenncooper.blogspot.com/2012/04/piece-from-my-current-manuscript.html
 


What I Need & What You Get
From Vermont Studio Center, I have received an Artist's Grant plus Work Exchange Award to off-set the cost of the residency, and after paying a $300 deposit, the remaining amount owed is $1,900.  I could also use help funding travel to the residency and off-setting the cost of my rent back in New York.  I'm asking for $2,700, as after fees, if I reach my goal, I would receive $2,511 of that.  If I reach that goal, I will pay back residency costs, and put the remainder toward my travel and living expenses.  If I reach a portion of the goal, I will pay for part or all of the residency costs.  
 
More information about the Vermont Studio Center can be found here:
http://www.vermontstudiocenter.org/intro-video/
 
For donating certain amounts, you may claim the perks listed on the right (my writing services or copies of my creative work).  You may also donate without claiming any of the perks.  Even $5 will be met with my sincere gratitude!

story:
Hello, My name’s Jacqueline Gabbitas.

I’m a poet and I’ve just completed a book-length environmental poem called The Book of Grass. It looks at the world from the viewpoint of grass – and with 11,000 different names for grass it’s a pretty big viewpoint – from rye to barley to bamboo to lemon-grass to hairy-flowered woollybutt (I’m not joking!).

But this crowdfunding campaign isn’t about The Book of Grass, it’s about a dozen or so grass poems and a publisher, Stonewood Press.

Stonewood Press is a young, independent publisher in the UK. It’s owned by Martin Parker (one of the editors of Brittle Star magazine) and it champions new writing. It publishes poetry (including my own Earthworks pamphlet) and short fiction (with a little science fantasy thrown in for good measure).

In the first few years of its life Stonewood has published work from almost twenty new writers in anthologies, full collections, novels and pamphlets; with more titles in production.

Like a lot of small independents it’s a labour of love, and, as a Stonewood author, I wondered what else I could do to support it.

I’d finished The Book of Grass just before Christmas, then had bit of a brain-wave – I’d take a selection from it and produce a pamphlet to raise funds for Stonewood Press. I asked a friend of mine, the celebrated children’s book author Frances Barry, to produce artworks for it and she didn’t have to be asked twice. And the artworks absolutely beautiful.

The pamphlet is Small Grass. It comes as a paperback, a hardback and a signed limited edition – all of which are available in our indiegogo campaign.

The comedian Mark Thomas once said that if you ask a thousand people for £1 each not only do you have a thousand pounds, but a thousand ambassadors. Just think what £1000 could mean to a small press – three new pamphlets or two books – new voices being heard for the first time or established voices able to take risks they might not take with larger publishers.

And all you’ve given is a £1, and your own voice saying, ‘Yes! This is important! I want to be a part of it’. You’re our new ambassador, and we can’t thank you enough just for that.

But you could give more, and get more in return – we’re offering books and signed copies and original artworks and, in one perk-offer, tea and cake and conversation!

All money raised in this campaign goes to Stonewood Press as well as all the profits from book sales.

£1000 would be amazing, but we’re down to earth and are looking to raise £600 – this will fund two new titles in the coming year and contribute to Stonewood’s promotional material (and the odd packet of tea – it’s thirsty work this publishing!)

Frankie and I have donated our time and work to help a cracking little publisher, and now we’re asking that you help us too – give us £1 and go and tell people about us and our little book, Small Grass.

If you can’t afford £1, then please help us by passing on the news – tweet and facebook and use everything in your power to let people know – go and have a cup of tea and a chat with your best mate, your mum, your colleagues, Aunty Joan and Uncle Burt, and ask them if they know about the hairy-flowered woollybutt or the Mexican sprangletop or hog millett!

And don't forget to use the indiegogo share tools!

Thank you.


**Please note: we cannot pay travel or accommodation expenses for getting to the tea in the perk, Hairy flowered woollybutt.
