story:
A day in the life of Noodles the Cat


Teaching your children how to read a tedious task? "A day in the life of Noodles the Cat"  will change your mind about that, as this frolicking feline will capture the hearts of parents and children alike. 


Tested and approved by kids!


Boost your children's learning potential

We all want the best for your our children. That is why we spend so much time choosing the right schools, so they can get the best education to secure their future. As a parent you can do something very simple, but very powerful for your children. You can boost your children's learning potential by making books an important part of their lives. Studies have shown that reading to your child can prepare him/her for academic excellence. Early reading for toddlers helps them view books as a fun activity and not as a chore. Toddlers who are exposed to reading are much more likely to choose books over video games and television. Reading to your child will also bring the two of you closer together.  Snuggling up with a book recaptures that sweet, cuddly time you enjoyed when your toddler was a baby. 


About the book:

"A day in the life of Noodles the Cat"  is a sweet children's picture book that depicts a day in the life of this adorable cat. Simple rhymes are accompanied with beautiful and colourful pictures of Noodles, providing a simple early lesson in words. Children will connect with this lovely animal. Watch Noodles play, eat and ultimately fall asleep happily, just as your child will upon hearing this endearing story. 


Background

They say owners don't pick their cats, but cats pick their owners. This is certainly true in our case. When we first met Noodles all her siblings were asleep. But not Noodles. She was playful, as to attract our attention it seemed. We immediately fell in love with this cute little kitty 

Like any proud cat owner we couldn't stop taking and sharing her pictures with our family and friends. We noticed they appealed to little children in particular, which is why we decided to write a children's book about her. 

Many children want to know how Noodles spends her day. This book shows Noodles eating, playing and sleeping. We selected pictures to accompany the simple storyline in rhyme to depict a day in the life of Noodles. Hence the title. 


What we do with your contribution

To spread the joy of this cute cat we are planning to get 150 books printed. The goal of $3500 will be enough to purchase an ISBN number for self-publishing and get 150 books printed. 


Feel good about your contribution

We will donate 10% of the proceeds to help our local animal shelter! 


Get these beautiful postcards! 

Other ways you can help

Wishing you could contribute some other way? You can! Help us out by sharing our project with your friends and family!


Social media

Want to know more about Noodles the Cat? You can follow her on:

www.noodlesthecat.com

story:
Ahnee. Welcome to the Kegedonce Press!

We are a First Nations - owned and operated publisher committed to the development, promotion and publication of Indigenous Peoples. 

We strive to foster the creative cultural expression of Indigenous Peoples through the publication of beautifully crafted books which involve Indigenous Peoples in all levels of production and by supporting activities which promote Indigenous literary development and the development of Indigenous publishing.

Why are we reaching out?  Because as a small Indigenous publisher, we have been committed to building an Indigenous literary industry over the last 15 years and often do not fit into mainstream granting requirements.  This means a lot of sacrifice along the way and the growing need to seek support outside of government grants in order to continue building upon what we have achieved. In light of the rising costs of publishing and the diminishing support for Indigenous efforts, OUR voices are needed more than ever!  Help us continue to share the voices of our people from across the land and support Kegedonce Press. 

Emma's Gift is a children book written by Deborah L. Delaronde ( Metis) and illustrated by Jay Odjick (Kitigan Zibi Anishinabeg Algonquin),  The story follows Emma who wants to participate in her community’s annual ‘King’s Day’ celebration that is held every year on January 6th. When Emma’s grandmother hurts herself, Emma reluctantly agrees to help. In helping her grandmother prepare and serve her King’s Day meal, Emma discovers the meaning behind this special day.

story:
What is The Freedom Fairy Tale?

The Freedom Fairy Tale, written by Dr. John Rossi, is a political book for adults to share with younger generations about the battle of Capitalism and Freedom against Communism and Socialism. The struggle for liberty and independence is beautifully and colorfully illustrated by Oscar Senn, renowned Illustrator and traditional painter . This new book was created as Dr. Rossi's way to answer his young daughter's question: "Dad, why is there so much fighting and arguing going on in our country? And for that matter, everywhere else around the world?"

After unsuccessfully answering his daughter's questions that night, Dr. Rossi had a dream which was the inspiration for The Freedom Fairy Tale book. He took that dream, wrote down all the details and explained it to his daughter at which point her response was "Wow dad, now that makes sense!" This simple explanation of a dream has turned into a beautiful educational tool to instill the values, ideas, and ideals that America was founded upon into the next generation. 

The Freedom Fairy Tale has been called the little book with a big picture. This quote really says it all. The book is short and to the point with children in mind. While meant to be accompanied by the explanation of a parent, The Freedom Fairy Tale can be understood by children and adults. It is full of beautiful illustrations that compliment the deeper meanings covered in the book.

In addition to The Freedom Fairy Tale book we have also published a Limited Special Edition version of the book as well as a coloring book that is a beautiful compliment to the story.



Our Mission - 

 We want this story of hope and freedom to be used. We want it in the hands of as many people as possible in an attempt to educate and serve as an example for the children of America. For this we will need your help.



How to help - 

 We have successfully Published The Freedom Fairy Tale, a Limited Special Edition of The Freedom Fairy Tale, and a complimentary coloring book. However, we lack the funds necessary to distribute these books. This is where you come in, we care much more about getting The Freedom Fairy Tale in peoples home's than about making a big profit; so we came here to Indiegogo and lowered our prices for a single copy all the way to a teacher pack of 20 copies.

By Funding The Freedom Fairy Tale you are helping to spread Hope!  Your Support, whether it is a $1 because you believe in the message or $100 so you can have 20 copies and spread hope on your own, counts toward a greater purpose. Your support will make the dream of Freedom more Hope!

story:
Welcome to my Funding Page!

I want to thank you for stopping by! I will try to be short and sweet.

Never an easy endeavor as a writer.

First off, my name is David Partelow. I am a father, author, poet and caffeine addict with denial issues. (No I don't need sleep!) I am also creator of the Sci/Fi world of LORE and its unfolding novels. My work can be found on Amazon.com. I love this racket. I love to write, tell stories and immerse readers in a new adventure. And I am ready to unveil my newest work and get it out to the world.


The Crescent Moon Saga.

With the help of artist, Ingrid Andersen, I have finally brought to life an idea that has been stuck in my head for over 20 years. It is a journey that appeals to children and adults alike. Crescent Moon is a magical world, linked to our own, filled with unforgettable characters, fantasy creatures and adventure. It is a world of balance and harmony, but that balance is constantly threatened by Moreg, a dark evil born of fear. To combat this evil, the world calls upon one known as the Dreamer, a champion drawn from the world of Earth who can resist the evils of Moreg. 

The Dreamer possesses unlimited potential, his powers fueled by pure imagination and belief. Without the Dreamer, the world of Crescent Moon faces the possibility of being thrust forever into darkness. The tales of Crescent Moon center around the Dreamer and the heroes that would fight and stand to summon him. Their adventures will be chronicled in the Prophecy Quests Trilogy, a three part story that follows an elf-fairy, a pantheryn, an imp, an elf, a gnome, a dragon and the Prophet as they attempt to gather the means to bring the Dreamer into their world. Their stories will be continued in the Trilogy of the Dreamer.

And it all starts here with book one: Prophet's Plight

Book One has been written. Ingrid is working hard on the interior illustrations and cover. With your help we will have the time and energy to devote to this project with the attention it deserves. We want to be able to offer a stellar finished product, as well as have the means to promote the world of Crescent Moon. Successful funding will go towards setting a release date (Sometime in the next 2-4 months depending on funding), promotion and creating Crescent Moon products, including subsequent novels. 

No matter your donation level, you will be included in the action and the finished product of Prophet's Plight, including signed bookmarks and trade paperbacks. You may even have the chance to influence the future of this magical world! I have set a large goal, as I would love to see Crescent Moon take flight. But no matter what amount we reach, your rewards are assured! Donating to this project gets you included in the book's acknowledgement, as well as the chance to get your hands on Prophet's Plight before it is made available to the public. Higher tiers allow you to have a character fashioned and named with your help to be included in future novels! You can even have book two or three dedicated to you!



There are Other Ways You Can Help!

While we are grateful for any financial support to help us get this project off the ground, there are many ways you can help Crescent Moon

  • Like us at our Facebook page for Crescent Moon. You can also get a glimpse of Crescent Moon with a sample of Prophet's Plight.
  • Tell your friends about this page and our Facebook page!
  • Know someone who likes fantasy worlds and adventure? Have them check us out!
  • Remember that every share, like and link exposes Crescent Moon to new people and potential fans!
Once again, I thank you for checking out Crescent Moon and its first novel, Prophet's Plight. Please feel free to ask any questions. We will also include stretch goals if our target goal is reached. Thanks for giving us a chance and believing. I assure you, the world and adventures of Crescent Moon have only just begun!

Higher tiers allow you to have a character fashioned and named with your help to be included in future novels! You can even have book two or three dedicated to you!There are Other Ways You Can Help!While we are grateful for any financial support to help us get this project off the ground, there are many ways you can help Crescent Moon

Like us at our Facebook page for Crescent Moon. You can also get a glimpse of Crescent Moon with a sample of Prophet's Plight.

Tell your friends about this page and our Facebook page!
Know someone who likes fantasy worlds and adventure? Have them check us out!
Remember that every share, like and link exposes Crescent Moon to new people and potential fans!
Once again, I thank you for checking out Crescent Moon and its first novel, Prophet's Plight. Please feel free to ask any questions. We will also include stretch goals if our target goal is reached. Thanks for giving us a chance and believing. I assure you, the world and adventures of Crescent Moon have only just begun!

story:
What is the Purpose of This Project?

It is about helping young men and women feel more comfortable in their own skin.

Your donation to this project will help us write a book to help as many as youth understand most importantly the following important life lessons:

1.  You are NOT a freak (even though we all feel like it sometimes)

2.  “Normal” is a lie

3.  Understanding your “Natural State” is important (using the Myers Briggs Type Indicator)

4.  How to map your goals based on and understanding of your “Natural State.”

We ask you to donate and help us bring this book, curriculum to fruition and help as many youth as we can.

Our fundraising deadline is January 31st, we would appreciate your donation between now and then to raise as much toward our goal as possible.

Here's the Skinny on Shawne and Bennie!

Our names are Ben Wallace and Shawne Johnson.  We have each been working and volunteering with youth for more than 15 years.  One thing we have seen as a universal need among youth (and adults) is to better understand who they authentically are as human beings.  

This project stems from a labor of love to help youth find a method for better understanding who they are, what they need, how to cope with, and hopefully thrive in the chaotic and ever-changing world around them.  This is a need that transcends gender, age, race, sexual orientation, or economic situation; it is a natural human need to understand who you are and where you fit in the world.  As our working title eludes to, a map is useless if you don't know which direction you are facing in relation to the world around you.  You need a "Compass" or a true idea of who you authentically are to help you head in the right direction.

This book isn't about leadership, although we think leadership is important.  This book is about using the Meyers Briggs Type Indicator (MBTI) as a foundation for developing a better understanding of who each of our authentic selves is and how that compares to the expected selves that we must become in various situations (conforming to what parents tell you to do, fitting it with friends, at work, at school, in relationships).  Some of the "expected self" roles are positive and some are negative, but regardless we must understand how our emotional bank accounts are affected when we are required to be someone different from our "authentic self."  We also need to understand how to recharge and replenish our emotional bank accounts and in some cases even learn new tools or behaviors that we an use to lessen the emotional cost of adapting to our environment.

We believe that this book will be a powerful tool for helping youth and adults better understand why they are the way they are, and how to deal with the curve balls that life throws at them.  For many readers, this will be a chance to get to know themselves better.  However for youth and adults sometimes bewildered by or frustrated with the world around them, this understanding of how to care for their emotional needs and the process of developing an understanding of their authentic self could be the difference between thriving in life and giving up.

Along with the book, we will be creating curriculum that will help organizations, youth groups, work teams, and others better understand how to be more effective individuals and team members with those around them.

We want to help the world become a happier, successful place for as many people as possible and we believe that this project will make a real impact in the lives of people all around the world from all walks of life.  And we need your help to make it happen.

What We Need and What You Get!

We need your help hitting our fundraising goal.  The money we raise will fund our tuition to go through the MBTI Certification Program as well as the use of the MBTI assessment to work with focus and target groups as we finish the book and develop the curriculum. While we have a lot of experience with the MBTI assessment, we feel strongly that our final product will be more effective and better received if we have gone through the certification process.

You have the opportunity to get a wonderful variety of perks ranging from being one of the first to get a copy of the book all the way up to getting your name in the acknowledgements of the book and even a personalized session to go through your Meyers Briggs assessment results and look at how that knowledge can help you.

Haven't you ever wanted to have your name in a book!?  Wouldn't you love to know more about yourself and how your natural "quirks" could be working in your favor?

There are a range of perks and we tried to make sure that there are perk levels that would be accessible to everyone.  We appreciate any level of support that you can provide.

If for some reason we don't attain our goal (which we are hoping won't be an issue) we will use the funds we do raise to get as far in our efforts towards the certifications and final product as we can.  We WILL get there, we just need your help to make it happen inside of a decade... 

Helping to Make a Real Impact 

This book has the potential to open up a perspective on who we are and how to navigate the chaos of life that we don't feel has been discussed before.  Some may have eluded to it, but we think our approach is valuable and unique.  We aren't in this to get rich, we are in this to help improve the lives and perspectives of as many people as we can.  

If you have ever remembered a time in your life when you felt lost, this book is for you.  If you have ever felt like the world was happening around you and you couldn't understand why, this book is for you.  If you have ever felt like you were a freak who didn't fit in and that you were the only one that felt that way, this book is for you.  

Even if you can't identify with any of the statements above (which we find highly unlikely) know that there are millions of youth and adults who do feel like this every day. If we are able to reach just one youth with this book and help them make the decision that they are normal and worthy, then we have succeeded.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can afford to give large amounts or maybe not any at all.  Regardless of whether you are able to contribute to our campaign, we would appreciate your help in sharing our message and our cause.  We think that it is worthy of the few minutes it took you to read about it and hopefully you are inspired to tell others about what we are trying to do.  Thanks for your support!

story:
HI, THIS CAMPAIGN HAS BEEN CREATED FOR YOU, WHO WOULD LIKE TO PRE-BOOK A COPY FROM THE NEW EDITION OF OSLO FOR MOTHERS. 

But other contributions are also welcomed.

It is possible to make contributions already from $1!!!

Every penny is greatly appreciated and will be well used.


Good NEWS!

The first edition of Oslo for Mothers got sold out in less than 4 months.
Therefore I decided to launch a new edition of Oslo for Mothers.
The new edition is 60 pages longer and there are plenty of new topics included:
Birth experiences from international mums, MMB (mums meaning business), diplomats, where to get free nappy boxes,  and much more!


PRE-BOOKING IS AVAILABLE ONLY FOR A LIMITED NUMBER OF COPIES


Launch date: Launch date for the first batch of the new edition is set to be the first week of December.
Price: New price will be 179 NOK, 30 USD.
Background

My name is Katalin Galambos and I’ve been living in Norway for more than four years with my family consisting of two small kids. Both of my kids were born during our stay here and thus I have been lucky to experience Norway’s impressing family and child centric environment. Being a mum is an everyday challenge and even more in a new society with different cultural background. In order to manage the daily operational issues with your children and settle in, you need to put much more effort in finding your way, than if you were a local. There is so much information you need to know!

In this book we have identified the typical challenging areas for expat parents in Oslo and would like to make it available for:


  • the ones already living her,
  • the ones that are just arriving,
  • and the ones planning to move here


Your fund is mutually beneficial. You will be among the first ones to get your copy while helping me to tackle the risk of self publishing.


My sincere thanks to: Coralie Denisey (participant writer), Emma Prunty (partiipant writer), Babou Olengha-Aaby (participant writer), Borbala Losonczy (participant writer), Zoe Harris (editor), Rita Vigovszky (graphic designer and illustrator), Mustaza, Paola, Claudia, Magda, Alexandra, Polina Østenvig, Judy Ellis, Istvan Virag, Model Vralstad, Joy Contreras Henri, Suzy Winspear, Tiffany Cheng, Elena Koshman, Petra Abraham, Gro van Blerk. Spanish version: Diana Espinoza (participant writer) Rosario Herrero (editor) Chinese version, Sofia Kuo (translator), Lucy Hsieh, Yvette Fang ...
...and to YOU who share my vision!

As a non working full time mother in Oslo I have dedicated extensive time to write this book but now need help with funds to get it printed. Any contribution counts enormously towards my goal of giving a useful guide to those expat mums who raise or plan to raise kids in Norway. On behalf of all the international mums living at this moment in Oslo I would like to thank those of you who choose to support us.

Please accept my sincere thanks for believing in this project!

story:
The Project

The Salvation Shark is the story of Becki Murphy, a teen pop star disillusioned with her fame. She meets Anton Lazarus, who claims to be the Devil, and promises to make all her problems go away if she commits one justified murder.

Originally published in 2010-11 in Laugh at Yourself First, the Salvation Shark is making its way to print. That's where I need you. Your generous donation  will help cover the print costs, and the live appearances to support the book.

You can read the novel right now on your Kindle. It costs $5, but you can download the entire novel on your Kindle for free July 15th.

 

How to Help

I grew up punk rock and believe in DIY. I publish through printisbetter books, my indie publishing house. I write, edit, design, and format, and publish through CreateSpace. The Salvation Shark will be available in print through Amazon September 10th. Meeting my goal will help me produce a print run of 200 books to sell and distribute for reviews.

Donors of $50 or more will receive a copy a month prior to the release date. Donors of $100 or more will receive acknowledgment in the text. Donors of $200 will be thanked and receive a limited edition hardcover. There are more great perks on the sidebar. With everything, you get my deepest appreciation.

 

Who I Am

The Salvation Shark is my third novel, after Here in This Sorrow in 2004 and Dollars Per Hour in 2005. Both were republished through my fiction blog, Laugh at Yourself First, which became www.printisbetter.com. I believe in DIY art and Copyleft I enjoy ebooks because they allow me to give as much of my writing away at a minimal cost to both me and my reader. I think print is better, and I want books to be something special to be kept on the shelf for a generation.

Last year I published Danglehorn, my first book for children, about an elephant and rhinoceros that must work together to protect their land and food. I performed in schools and libraries across New York to elementary audiences excited to trumpet like an elephant and sign their name in a notebook made from elephant poop. I also write a monthly column in the legendary National Police Gazette, which was reborn in my hometown, Binghamton, NY., after 30 years of dormancy. The magazine is distributed free, and in addition to classic material, the NPG features sports, music, theater, politics, and crime. www.policegazette.us

In 2011 I starred in "The Demon Messenger," a low-budget horror film about a group of activists that summon a monster to combat a ruthless oil company in Upstate, NY. Prior, I was president of Theatricks by Starlight and bringing from the page to the stage 19 original scripts, including my own, "Sweet Chastity in Wonderland," "The Legend of the Ghost of Dracula's Cook," "Jack the Ripper Doesn't Exist," and the original "Danglehorn."

In my Day Job, I work as a school portrait photographer, putting me literally every day on stage under hot lights performing live for the most notoriously unpredictable audiences imaginable. Through this work, I've learned more about writing and live performance than any time in theatre. I enjoy promoting my writing through travel.

Pass It Along

In the words of Henry Rollins, "I'd rather be read than paid." I don't want to disuade you as a reader because you don't have anything to spare. Even buying an ebook will be a help, or wait for a free day. If you download my story free and lend it to a friend, Amazon will pay me. Maybe there is such a thing as a free lunch. Don't have a Kindle? I have several books in print through Amazon, or if you dig deep enough, you can find my blog, Laugh at Yourself First, where I published hundreds of stories free for the reading. If you enjoy, please tell a friend.

Check out the pictures and additional video on this campaign to check out the perks you'll receive if you donate. Contact me if you have any questions, or visit www.printisbetter.com

story:
So Vain Books is the independent publishing house for books and magazines that creates an exciting and glamorous world for the stylish, sassy and ambitious young woman and will give you the most exclusive insights into the fashion and beauty world. Be part of the glamorous world by backing us up and enjoying all the great perks that we have created exclusively for you!

Who we are

We are a team of young, ambitious and enthusiastic people who have extensive experience in fashion media, PR and publishing. We have been incredibly fortunate to meet and work with many talented fashion and beauty bloggers and therefore we have been exposed to their great influence over their dedicated followers. This sales force has been significantly exploited by all the top fashion and beauty brands for years, although we felt it still remains partly unexplored by the publishing world, and so as a result the idea for So Vain Books was born! 

Our aim is to offer the readers of the most glamorous and fabulous bloggers and youtubers a chance to loose themselves in an inspiring and engaging book written by their idols. The books will include all new content, give exclusive insights in the fashion and beauty world and will be written in a witty and really engaging way. We will also give readers a chance to meet the authors at glamorous red-carpet events, get their copy signed and interact with them and other fans! Not only will we offer face to face interaction at such events but also virtual ones through our website and social networks, by creating an online community for all girls in love with the world of fashion, beauty and all that it involves.

And we are not going to stop here! In order to find the most talented, enthusiastic writers we will be launching a very exciting competition for first-time authors (or self-published ones)! The winner's novel will be published by us and distributed to all the major bookstores in the U.K. and online! The novel will  incorporate the glamorous style and ethos of our brand name and so the main themes will revolve around "Glamour. Love. Sex”, similar to the genre of The devil wears Prada, Gossip Girl and Sex and the City.

We are well aware that our project is an ambitious one, however we are extremely passionate and truly believe that So Vain Books has huge potential. We have confidence that we will be able to bring the project to life while managing to find the best and most profitable way to do just that, thanks to our great expertise ranging from business to finance, from fashion to PR. We also have the right attitude and the ‘know-how’ needed to be sure that So Vain Books will grow and be the topic of conversation on everyone's lips for yeas to come!


5 Good Reasons For Backing us and Why We Need You To

  1. You will truly enter and be involved in the glamorous world of So Vain Books. You will feel part of our thriving community and be the first to know about everything related to it.

  2. You can have the chance of not only making this dream world a reality, but also receive for free our first e-books, printed books and even SIGNED copies sent right to your doorstep.

  3. You can also receive (and win!) an exclusive V.I.P. invitation to one of our glamorous red-carpet book launch events. This unique invitation will include: no queuing at entry, walking the red-carpet with your favourite bloggers/youtubers while capturing the moment on your camera, a personalized goodie bag with extra So Vain products inside and an extra complementary glass of champagne!! This is an exclusive invitation for a limited number of people, so be sure not to miss out on this fabulous opportunity!

  4. By following our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/SoVainBooks you will have the chance to receive even more of our So Vain benefits including extra e-books, signed copies and, who knows, maybe a V.I.P. invitation!

  5. We are a vulcano of ideas and energy and over the next few years we are planning to do truly great things, so we need YOU to make all of these amazing ideas a reality for YOU!

Our goal is to raise £6,000 in order to kick start the project, this will involve being able to register the society, sign the contracts with the authors and create and launch our exciting and interactive website! This money will be vital to be able to start the project so that we can fulfill all our promises made to you.

If we will not reach our entire goal ( hopefully this won’t be the case), then we will still put the money raised to good use in order to get So Vain Books started and we make sure to deliver everything to you on time.

When It Will All Happen

We already publish a really glamorous and well-established online fashion magazine called So Vain magazine ( www.sovainmagazine.com ) and we are in the process of talking with some amazing fashion bloggers who we think will be ideal candidates to publish great books. At the end of november we will also be launching our exciting novel competition (as explained before).

Our plan is to start releasing our first books in september 2014. We will make sure that you are kept updated throughout the year and you will be able to follow the latest developments of the up coming books on the authors' blogs which we will create on our website from the beginning of 2014!

Other Ways You Can Help

Loving the project but feel unable to contribute? 

Another way you can help us out and make a difference is by sharing our campaign with all your friends and family and to spread the word about So Vain Books to everyone you meet! You'll still be part of our glamorous world and we really appreciate your support!

DON'T FORGET to follow our Facebook page and other social media profiles for the latest news on blogger and fashion updates and of course get exclusive extra goodies and enter our fabulous competitions!

story:
Taking The Next Step is a Guide for parents to inform them of a better process to prepare their sons and daughters for college. This book starts from the eighth through the eleventh grade. This book prepares the parents as well as the students in this process to get early admission, scholarships, fee waivers for SAT/ACT as well as application fees for colleges. We are hoping this book will better assist in lessening much of the financial stress that comes with attending college. We believe this book will help many families in this stressful economic environment.

story: Nelson, a 32 year old instruction manual writer, is having trouble asking out Sophie, a 30 year old used bookstore clerk. Through seemingly random circumstances Nelson ends up meeting a 28 year old, eccentric, astrology loving girl named Trish and going on a few adventures with her where he learns that its OK to fight for himself once in a while. When Nelson and Trish go to the local coffee house they accidently run into Sophie. In a normal circumstance this would be great for Nelson, but with Trish basically wrapped around his arm its making the situation awkward. When Nelson and Trish get back to his place they have an argument about the situation which reveals that Trish meeting Nelson was no accident at all and that she planned on meeting him from the very beginning. Just as it looks like Nelson is about to give into Trish’s last attempt at having him, he breaks it off and runs back to the bookstore to ask out Sophie.

story:
Where's The Sidewalk?

When my son was little, and I took him hiking, he asked "Where's the sidewalk?" and at that point, I decided to dedicate my time to getting kids into nature. When my then 5 year old son learned how to get me in and out of the woods by using trail markers he became empowered and excited to keep going out. He felt proud, and independent. Like he could be a leader.  I knew I was onto something. We are on the cusp of turning this environmental education project into a non-profit called Dirty Boots, and these books will help fund the cause. 

Jack's Pack is about what Jack puts in his pack to navigate through nature safely and with an adventurous purpose, all with respect and appreciation for the land.  BUT WE NEED HELP! 

What We Need & What You Get

I am a mom on a budget, with a lot of passion, and a lot of people waiting for Dirty Boots to happen!  I want every kid out there, getting dirty, having fun, and becoming empowered by their abilities! 

I am an artist, a writer, and a nature enthusiast. I am using every skill I have to get this thing off the ground, and the way I can fund this project is to use my best skills to make the funds happen through books that will fund the project for me to pay for this to become a non-profit.  My campaign is in place to raise money to publish the books, and a portion of these proceeds pay for my time, and start-up costs for Dirty Boots.

BE A PART OF THIS AMAZING PROJECT! Every donation over $20 gets something! Books, signed books, artwork prints and Dirty Boots swag! 

If I don't reach my goal, the money still goes to printing as many books as I can to sell to raise money for Dirty Boots. 

The Impact

Dirty Boots is an environmental education project aiming to educate children in the schools and on the trail, all the way through high school, and into college, progressively getting students critically thinking about the environment, the impact our choices make and steps we can take to live within it from a sustainable restorative perspective, and eventually volunteering, and ultimately restoring depleted areas around the globe.  

This fully written and illustrated book is one of many that are in the works. The goal is for this book to pave the way for the others to create a sustainable funding resource for Dirty Boots.  The books will present a gateway toward additional funding by organizations in support of this cause by carrying this book for sale in their storefronts and online shops. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are short on funds, you can still help by telling your family and friends in person, on Facebook or anyway you can, to support what we are trying to do! Any help in any way is appreciated!

story:
Dockside: Kim and Eric Embrace Crowdfunding to Realize Dreams

"The book developed a schizophrenic disorder having both the personality of a rockumentary and techno-geek how-to book. I didn’t know if the multiple personality perspective would work or not, but now that it is done, I can see we have a book rich in detail about both what Kim and Eric went through to make their crowdfund a success and the detail of how to use the technologies yourself."

When Kim and Eric Stone wedded their futures and proclaimed "We're all in" for Dockside Tropical Cafe, I was intrigued. When they invited me to stay with them on their boat in the Keys and see their crowdfunding unfold to generated much needed funds to launch their dreams, I was completely blown way. I wanted to be involved. I wanted to write the book, now before you, that explains the path from dreams through crowdfunding to reality all through the eyes of the people who made it happen.

I hope you will find that Dockside: Kim and Eric Embrace Crowdfunding to Realize Dreams is a unique book and almost a unique genre in that it combines the how to explanations of crowdfunding with a rockumentry-like description of what what Kim and Eric went through to make their dream a reality. I want readers to realize their own dreams. I also want them to look at their projects with their eyes wide open, knowing that crowdfunding is a great tool, but it is not magic. Hard work, perseverance, and a little dose of reality can make your adventure become a dream come true.

Whether you need ideas to help you accomplish your dream or you just want to learn more about what Eric and Kim have managed to accomplish, this book will be a memorable read. We will dive right into the crowdfund and let you know how success happened there, but we will also look back and see how Kim and Eric came to this point in their lives. In some ways, Dockside Tropical Cafe may seam like a glamorous overnight success. The reality is Kim and Eric have brought a lifetime of experiences and dreams together for this exciting time.

"What this book does that no other book does to the same extent is to treat social networking technology as a set of integrated tools that work in concert with a community. It also recognizes that you, the potential crowdfunder, are part of a community and your project can gain life through your community more than it will through your relationship with your computer tools."

Join the Adventure!

We have captured the data, analyzed the success stories, written the draft and consulted with a word class editor. We have some great content and we want you to join with us to being it to life in a library quality hard cover edition. It is funny in a way that we are talking about the high-tech subject of crowdfunding and focusing on the preparation of a hard cover printed edition of the book. We know that fans of Eric and Kim and students of crowdfunding will cherish this keepsake, maybe even the more in our digital word.

By participating in the rewards program at the level that is best for you, you will becoming an integral part of seeing this project through its final stage.
Choose a Level!

Picture of Sombrero Beach, down the street from Dockside Tropical Cafe. We celebrated the design of the mashup burgers here with the staff in Fall, 2013.

story:
Short Summary

Picture yourself sitting at the final table at the 2012 World Series of Poker Main Event, you look across the table and there sits Daniel Negreanu. You guys are heads-up and the winner can take home $8.9 million dollars. Well this could be a reality for an amateur poker player from Davenport, Iowa. Ryan York entered The Arc of Quad Cities Area Fundraiser Texas Holdem Tournament, with 303 entrants, after hours and hours at the tables he eventually won a seat to the WSOP Main Event ($10,000).  Ryan will be making it to the WSOP main event on July 9th, 2012 and making a run at the bracelet.

My name is Stephan Booth and I am an up and coming filmmaker, I brought up this idea to Ryan to do a documentary about his win and play in the WSOP Main Event. I want to bring the world his story. He has been playing poker for about 10 years now, since family obligations made him get “real” job, meanwhile he has been working on his skills in local tournaments and cash tables. I am currently a student at Full Sail University getting my bachelor’s degree in Video Cinematography, eventually adding a Master’s in New Media Journalism.

I would like to bring his story to the big screen. This campaign is to raise funds to make a documentary that follows Ryan from his home to Las Vegas, Nevada for the WSOP Main Event. I would like to document his preparations for the tournament, his tournament play, and his tournament results. There will be other background information including interviews from family, friends and possible poker players.

The magnitude of your contributions, big or small, will help get out Ryan’s story and how he made it to the WSOP Main Event. This is my first film project, not only are you helping Ryan to become an idol in his local area, you are also helping an up and coming filmmaker breakout and show the world his skills.

What We Need & What You Get

 The funding will be broken down in this way:

Equipment Upgrades:  $3,000

Sony Pro Camcorder:    $1499

Accessories: $767

(I know it doesn’t add up but I do need the money so I added little extra to compensate for the fee from INDIEGOGO)

Editing Services/Visual Effects: $2,700

 (Examples: Production Company help)

(Reasoning: I am currently in school for this, however, I just started so I don’t know exactly how to do this yet. I want to use a known production company to produce the work to meet the contributors and characters expectations)

Marketing: $1500

(I need this to make cds and advertise for this documentary)

Trip Expenses for the Crew: $1885

Hotel: (6 nights at $100)  $600

Car Rental: (Midsize car for the week)  $355

Food: (2 people at $30 dollars a day) $480

Gas: (gas to get there and back) $450

Miscellaneous:  $1,000

 (I just have a feeling I am missing something, so I added this just in case.)

Now the perks are exciting:

          Red Perk:  Ever wondered what it would look like with your name in a credit of a movie? With $25 contribution you get your name in the credits and a free copy of the documentary.

          White Perk: Ever wondered what it would look like with your name in a credit of a movie? With $50 contribution you get your name in the credits and a free autographed copy of the documentary.

         Blue Perk: Ever wondered what it would look like with your name in a credit of a movie? With $100 contribution you get your name in the credits and a free autographed copy of the documentary. Autographed picture of the Ryan York.

         Bronze Perk: Ever wondered what it would look like with your name in a credit of a movie? With a $250 contribution you get your name in the credits and a free autographed copy of the documentary. Autographed memorabilia. You will be credited for the contributions and as an Honorary Cameraman.

         Silver Perk: Ever wondered what it would look like with your name in a credit of a movie? With a $500 contribution you get your name in the credits and a free autographed copy of the documentary. Autographed memorabilia. You will be credited for the contributions and as an Assistant Producer.

         Gold Perk:  Ever wondered what it would look like with your name in a credit of a movie? With a $1,000 contribution you get your name in the credits and a free autographed copy of the documentary. Autographed memorabilia. You will be credited for the contributions and as an Co-Director/Co-Producer.

All of the perks are subject to change, and only be changed to enhance the perks, never to take away anything.

 

These perks sounds great to me. How about you? Tell me what you think I should add to them. You can contact me at s.booth0128@gmail.com.

 All funds received will go into the making of this documentary.  If by chance it exceeds the amount, the difference will go into making this documentary even better. Don’t hesitate and get your self a copy of the documentary today. 

The Impact

      

    This project will be of great value to the contributor and to the world because it will show how a lower middle class person, with hard work and determination to make it to the big show.  I have been talking to Ryan about this project and he wants to show our local community, how a local guy can climb out of the “ghettos” and strive in the poker community.  Meanwhile, I want to show the contributors and the world what kind of impact I can have on the world and it will also help me realize my dream of making a GOOD documentary. See you have a chance to “knock out two birds with one stone”, first you will be helping Ryan getting his name out in our local community and Stephan, helping him make his first film a WINNER.

As stated above this will be my first project. I hope to earn your trust and respect with all the transparency in my campaign. I will not let your hard earned money to go to waste. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Due to some financial restraints some of you cannot contribute money. This I do understand, however, you can spread the word VIRALLY and post this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter accounts and word of mouth works great as well. Also can you use the Indiegogo share tools that are provided for you. Also if you have any other ways of contributing to the campaign, I am open ears. Thanks for your time viewing our campaign. We hope the best for you and your world…..

story:
In the mid-1930's a girl comes of age in a rural Vermont town. Her life will later take her through war and into a short modeling career. Later, into politics and performing. This girl was my grandmother and my mentor into adulthood. 

I aim to write her story from a fictional perspective through recollections provided by town residents, research via the historical society, and my own imagination. Funding this project will help provide the means for hands on research at the early stages of the writing process.  I appreciate your generosity and any contribution will help.

story:
Empowering Democracy through digital tools.

In the wake of the economic crisis and in a country where politics has all too often been beset by scandals and corruption, Vouliwatch aims to help develop an open and accountable political system that uses new digital technology to promote citizen participation in the political process and to rebuild trust in parliamentary democracy. In the heyday of Ancient Greek democracy, citizens actively participated in political dialogue, and Vouliwatch aims to revive this essential aspect of a democratic society through the use of digital technology.

How it actually works!

Vouliwatch is a digital platform that offers Greek citizens the opportunity to publicly question MPs and MEPs on the topic of their choice, and to hold their elected representatives accountable for their parliamentary activity. It is loosely modelled on similar initiatives that are already running successfully in other countries (Ireland, Luxemburg, Tunisia, Germany, France and Austria).

Ask your MP and MEP

MPs and MEPs can post a public response to users' questions and comments, bringing them closer to the citizens they represent and giving them the chance to engage in public dialogue, learning what issues are close to their voters' hearts and allowing them to better represent their constituencies. Each MP and MEP has a devoted page on the website which details their CV, full contact details, committee activity and voting behaviour. 

Crowdsourcing/bottom up approach

The platform also gives users the chance to influence political debate and to focus the attention of both the media and the politicians on issues that citizens believe are important and are not being discussed widely.Vouliwatch offers citizens the chance to share their ideas and experiences and to make proposals to parliament for political action. The community of users can then comment on and rate them. A Google map application depicts all submitted data with the option of filtering based on different criteria (location; subject categories such as e.g. education, tourism, etc.). Every 2 months all submitted data is summarized in a report and sent to all MPs by our team, as food for thought and action. Vouliwatch will then publish and promote any resulting parliamentary reaction.

Topic of the month

Each month the editing team of Vouliwatch chooses a topical political theme for online discussion and analysis. We then organise live open debates based on the above where citizens get the chance to discuss and exchange with MPs, academics and experts on the issue at hand.

Votewatch

Votewatch is our latest application which allows users to keep an eye on the voting behaviour of each MP while informing the public on the details and background information of each legislation.

Why support us?

At Vouliwatch we believe that democracy is not only about voting once every 4 years, but that a truly representative democracy must include citizens more actively at every level of the process. Vouliwatch's digital platform provides a tool to allow this, but we need your help and support to continue to do so.

Vouliwatch, an independent, registered non for profit organisation, has been up and running since mid March 2014. The project has been self financed and its activities supported by volunteer and pro-bono work. We are proud to say that despite the lack of sufficient funding, the weak digital culture in our country and the overall unstable political climate, our impact has so far been surprisingly positive. Our platform counts more than 1000 registered users, 10.000 unique monthly visitors while about 500 questions and proposals have been submitted so far to the profiles of MPs who in turn have started to respond regularly! Our social media pages have more than 7.000 followers and our presence in the mainstream media has been very frequent. Moreover during this period we have successfully organized 2 topical political public workshops where citizens had the chance to debate and engage with their elected representatives face to face.

These first few months proved that our project has great potential but we want Vouliwatch to grow even bigger and stronger in terms of its scope, activities and outreach. We estimate that for the maintenance of our platform, the development of new digital applications and the launch of our awareness raising campaign we will need €20.000 in 2015.  

Specifically, your donations will allow us to:

  • Cover the maintenance costs of our platform for the next year!
  • Strengthen our awareness raising campaign which includes: the printing and distribution of Vouliwatch leaflets, access to advertising space on websites (banners), the creation of a series of promotional animated videos targeted at younger audiences and the organisation of events such as political debates with the active participation of citizens!
  • Introduce new innovative democracy promoting tools to our platform which will significantly enhance its scope and impact, Namely: the "policy monitoring tool" which will allow citizens to compare, contrast, have a say and potentially influence official party positions on a set of topical issues (i.e. immigration, austerity,unemployment). The "candidatewatch" which during pre election periods will serve as a tool for citizens to publicly question and get to know their potential representatives in the parliament!
  • Grow as an orgainsation, reach a wider audience and make a change! 
Vouliwatch stands for more accountability, transparency and bottom up participation. Be part of the change, join our efforts to empower democracy in Greece by contributing to this campaign!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
I'm Kevin Patrick Sullivan co-founder and curator of the ANNUAL SAN LUIS OBISPO POETRY FESTIVAL/CORNERS OF THE MOUTH. I'm originally from Dearborn Hgts. Michigan, and I've lived here on the central coast of California since 1975. I'm a high school graduate and I'm a Grounds 1 at San Luis Coastal Unified School District here in San Luis Obispo where I have worked for the past 23 years.  I have enriched my life beyond measure, when I decided to become a poet in 1980 and then several years later co-founding a poetry festival and a monthly reading series. Over the years the community has been enriched as well. We have raised money for the local literacy and arts councils. We have worked with the California Arts Council, the City of SLO, Cal Poly University and Poets and Writers Inc.

Times are tough right now and I'm asking you to help me fund the 30th Annual SLO Poetry Festival for poet honorariums and funding for a literary journal titled LANGUAGE OF THE SOUL A Celebration of 30 Years at the San Luis Obispo Poetry Festival. I want to pay all the poets, except for the open readers participating a minimum of $100. The rest will go towards the journal. It will be a big book. Its contributors will come from the 30 years of the festival and even from the Corners of the Mouth, the monthly reading series I've held at Linnaea's Cafe in downtown SLO since 1984.

Your contributions will make real in the world, the many voices heard over the years, voices like Ray Clark Dickson, Glenna Luschei, Hernan Castellano Giron, Ann Candelaria, Lorna Dee Cerventes, Sam Hamill, Eavan Boland, Carol Muskie Dukes, Al Young, Clayton Eshleman, Eleanor Lerman and Nellie Wong to name just a few. This will be an extraordinary anthology of contempoary American Poetry. It will be a delight to hold in your hands, the words of the poet coming to life with your breath. This is what we can do together, we can make a beautiful book and a joyful noise. I do have experience in publishing and as an editor.  This will not be my first go around. Please be generous. 

I'm asking for $10,000. The way I figure it I'll need at minimum $1,500 for the honorariums. That will leave $8,500 for the book. I'll need PDF files, book design and outright printing costs. There will be mailing costs for contributors copies and web site updating costs for selling the book on line. There will be advertising cost as well. Check out our website at www.languageofthesoul.org  

Look for us on Face Book at ANNUAL SAN LUIS OBISPO POETRY FESTIVAL / CORNERS OF THE MOUTH.

Every donation of $50.00 or more will receive a copy of the book once it is printed. My goal is to have the book published in time for the 31st ANNUAL SLO POETRY FESTIVAL next Noveber. Please help, small or large donations everything counts.  

If I don't reach my goal the 30th ANNUAL SAN LUIS OBISPO POETRY FESTIVAL will still go on, I guess I won't pay all the poets. I will publish the anthology perhaps it will be a smaller version. It will be availble for the 31st ANNUAL SLO POETRY FESTIVAL and everybody who contributed $50.00 or more will get a copy of the anthology.

Please donate, and know that you have helped bring into this world a work of beauty. A wonderful poetry anthology that celebrates a time and place. The place San Luis Obispo, California. The time 1984 to 2013. Thirty years of poetry, of the spoken word. 30 years of poems held in your hands, 30 years mining the language of the soul.  

Tell all your friends and neighbors about what we are doing here in SLO, CA.. Use whatever tools are availble, exspecaially the Indiegogo share tools. Every donation helps.

Thanks, with a heart and a hand, Kevin.

story:
Antología de 100+ Jóvenes Poetas Contemporáneas

¡Hola! Somos Liberoamérica (.com), una plataforma literaria de más de 800 autoras y autores jóvenes constituida en torno a la literatura contemporánea, la cultura latinoamericana, el pensamiento transnacional, la integración y la pluralidad sociales y la igualdad étnica, cultural, de género, clase, credo, cuerpo y orientación sexual.

Tenemos preparada nuestra primera antología poética de autoras jóvenes, con más de 100 poetas de toda América Latina, Portugal y España, llenas de ilusión por compartir su obra de forma internacional. Para ayudarlas, queremos dar a conocer sus versos en un libro que ya hemos publicado en Argentina y Uruguay y que comenzaríamos a distribuir en España a partir de noviembre si este crowdfunding tiene éxito.

Nuestras autoras son:​
ARGENTINA · Andrea Aguirre · Brenda Anaquel Anaya · Nía Cabellos · Mere Echagüe · Sol Fantín · Sol Iametti · Carla Olivera · Gaby Sambuccetti · Micaela Szyniak · Katya Vázquez Schröder · BOLIVIA · Lucía Carvalho · Carolina Hoz de Vila · Marcia Mendieta · Estenssoro · Andrea Puente Mancilla · Carla Reyes · Melissa Sauma · Nelly Vázquez Jiménez · Jess Velarde · BRASIL · Lisa Alves · Carla Carbatti · Katyuscia Carvalho · Lubi Prates · Nina Rizzi · CARIBE · Thaís Espaillat · Karla Ferrer Arévalo · Yaissa Jiménez · Michelle Ricardo · Sinny · Karol Starocean · Elaine Vilar Madruga · CENTROAMÉRICA · Cynthia Alfaro · Ale Ara · Venus Ixchel Mejía · Corina Rueda Borero · Solange Saballos · Dariela Torres · CHILE · Mariana Camelio · Daniela Catrileo · Gladys González · Fernanda Martínez Varela · América Merino · Valentina Osses · Victoria Ramírez Mansilla · COLOMBIA · Lina Aguirre · Estefanía Angueyra · Natalia Arias Olave · Laura Castillo · Laura Andrea Garzón · Alejandra Lerma · Margarita Losada Vargas · Yeni Zulena Milán Velásquez · Lina Téllez · ECUADOR · Priscila Bustamante · Sara Montaño Escobar · Yuliana Ortiz Ruano · ESPAÑA, GALICIA, EUSKAL HERRIA, CATALUNYA · Andrea Abreu López · Gema Albornoz · Leire Alonso Allué · Núria Armengol · Nerea Campos · Laia Carbonell · Marta Castaño · Ana Castro · Jess Domínguez · Sara Ferro · Izaskun Gracia Quintana · Anna Gas i Serra · Jule Goikoetxea · Naila Gómez · Esther Gómez · Aída González Rossi · Iosune de Goñi García · Anna Gual · Teresa Gubern · Maria Isern · Lia Katselashvili · Isabel Logroño · Alicia Louzao · Andrea Maceiras · Irati Majuelo Itoiz · Laia Maldonado · Alejandra Marquerie · Sonia Marpez · Inés Martínez · Lola Mascarell · Lucía Morales · Lucía Mosquera Novoa · Ana Patricia Moya · Violeta Nicolás · Laura Pardo · Saray Pavón · Noelia Pazos Carro · Paula S. Piedad · Ona Salvat Febrero · Sonia San Román · Elisabet Sauló · Ana Vega · Ane Zubeldia · MÉXICO · Ingrid Bringas · Alicia Camposalas · Elisa Díaz Castelo · Esbeidi Lara · Mónica Licea · Nadia López García · Clyo Mendoza · Sidharta Ochoa · Ale Oseguera · Brianda Pineda Melgarejo · Karen Plata · PARAGUAY · Giselle Caputo · Norma Flores Allende · Jazmín Rodríguez · PERÚ · Gloria Alvitres Aliaga · Karen Luy de Aliaga · María Belén Milla · Elizabeth Peláez Sagástegui · Astrid Soldevilla · PORTUGAL · Mafalda Sofía Gomes · Denise Pereira · Mia Quadros · URUGUAY · Olivia Arocena · Virginia Finozzi · Lucía Mazzini · Regina Ramos · Guillermina Sartor · Romina Serrano · Adriana Stratta · VENEZUELA · Paola Assad · María Alejandra Colmenares · Oriette D'Angelo · Andrea Morena Garcia · Giuliana Marmo Petrocco · Camila Ríos Armas

Dedicamos un recuncho ás voces femeninas en galego con Andrea Maceiras, Lucía Mosquera Novoa e Noelia Pazos Carro, para que nestas páxinas podamos escoitar o son dos queixumes dos pinos.

Liburuak Euskal Herriko lau idazle gazteen testuak ere biltzen ditu: Leire Alonso Allué, Iosune de Goñi García, Irati Majuelo Itoiz eta Ane Zubeldia. Euskarari espazio bat eskaintzea beharrezkoa iruditu zaigu, gure ahotsek beste herrialdetako emakumeen hitzekin bat egin dezaten eta euskal literaturak proiektu berri honen barruan bere lekua izan dezan.

De la mateixa manera, el nostre llibre també inclou les veus en català de les autores Núria Armengol, Laia Carbonell, Anna Gas i Serra, Laia Maldonado i Ona Salvat Febrero.

El propósito de nuestra antología es sentar las bases para construir una editorial joven, independiente, feminista y renovadora capaz de plantearse como alternativa en el campo literario iberoamericano para dar voz a nuestras autoras (¡y a muchas otras y otros!) en castellano, galego, euskera, catalán y portugués.

Nuestro sueño apunta muy alto porque nuestras autoras lo merecen, y libro a libro, por todas ellas, lo podemos conseguir :)


Tu ayuda nos da vida (¡y a ti te da poesía!).
¡¡¡GRACIAS POR APOYAR Y DIFUNDIR!!! :)

_________________________________________________________________________


¿Te gustaría saber más sobre nosotras? Te contamos nuestra historia :)

Con apenas un año de vida, Liberoamérica nació el 30 de mayo de 2017 gracias a la iniciativa de dos compañeras de Argentina —Lucía Bima, Cecilia Resiale— y un compañero de las Islas Canarias —Darío Zalgade— que se hartaron de la discriminación de las nuevas voces en los medios culturales iberoamericanos y decidieron construir su propia revista digital. Aquel nuevo espacio pasó a llamarse Liberoamérica (.com) y comenzó a crecer de forma extraordinaria, incorporando a más de 100 colaboradorxs jóvenes cada mes y sobrepasando en cuestión de semanas a numerosos espacios emblemáticos de la literatura online de la última década en toda América Latina.

Durante los meses siguientes Liberoamérica establece un equipo editorial estable en todos y cada uno de sus países y regiones y comienza a organizar eventos poéticos y literarios gratuitos en Barcelona, Bogotá, Buenos Aires, Ciudad de México, Córdoba, Lima, Madrid, Managua, Monterrey, Montevideo, Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Santiago de Chile y São Paulo. Nuestra comunidad deja de ser virtual y pasamos a vernos las caras, escucharnos la voz y contagiarnos la risa. La sensación de estar tejiendo un proyecto colectivo cada vez mayor ya empieza a ser imparable.

Con la fuerza tremenda de esta ilusión, en noviembre de 2017 Liberoamérica decide que llega el momento de dar el salto al papel y propone la publicación de una antología feminista en toda América Latina, Portugal y España. Acudimos a diversas editoriales pero las propuestas que recibimos fueron un insulto, así que decidimos constituirnos nosotrxs mismxs en el espacio editorial que nos gustaría haber encontrado: un espacio abierto, joven, feminista, horizontal, valiente, plural, creativo, fuerte, independiente y libre. Desde esas premisas, abrimos una extensa convocatoria de poemas e iniciamos un proceso de votaciones internas para elegir cada detalle editorial, desde la portada hasta el precio de salida de los libros. De diciembre'17 a febrero'18 Liberoamérica es un hervidero de propuestas y poemas que desemboca en nuestro primer crowdfunding, el de Argentina y Uruguay, del que nace nuestra primera edición de Liberoamericanas: 80 poetas contemporáneas, recibida con enorme entusiasmo en ambos países en junio'18.

Llega entonces julio'18 y es el turno de España, Galicia, Euskal Herria y Catalunya, donde nos proponemos redoblar la apuesta: de 84 poetas a más de 120, de dos lenguas a cinco, y de seis editoras a doce, en una propuesta decidida por la pluralidad cultural, el respeto identitario, el amor por la poesía y las ganas enardecidas de cambiarlo todo.

Nuestro siguiente paso eres tú. ¿Nos tiendes la mano? :)
¡¡¡¡GRACIAS POR APOSTAR POR NOSOTRAS!!!!
(¡Y por compartir nuestra llamada al mundo!)

story_txt: Antología de 100+ Jóvenes Poetas Contemporáneas¡Hola! Somos Liberoamérica (.com), una plataforma literaria de más de 800 autoras y autores jóvenes constituida en torno a la literatura contemporánea, la cultura latinoamericana, el pensamiento transnacional, la integración y la pluralidad sociales y la igualdad étnica, cultural, de género, clase, credo, cuerpo y orientación sexual.Tenemos preparada nuestra primera antología poética de autoras jóvenes, con más de 100 poetas de toda América Latina, Portugal y España, llenas de ilusión por compartir su obra de forma internacional. Para ayudarlas, queremos dar a conocer sus versos en un libro que ya hemos publicado en Argentina y Uruguay y que comenzaríamos a distribuir en España a partir de noviembre si este crowdfunding tiene éxito.Nuestras autoras son:​ARGENTINA · Andrea Aguirre · Brenda Anaquel Anaya · Nía Cabellos · Mere Echagüe · Sol Fantín · Sol Iametti · Carla Olivera · Gaby Sambuccetti · Micaela Szyniak · Katya · Alicia Louzao · Andrea Maceiras · Irati Majuelo Itoiz · Laia Maldonado · Alejandra Marquerie · Sonia Marpez · Inés Martínez · Lola Mascarell · Lucía Morales · Lucía Mosquera Novoa · Ana Patricia Piedad · Ona Salvat Febrero · Sonia San Román · Elisabet Sauló · Ana Vega · Ane Zubeldia · MÉXICO · Ingrid Bringas · Alicia Camposalas · Elisa Díaz Castelo · Esbeidi Lara · Mónica Licea · Nadia López García · Clyo Mendoza · Sidharta Ochoa · Ale Oseguera · Brianda Pineda Melgarejo · Karen Plata · PARAGUAY · Giselle Caputo · Norma Flores Allende · Jazmín Rodríguez · PERÚ · Gloria Alvitres Aliaga · Karen Luy de Aliaga · María Belén Milla · Elizabeth Peláez Sagástegui · Astrid Soldevilla · PORTUGAL · Mafalda Sofía Gomes · Denise Pereira · Mia Quadros · URUGUAY · Olivia Arocena · Virginia Finozzi · Lucía Mazzini · Regina Ramos · Guillermina Sartor · Romina Serrano · Adriana Stratta · VENEZUELA · Paola Assad · María Alejandra Colmenares · Oriette D'Angelo · Andrea Morena Garcia · Giuliana Marmo Petrocco · Camila Ríos ArmasDedicamos un recuncho ás voces femeninas en galego con Andrea Maceiras, Lucía Mosquera Novoa e Noelia Pazos Carro, para que nestas páxinas podamos escoitar o son dos queixumes dos pinos.Liburuak Euskal Herriko lau idazle gazteen testuak ere biltzen ditu: Leire Alonso Allué, Iosune de Goñi García, Irati Majuelo Itoiz eta Ane Zubeldia. Euskarari espazio bat eskaintzea beharrezkoa iruditu zaigu, gure ahotsek beste herrialdetako emakumeen hitzekin bat egin dezaten eta euskal literaturak proiektu berri honen barruan bere lekua izan dezan.De la mateixa manera, el nostre llibre també inclou les veus en català de les autores Núria Armengol, Laia Carbonell, Anna Gas i Serra, Laia Maldonado i Ona Salvat Febrero.El propósito de nuestra antología es sentar las bases para construir una editorial joven, independiente, feminista y renovadora capaz de plantearse como alternativa en el campo literario iberoamericano para dar voz a nuestras autoras (¡y a muchas otras y otros!) en castellano, galego, euskera, catalán y portugués.Nuestro sueño apunta muy alto porque nuestras autoras lo merecen, y libro a libro, por todas ellas, lo podemos conseguir :)Tu ayuda nos da vida (¡y a ti te da poesía!).¡¡¡GRACIAS POR APOYAR Y DIFUNDIR!!! :)_________________________________________________________________________¿Te gustaría saber más sobre nosotras? Te contamos nuestra historia :)Con apenas un año de vida, Liberoamérica nació el 30 de mayo de 2017 gracias a la iniciativa de dos compañeras de Argentina —Lucía Bima, Cecilia Resiale— y un compañero de las Islas Canarias —Darío Zalgade— que se hartaron de la discriminación de las nuevas voces en los medios culturales iberoamericanos y decidieron construir su propia revista digital. Aquel nuevo espacio pasó a llamarse Liberoamérica (.com) y comenzó a crecer de forma extraordinaria, incorporando a más de 100 colaboradorxs jóvenes cada mes y sobrepasando en cuestión de semanas a numerosos espacios emblemáticos de la literatura online de la última década en toda América Latina.Durante los meses siguientes Liberoamérica establece un equipo editorial estable en todos y cada uno de sus países y regiones y comienza a organizar eventos poéticos y literarios gratuitos en Barcelona, Bogotá, Buenos Aires, Ciudad de México, Córdoba, Lima, Madrid, Managua, Monterrey, Montevideo, Santa Cruz de la Sierra, Santa Cruz de Tenerife, Santiago de Chile y São Paulo. Nuestra comunidad deja de ser virtual y pasamos a vernos las caras, escucharnos la voz y contagiarnos la risa. La sensación de estar tejiendo un proyecto colectivo cada vez mayor ya empieza a ser imparable.Con la fuerza tremenda de esta ilusión, en noviembre de 2017 Liberoamérica decide que llega el momento de dar el salto al papel y propone la publicación de una antología feminista en toda América Latina, Portugal y España. Acudimos a diversas editoriales pero las propuestas que recibimos fueron un insulto, así que decidimos constituirnos nosotrxs mismxs en el espacio editorial que nos gustaría haber encontrado: un espacio abierto, joven, feminista, horizontal, valiente, plural, creativo, fuerte, independiente y libre. Desde esas premisas, abrimos una extensa convocatoria de poemas e iniciamos un proceso de votaciones internas para elegir cada detalle editorial, desde la portada hasta el precio de salida de los libros. De diciembre'17 a febrero'18 Liberoamérica es un hervidero de propuestas y poemas que desemboca en nuestro primer crowdfunding, el de Argentina y Uruguay, del que nace nuestra primera edición de Liberoamericanas: 80 poetas contemporáneas, recibida con enorme entusiasmo en ambos países en junio'18.Llega entonces julio'18 y es el turno de España, Galicia, Euskal Herria y Catalunya, donde nos proponemos redoblar la apuesta: de 84 poetas a más de 120, de dos lenguas a cinco, y de seis editoras a doce, en una propuesta decidida por la pluralidad cultural, el respeto identitario, el amor por la poesía y las ganas enardecidas de cambiarlo todo.Nuestro siguiente paso eres tú. ¿Nos tiendes la mano? :)¡¡¡¡GRACIAS POR APOSTAR POR NOSOTRAS!!!!(¡Y por compartir nuestra llamada al mundo!)facebook.com/liberoamericamagtwitter.com/liberoamericainstagram.com/liberoamerica Notas en prensa:Diario de Navarra (España) - La Soga (España) - Galicia Diario (España) - Librújula (España) - La República (Perú) - Clarín (Argentina) - La Verdad (España) - Cubical Mag (España) - Euskalkultura (CAS) / Euskalkultura (EUS) (Euskal Herria) - La Diaria (Uruguay) - Red Uno (TV, Bolivia) - Málaga al Día (España) - El Correo (EUS) (Euskal Herria) - La i Crítica (España) - El Observador (Uruguay) - Radio Cut (Argentina) - Pat Noticias (Bolivia) - Odisea Cultural (España) -

story:
The Inspiration

"Our place is part of what we are.”  — Poet Gary Snyder

Our relationship with the place we live is one of our closest bonds. The physical landscape we experience every day holds layers of history, much of it passed down in myths and half-remembered lore. And yet, when that landscape is undergoing change, there’s often a sense of being uprooted while still being physically present. 

In such times, stories deepen our roots. The native Coast Miwok used legends and oral traditions to define their surroundings and themselves. It’s no different today. Communities that lose their collective memory of the past lose their sense of meaning and identity. 

In our new book On a River Winding Home, we've set out to "restory" the Petaluma River Watershed landscape by pairing contemporary photos with intimate tales of the past that have provided the watershed with such a powerful sense of place.

     City of Petaluma from the headwaters of Thompson Creek

Praise for On a River Winding Home

“This is a truly wonderful book, in the poetry of the writing, the meticulous research, the knowledgeable commentary, and the vivid photography." —Adair Lara, author of History of Petaluma: A California River Town

"A gem."—Gaye LeBaron, Santa Rosa Press Democrat

“Story-telling at its best." —Lyndi Brown, Sonoma County Gazette

"If you love Petaluma, you'll love this book."—John Crowley, Aqus Cafe

"This book is a must-read for anyone who lives in the North Bay.” —Chris Samson, Petaluma Argus-Courier  editor 1984-2012

“A treasure trove of intimate, colorful images and impeccably researched history — paired to both delight and inform." —Frances Rivetti, author of Fog Valley Crush

"A masterpiece."—Katherine Rinehart, Sonoma County History and Genealogy Library

"A classic." Chuck Lucas, Penngrove Proud

"It’s such a treat to turn the pages of this joyful read, like unwrapping a special gift."—Harlan Osborne, Santa Rosa Press Democrat

"Gorgeously crafted."—David Templeton, Petaluma Argus-Courier

“The book is drop dead gorgeous. . . it should grace every coffee table and bookshelf from Petaluma to Pittsburgh.” —Suzanne Farver, former executive director, Aspen Art Museum 

“A fine, handsome book, telling many of the best stories of old Petaluma.” —Lee Torliatt, The Sonoma Historian

"The stories and portraits of the fascinating people who came to live here and make the land their own are the best I have read . . . anywhere. Bravo!” —Skip Sommer, Petaluma Argus-Courier

The Authors

Scott Hess, a longtime Petaluma-based photographer, takes readers on a pictorial journey that reveals the beauty and spiritual grace of the watershed’s natural landscape, the bucolic nature of its working farms and ranches, and the historic charm of its river city, Petaluma.

John Sheehy, an award-winning historian and fourth-generation Petaluma native, seamlessly blends Scott’s photographs with short stories that celebrate the watershed’s colorful history, showcasing a lively cast of characters ranging from the native Coast Miwok, Mexican rancheros, and Gold Rush settlers, to the slow growth pioneers, winemakers, and farm-to-table pioneers of today.

Storyteller John Sheehy (left) and photographer Scott Hess (right).

The Book

"If you don't know where you are, you don't know who you are." —Wendell Berry

Our book seeks to bring alive the Petaluma River Watershed in all of its complexity, both past and present. It is designed for place-loving people, specifically those already rooted, becoming rooted, formerly rooted, or even re-rooted in the area.

By pairing contemporary images with stories of the past, we hope to increase awareness of the delicate balance the watershed must strike in protecting its unique natural, social, and historic-built environments, while at the same time evolving forward. Communities are built by nesters—those who settle, and in settling come to deeply know, love, and care for the place they have settled into. Our book seeks to foster and deepen that fundamental commitment.

      Mutual Relief Building, Kentucky Street and Western Avenue

Part rambling walking tour, part voyage to the past, he book is divided into three parts: the native Coast Miwoks, the working landscape of farms and ranches, and the river town. Particular locations have been selected with the aim of expressing the watershed’s unique beauty, both in the natural and the built landscapes, and the strong sense of place the watershed has provided for generations.


Holstein cows, Spring Hill Road

Beautifully designed by designer and artist Laurie Szujewska, On a River Winding Home is a book that you will want to display on your coffee table long after you’ve finished reading it, both to share with friends as well as to remind yourself of what a fascinating, dynamic place the Petaluma River Watershed is.

Volpi's Ristorante, Washington and Keller Streets

A limited edition of the book has been published in a  hardcover, coffee table format of 8 3/4 x 12 inches. Made up of 232 pages, 70,000 words, and 133 images, the book is printed on high quality, dull-coated art paper, and Smyth sewn with a litho-wrapped cover.

The scow schooner the Alma docked in the Turning Basin
