story:
Featuring stories by:

 

Stephen King, Neil Gaiman, Richard and Billy Chizmar, Brian James Freeman, F. Paul Wilson, Gene O’Neill, Lisa Morton, John R. Little, Chad Lutzke, Taylor Grant, John Boden, Andrew Lennon, Mark Allan Gunnells, Elizabeth Massie, Todd Keisling, Justin M. Woodward, Kenneth W. Cain, Jason Stokes, Kelli Owen, Paul Kane, Ray Garton, Hanson Oak, Mark Matthews, Matthew Brockmeyer, Tony Bertauski, John Palisano, Somer Canon, John Skipp, Kevin J. Kennedy & William F. Aicher.

 

Edited by John J. Questore and  Eugene Johnson

 

Why back this project?

 

Virginia Beach has long been a place that people associate with beaches, nightlife, and a retreat from the stressors of the world; where the sun can shine down on you, and your cares are washed away briefly by the ocean waves.

On May 31, 2019 those waves ceased with the tragic shooting deaths of 12 innocent people and 4 more injured during the attack; turning a place known for relaxation and family fun - Dark.

This book is to honor those who were injured and lost their lives in this tragedy. All proceeds will be donated to the Virginia Beach Tragedy Fund c/o United Way South Hampton Roads.

 

100% of the profits from sales over the next year will be delivered to the survivors and families left behind in the wake of this senseless event. The anthology will then be retired on Nov. 1, 2020.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

This project is near and dear to our hearts. This is why Gestalt Media has decided to publish this anthology as a purely charitable endeavor. The stories contained within have been graciously donated by some of the top talents in the industry and a handful of promising newcomers. The artwork, time and effort to edit, compile and format both the ebook and paperback versions has been donated by these wonderful people.

 

As such we are able to ensure the families receive as much of the proceeds as possible. 

 

Why Crowdfund?

 

It is our view that crowdfunding the pre-sale portion of this campaign allows us to circumvent the otherwise unavoidable cost of doing business in today's market place. By bringing this project directly to you (the people who care most) we can avoid fees and percentages that other platforms might charge for their service. This way we're freeing up more of the total sales to go where they belong, the families.  It also allows us the opportunity to offer several versions of the ebook and paperback for use as gifts or display pieces.

 

About the Perks

 

Through the generosity of two wonderful people, we are able to bring you three designs for the cover of this anthology, to suit your tastes. All three contain the same spine chilling tales from some of today's most talented authors.

 

Note: All editions are 6 x 9. 

 

River of Consciousness:

The trade paperback edition cover features a beautiful image by artist Ivan Bjorn. This is the main edition.

 

80s Throwback:

Inspired by the early novels of the 1980s storytellers, this edition is a special perk gifted to us again by the talented artist Ivan Bjorn specifically for this pre-order campaign. A very limited run will be printed and available for purchase.

 

2020 Con Exclusive:

Designed by talented author and artist, Greg Chapman. The contemplating man, watching over a sea turned dark is exclusive to the pre-order campaign and our selected con visits throughout 2020. Mr. Chapman has been gracious enough to donate this design to the campaign.

 

Why $25?

 

Publishing is a business and per contract, we are bound to this price point. However, we are able to offer free shipping to everyone (in the US) who orders through the IndieGoGo pre-order campaign.

 

Risks & Challenges

This edition launches Oct. 1.  All backers should be receiving their copies within a few weeks of the pre-order close date. This is because of financing (all IndieGoGo transactions are thoroughly vetted before they're released) and to give us time to order and ship each package. eBook orders will be delivered via email provided on your order the same day funds are released to us.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

As always there is no way we could make such a huge difference in the world without everyone who has stepped up to make this anthology happen and the people who have purchased their copies so that we can do whatever small bit of good we can in the face of such a tragedy. 

You can help support this cause by sharing this page with anyone you know that might want to help or who simply loves a great collection of stores by masters of the genre. By spreading the word about the anthology, its authors and our goals and as well by contacting the United Way of Hampton Roads and donating personally. Together we can make something positive from something that not long ago was unthinkable.

story:
VERTIGO FÖRLAG

Vertigo presenterar sedan 1992 texter på avgrundens rand för läsare som inte önskar vända bort ansiktet från vår tids katastrof. Med en högkvalitativ utgivning av gotiska skräckklassiker, esoterisk  och politisk litteratur, erotiska klassiker, ja allt som skapar yrsel och illamående, hänförelse och uppenbarelse, är vår plats i den svenska bokbranschen behövd.

Skydda vertigo.se

För förlagets överlevnad är det viktigt att ha en fungerande hemsida där du kan botanisera och köpa vår litteratur. Presentationer av författare, böcker och event är en viktig del i vår marknadsföring.

Efter ytterligare en attack måste vi nu betala dyra pengar för att sidan har behövt återställas och samtidigt säkerställa att vi kan stå något säkrare mot nymoralisters vansinniga angrepp och försök att sänka oss. Därför ber vi nu dig om hjälp att bistå med en slant så att vi har råd att hålla vertigo.se vid liv och på så sätt även säkra att förlaget fortsatt kan ge ut högkvalitativ litteratur för alla de som inte nöjer sig med endast det enkla här i livet.

Ditt bidrag

För att vi ska kunna locka fler bidragsgivare har vi skapat små perks, dvs paket som skickas hem till dig när kampanjen är klar. Om det är så att du önskar bidra men inte vill få någon av böckerna hemskickade, alternativt hämta dem direkt i butiken på Karlshamnsgatan i Malmö, då kan du skriva det i ett meddelande. 

Andra sätt att hjälpa Vertigo

Om du inte har möjlighet att skänka pengar här och nu, vilket vi har full förståelse för, så finns det andra sätt.

  • Köp våra böcker, eller låna dem på ditt bibliotek
  • Gå med i våra Stormtrupper, våra absolut finaste ambassadörer och lojala följare (http://www.vertigo.se/stormtrupperna/)

story:
Help me find my ancestors!

  • I have 2 weeks to raise £600. I have $350 for the project so far. $500 to go.
  • I have hit a brick wall with my research. I have traced my family to the Battle of Culloden. To discover what happened to them, I must enlist the help of a professional to search the catalogs in Scotland to find the answers.

Culloden and The Family Tree

It doesn’t begin with Culloden. History is seldom so neat and precise that a single event can be identified as the start or end of a thing. Rather, Culloden was a hinge, a point at which events changed direction, when the door to the past was closed and one to a very different future opened.

It was a rainy day, April 16, 1746, when the Jacobite army of Bonnie Prince Charlie faced the English army under the Duke of Cumberland, across the moor at Culloden. Among them were my relatives. I don’t know yet if they were direct ancestors, or outside the direct line. But they were my blood, family members standing in the cold, wet morning. Their fate would eventually spin among the threads of mine, centuries later.

The Impact - It only takes $1

  • If you contribute $1 to my cause, it will bring something special to the members of my family that don't have a lot of time left on this earth. Completing this research will also qualify me to accept a title I have been nominated for and desired for what feels like... a lifetime.

"History is a great destroyer - it destroys reputations, illusions, myths, and vanities; it reminds us that we are all mortal..." Dr. Bruce Durie, Author of Scottish Genealogy.

This is a project, not a charitable cause

This is not a charitable cause. It means a lot to my family, and your support is appreciated immensely.

Other Ways You Can Help

This is my first crowdfunding campaign. If you can't contribute, share the campaign!

story:
(Draft of the book cover)

 

Hi! I'm Jakub, a classical musician from Warsaw, Poland. Big fan of Bach, Mozart and John Williams. Because of the latter, I've been huge fan of Star Wars classical saga, since being... 8 :)

I grew up in the country behind the Iron Curtain – we could see there the Star Wars Original Trilogy in cinemas, but we couldn't buy the original Kenner action figures. What a loss for kids!

Luckily, we had good copyists in our country. They were making unlicensed toys all over the 1980s, and we – the kids – played with those copies.

Today, those bootleg copies are much sought after by modern collectors. I am one of them. Actually, I am the owner of one of three of the biggest and most complete collections of vintage Polish Star Wars figures in the world. About 1/4 of all existing figures (ca. 4800 are known today) went through my hands during last 11 years. That inspired me to write – in English – a book about them, to pay hommage to a phenomenon that could have been born only in this place, those times. Thanks to generous contribution of my fellow collectors, this book summarizes the today's knowledge about the topic. Now You can help this book to be released.

 

(Five examples of Polish Yoda figures from ca. 1986)

 

The action figures I describe in the book are not only the collector's trophies to me. This is my childhood memories enchanted in little rubber artefacts as well as the history of my home country. To release this book is to give those items, those memories, that history an immortal shape. I have no doubts, that not many publishers are interested in ordering such collector's guide, that's why I am releasing it privately, taking all the risk. I worked hard for last two years, making pictures, editing them, writing articles, measuring the figures, consulting the doubts, creating layout... Now the time has come for the stage of proofreading and upcoming printing, which will cost a lot.

 

Being a supporter of this campaign is being a contributor of the historical release, a book extremely rare and interesting not only for a focused specialists, but for any Star Wars fan or toy collector. This is not just a book. This is first ever book of this kind. Let's make it together!

(That's just me, keep scrolling.)

 

 

Two costs have to be paid on this stage of the project:

1. Proofreading (native American).

2. Printing (200 copies).

This, including campaign fees, will take as much as USD 3300. 

 

I am offering exciting perks for your support! Just look at them:

- your name could be mentioned in the Backer's Section of the book

- you can order a copy (or more) of the book in special price, shipped

- you can get a promotional t-shirt, full of happy Polish Yoda figures

- you can become an owner of a grail: original vintage Polish Star Wars figure

- but you can also get one of my albums, including nice Bach's music :)

 

Don't worry, if I don't get the entire sum I need, I will release the book anyway. I just need a tiny help. A feedback, that my hard work is important to some of you :)

 

 

The Impact

Far Far Away is an unique book, first printed guide to very attractive collectibles. Collectors, but not only them, will find it interesting. It concerns the subjects connected with the most influencing movie saga in the history. Any Star Wars fan will have a good time while reading this book!

 

 

(Example of the page layout.)

 

The book will be in B5 format (176 x 250 mm or 6.9 x 9.8 in), hard cover, counting 208 glossy pages, full of high resolution colour pictures (over 1000 of them), with detailed description of about 350 figures. 90% of them come from my archives, the rest is a kind contribution of my friends collectors, such as Jason Harrison-Edge, Daren Wilde, Andy Anderson, Trevor Wencl, Roger Ferm, Kim Zoll and many many others. Each described figure will be measured (height and weight) and graded (count and value).

(Book content.)

 

It will be printed soon after this campaign ends. I hope to see the book released on late December. That means you may order a copy as a late Christmas present! I will start shipping them in January. After you get a copy, you will get your own, virtual, complete set of Polish Star Wars figures, with many variants, standing right on your shelf :)

 

(Polish Logray says 'Thank you!'. He's unarticulated.)

story:
Our March Into Summer

We have so much planned for you. As we continue to roll out our monthly editions focusing on topics that matter to Queer People of Color, we want to give you a preview of what you'll help bring about.

Many new and established publications and digital media companies get by on demanding free labor, and even not paying their writers and editors. This is especially true for media in the people of color and LGBTQ markets. But EFNIKS pays, and we will always pay. 

JUNE: SPACES

In June, we're focusing on the concept of "safe spaces" for LGBTQ People of Color. We're asking where we find safe spaces, and whether spaces that are supposed to be safe for us really are what they claim to be. Are gay bars safe spaces? First responders? Churches? Pride marches? Mental health professionals? College campuses? Dating apps? If they are indeed "safe spaces", it begs the question: for whom? 

JULY: AUDIO

AUDIO has us looking at music, queer artists of color, and the sounds we go to when we're in a mood. Who are the LGBTQ artists of color we should know? What are the mainstream tracks that are the best of 2017 so far? What are monthly or weekly queer parties where we can hear the music we want to hear? Give us playlists, artists, the songs that mattered to you growing up and growing fine. 

AUGUST: FEMME

This month we'll be celebrating queer women, femme gay men, and the gender non-binary / non-comforming. We'll be looking to their voices, asking how they navigate the LGBTQ landscape, and how they deal with all things FEMME as People of Color. We also want to hear from cis and masc presenting men on how they confront toxic masculinity.

SEPTEMBER: TOUCH

In September, we want to give you all things "sex positive". We want to look at sexual health, sexual enjoyment, subcultures, consent, and what it means to "do it right". We want to talk to experts, the experienced among us, and see how we can share what we know and feel to give us all a path to better enjoyment of our bodies in common. 

EFNIKS Media

Launching at the start of summer, EFNIKS Media is the place where we support and promote podcasts, video, and short film, all made by LGBTQ People of Color. Some will be EFNIKS Originals. Some will be distributed by EFNIKS. Some will be featured and supported. All will help promote the mission of this space, that representation matters, that LGBTQ People of Color matter.

story:
Overview:

We propose that the concepts and means of evaluation of intelligence and creativity of persons with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) be reconsidered. Guided by the striking and exuberant canvases of Camila Falchi, the book reveals potentials of the ASD group that have been underestimated for decades. The book places autism into greater scientific, educational and treatment perspectives and presents possibilities for people on the spectrum of being more fully integrated into, and valued by our educational system and society.

How we will use funds from this campaign:

Our text is complete and we will use the funds to hire a professional copy editor to prepare the book for publication by an on-demand publishing house and to arrange marketing and distribution. We will publish both a hard copy edition and an e-book. 

What you get:

We of course will be grateful for donations of any amount! However, donors at particular levels will receive either an e-book, or a printed copy of the book, signed and personally inscribed by the authors, as described in the  Donor's Perks listing. We hope that you will find the objectives of this book, to provide a new view of autism, worthy of your support.

Why we have written this book:

In the United States, it is estimated that one out of every 68 children has an Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD), which represents a challenge for the families, the educational system and the whole society. We seek to promote inclusion of persons on the spectrum by rupturing stereotypes and stigmas. We give a basic and broad view of ASD, including new cognitive models for the neurobiology of autism. We highlight art therapy and music therapy as promising possibilities for complementing therapies based on behavior adaptation and modification. We propose that the concepts and means of evaluation of intelligence and creativity within the spectrum be revised, to reveal how these potentials of the autism group have been underestimated. We make an appeal for greater integration of persons on the spectrum into society.

Autism spectrum scientific literature.

Why we are qualified to write this book:

The authors, Dr. Elisabete Castelon Konkiewitz MD, Professor of Neurology and Psychiatry at the University of Greater Dourados, (UFGD), Brazil, and Dr. Edward Ziff PhD, Professor of Biochemistry, Molecular Pharmacology and Neural Science at NYU School of Medicine, have both written extensively for lay audiences about neurological diseases and have organized symposia and produced health-related videos for Dr. Castelon Konkiewtz’s YouTube channel.

Professor Elisabete Castelon Konkiewitz, MD

Dr. Castelon Konkiewitz's book with Angela Virgolim, “Altas Habilidades/Superdotação, Inteligência e Criatividade – Uma Visão Multidisciplinar” (High Abilities/Giftedness, Intelligence and Creativity - A Multidisciplinary Vision), was awarded the prestigious 2015 Jabuti Prize (Prêmio Jabuti) in the area of Education. 

Professor Edward Ziff, PhD

Dr. Ziff has co-authored with Dr. Israel Rosenfield, a highly popular book on the DNA revolution (DNA: A Graphic Guide to the Molecule that Shook the World; Columbia University Press) and articles about biology and the brain for the New York Review of Books

The artist, Camila Falchi:

Camila Falchi and her mother, Eliana Falchi 

Camila Falchi Parra Carvalho Silva is a young artist who is on the autism spectrum. She was born in 1991 and lives with her family in a town northwest of São Paulo, in Brazil.  Camila plays the piano and is fascinated by certain shapes, which appear repeatedly in her paintings, such as polka dots, squares, circles, and parallel and divergent lines. These preferences confirm both a will to experiment and the receptiveness to the unknown of an optimist with a curious spirit.  The book reproduces over 30 of her paintings, which are an exuberant expression of creativity by an ASD individual.

Squares (“Quadrados”) 40 cm x 60 cm – acrylic paint, 2015 

 

Imagination (“Imaginação”) 50 cm x 70 cm – acrylic paint, 2014

Audience:

The book  will appeal to parents, self-help groups, the autism, neurodiversity and medical communities, educators, social workers, art therapists, psychologists and neuroscientists, and can be adopted for graduate and professional courses.

Other ways to help:

If you support our cause but are unable to help financially, please spread the word about our Indiegogo campaign on social media and by using Indiegogo’s share tools. Thanks!

story:
Update: We've all the stretch goals! Announcing New Stretch Goals:

Transformation Park closes at the end of the day on May 31st, and thanks to your support, we've hit every single one of my original stretch goals. So here are some more!

$1000 - Super Size - I'll increase in length and detail whichever attraction has the most support!
$1100 - Boat Ride - The ferry to Transformation Island will be full of surprises. 
$1200 - Super Size II - I'll increase in length and detail whichever attraction has the second most support!
$1300 - Transformation Fireworks A finale at closing time. Witness the post-transformation reactions to the display!
$1400 - Super Size III - I'll increase in length and detail whichever attraction has the third most support!

Synopsis and Campaign Info

Transformation Park is a crowdfunded transformation-themed ebook. The guests of Transformation Park have no idea that they'll be transformed by the magic of the rides, attractions, and concession stands - and you can decide which ones they visit, as well as request your own!

Outline

Different zones of Transformation Park will have different types of attractions, complete with all kinds of transformations. When you support Transformation Park at the Attendee level or higher, you get a custom character, who then enjoys whichever zone (or specific attraction) you'd like! The more people sponsor specific zones, the longer and more detailed those zones will be. 

Transformation genres can include weight gain, gender change, age regression or progression, muscle growth or loss, demi-human (vampire, werewolf, mermaid, ogre, succubus, ect.) cultural changes, personality changes, and much, much more!

If you'd like to have an entirely custom idea, you can do that too through the Gold Pass or Platinum Pass! I can then add it to the park guide, giving others the chance to support your area of the park. See Pledge Info and Zones below for more information.

Pledge Info

If you pledge at the Attendee level, T.F. Wright - the author of the My Transformations website and many bestselling transformation themed ebooks - will include your character in the park, experiencing an attraction of your choice. The specifics of the plot will be a surprise!

If you pledge at the Gold Pass level or higher, you'll get a custom short story about your own attraction in Transformation Park! You can choose multiple characters, the plot, and the transformation. Each new attraction will be part of an existing zone.

If you pledge at the Platinum Pass level or higher, you'll get your own entire zone, with as many characters and attractions as you'd like! 

Attractions which receive more support will get a longer and more detailed section of the story. I'll post regular updates as to what's garnering support, and include custom zones and attractions so that they can get extra support too! I'll also announce stretch goals which will involve even more transformation themed fun. With that in mind, here are the areas of the park...

The Zones of Transformation Park

There are currently five zones of the park: Fairy Tale Land, Future Land, Transformation Island, Circus Tent, and Food Trucks. Each of these attractions won't exist until someone sponsors them, so if you love a concept, become an attendee.

Fairy Tale Land

In fairy tale land, every ride tells the story of a classic fairy tale. But those who hop on board the ride find themselves sucked into the fairy tale itself, forced to live out a transformation-themed version of the story. Fairy Tale Land could feature...

The Little Mermaid: Mermaid transformation with a gender-bender twist...
Hansel and Gretel: Weight gain and witches, what's not to love?
Snow White: Age progression spells will abound...
Cinderella: How about a reverse makeover instead? Social class downgrade, plus weight gain.

Future Land

Come see the future - today! All attractions are science fiction themed. Future Land could feature...

Time Machine Experience: An interactive video presentation on time travel could have some age progression or age regression related consequences...
Digital Disco: A giant dance hall where music causes mass transformations. Want to turn everyone into Punks? Nerds? Bimbos? Change their sexuality or gender? You pick the music, you choose the change.
Alien Roller Coaster: Encounter extra-terrestrials when you blast off to space. What kind of aliens, and what they want to do with humans, is entirely up to you.

Transformation Island

A new addition to Transformation Park, Transformation Island is an off-coast retreat with darker, scarier themes. Transformation Island could feature...

Monstrous Grotto: What's in those caves behind the waterfall? It's the perfect setting for a dark, monstrous-type transformation. Pick the type of monster you'd like (and any other transformation you'd like them to have) and I'll do the rest.
Haunted House: Have a thing for weight-stealing vampires? Zombie bimbos? Age progression ghosts? Whatever it is, let me know, and they'll feature in the house of scares.

Circus Tent

Traditional amusement park attractions with a transformation twist. The Circus Tent could feature...

Funhouse Mirror: Reflections can be deceiving. The mirror causes people's appearance and personality to drastically distort in any way you'd like.
Kissing Booth: What if a simple kiss could change everything about you? Pick the change, and you'll get a kiss - and maybe a little more...
Test your Strength: A classic carnival game that involves a hammer. Perfect for muscle growth or muscle transfer.

Food Trucks

Serving all sorts of food that causes all kinds of changes. The focus on Food Trucks is erotic descriptions of eating. Weight gain is certainly a strong possibility here, but any other transformation you'd like is also on the menu.

Pledge FAQ:

Q: I'm confused - should I pledge at the Attendee, Gold Pass, or Platinum Pass?

Attendee: Best if you'd like to support an existing attraction from the list above. 
Gold Pass: Best if you'd like to create a new idea that fits well into an existing land - like a Beauty and the Beast themed Fairy Tale attraction, or transformation-themed fortune teller in the Circus Tent.
Platinum Pass: Best if you want your own zone, and an entire chapter in the story dedicated to  your ideas, with however many attractions and characters as you'd like. An example would be requesting a Super Hero Stadium, where park patrons become transformation-themed heroes or villains. 
Q: How long a story will I get?

Attendee: the length of the story will depend on how much support each zone gets. The more support, the longer the story. 
Gold Pass: Your story will start out at around 2,000 words, but may be significantly longer if another backer decides to support it.
Platinum Pass: You'll have an entire chapter dedicated to your custom zone. Minimum 5,000 words, but may be significantly longer if another backer decides to support it.
The goal for Transformation Park is to have existing stories get longer with additional support - in other words, quality over quantity. 

Q: If I pledge at the Attendee level, can I say what happens to my character?
A: You can decide what kind of character you'd like, one attraction you'd like them to visit, and a transformation that fits with that attraction. The exact plot is a surprise.

Q: If I pledge at the Attendee level, do I have a totally unique character?
A: Yes, if that's important to you. Please specify if you'd like anything specific about your character.

Q: If I pledge at the Gold Pass level, can I have a custom story written about an existing attraction? 
A: Yes. You don't need to create a new attraction if you don't want to.

Q: If I pledge at the Gold Pass or Platinum Pass level, can I request that my section of the park be private?
A: If you'd prefer not to have the area of the park be listed to help garner more support, then yes, you can request that it be private.

Q: If I pledge at the Gold Pass level, can I have my single story happen in new zone I just came up with?
A: Please suggest an attraction which fits the theme of an existing zone, or get the Platinum Pass for your own zone.

Q: Can I request my custom character be a real life celebrity, or involve a copyrighted character?
A: No, since Transformation Park will be published, fan fiction is not possible. We can do fictional characters which are different but inspired by real life.

Interview with T.F. Wright

Tell us a little more about yourself.

I first started writing stories online when I was 16 years old. A natural introvert, I felt it was difficult to find people who understood me. When I posted my first story, I suddenly felt like I had a way to connect with people that was punishingly elusive elsewhere. The passion of writing is a force that gives my life meaning, and I've never looked back.

Why did you write the book?

I've written two other crowdfunded stories: The Transformation Mall and Transformation TV.  Both of these projects were huge successes, and I'd highly suggest checking them out if you'd like to see what this kind of project will look like.

What was your inspiration for the book?

I took a trip to an amusement park recently and I enjoyed the way each area had a different theme. I thought that might be a way to have many different kinds of stories fit into one collection.

What do you plan to do with the funds you raise?

When I first started writing over ten years ago, writing was just a hobby and I wrote very sporadically. Thanks to my fans, I've been able to make writing my full-time job. Since writing is my only source of income, the money will go to support my living expenses so I have time to give the story the attention it deserves.

What if you don't hit the goal?

I'll still release a few few short stories based on this theme. The more funding, the more ideas I can put into the story, and the better it will be. 

What can I do to raise awareness about the campaign?

If you'd like to help, please post about this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Deviant Art, Reddit, or make a post about it on your web forum of choice.

What if I have a question about this campaign?

If you have a question about the rewards for this campaign, or you'd like to commission a custom story outside of Transformation Park, feel free to contact me.

story:
¿Qué?

El vaso para chocolate es una trepidante novela de aventuras en la que cada avance hacia la resolución genera un nuevo dilema que debe ser resuelto...

Poco podía imaginar Eric Morel que su apacible estancia en el sur de Francia desembocaría en un arriesgado viaje por el mundo y la historia en pos de una antigua cerámica maya. Una peligrosa aventura plagada de intrigas en la que lo acompañará́ Ariadna Battaglia, una joven experta en arte maya. En ella se inmiscuirán en una peligrosa trama de tráfico de piezas arqueológicas. Así, se verán abocados a viajar hasta París, para obtener información de personajes de dudosas intenciones. Esto los llevará hasta las ruinas mayas de las remotas selvas del Petén guatemalteco, en un arriesgado periplo que incluso supondrá́ su descenso a Xibalbá, el Inframundo maya.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Ricardo Torres Marzo.

Nacido en Utiel en 1.980, soy Doctor Internacional en Historia del Arte por la Universidad de Valencia, con especialidad en la cultura maya. He enfocado mi carrera en la arqueología, habiendo participado en cerca de un centenar de intervenciones arqueológicas en España, Guatemala y México. Actualmente, además de trabajar como arqueólogo, soy profesor en el Posgrado de Estudios Mesoamericanos de la UNAM, México. Aunque esta obra supone mi primer acercamiento a la ficción, soy autor de diversos artículos científicos sobre arqueología y patrimonio maya. Asimismo, he impartido numerosas ponencias relativas a estos temas en España, Guatemala, México, Francia y Alemania.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 840€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de El vaso para chocolate que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Ricardo Torres Marzo vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Short Summary

Nushu Voices LLC was formed on 3/29/17 to curate, edit, and publish women's secret stories anonymously but the concept and plan to share great stories began years ago. I seek seed funding to launch the business and set up a fully functioning site to make it a reality. Many events and experiences inspired the launch of Nushu Voices. A Terry Tempest Williams book first introduced me to Nushu, or ‘woman’s writings’, a secret script developed by illiterate Chinese women. I attended Yoni Ki Baat, and listened to women's stories that used the healing power of humor to temper pain. I lost my Grandma and wondered about her untold stories. I wrote and struggled to express my own hard truths, and joined the historic Women’s March with my teenage daughter. I continued to reflect upon the power of women’s voices.

I thought about the challenges that women face in communicating our stories. We often edit ourselves or silence our voices when we imagine an audience.

I want to help tell the good stuff: the stories that are lost, the stories we only tell our best friends, the stories that make us laugh and cry. 

What We Need & What You Get

The majority of the funding that is raised will go towards producing a professional website where stories can be securely submitted and shared, in both written and podcast form.

Once the site is up and running, ongoing funding will be sought through advertising and subscriptions. 

Site Needs:

  • Identity/Branding/Copywriting $2,000
  • Web Experience $4,000
  • Membership Subscription System & Special Member Features $4,000
  • Marketing/Outreach $2,000
  • Podcast Infrastructure/Operations $1,500
  • Hardcover publishing $1,500

The Impact. Consider:

  • Why are women important?
  • Why are stories important?
  • Why are women's voices important?

Too often, the truth of women's lives is edited. We fear truth's repercussions.  We pause and consider:  How will our daughters and our mothers react? Past the whispered private exchanges, stories die.

Nushu Voices works to bypass those boundaries.

"Beside a well, one won't thirst; beside a sister, one won't despair." 

—Chinese Proverb

Risks & Challenges

There is risk, yes. The initial scope of the project would naturally vary based on how well fundraising goes. A lot of prep work is already done, stories are being gathered and prepared, and the idea has been met with enthusiasm. There is great potential here.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help now, please consider helping in other ways: 

  • Tell others about the Nushu Voices campaign!
  • Don't forget: You can use Indiegogo's share tools!

Thank you for your support!

story:
¿Qué?

Única es una trepidante novela de acción paranormal que aporta un soplo de aire fresco al género new adult.

La vida corriente de Irina se rompió cundo un sueño la envolvió en un nuevo mundo repleto de magia, seres fantásticos y peligros a los que jamás hubiera pensado tener que enfrentarse.

Solo ella, junto a sus compañeros: Derek, un poderoso hechicero; Anais, una mestiza misteriosa; Elda, una preciosa aprendiz; y Saúl, un vengativo licántropo. Podrán evitar que el oscuro pasado de la organización llamada Guardianes de la Brecha marque el futuro con los errores de otro tiempo.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy os presentamos a Olga Gort.

Nacida en el otoño del año 1995 en un pequeño pueblo del oeste de Cataluña, su interés por la escritura y el mundo editorial la llevó a estudiar preimpresión en artes gráficas y diseño y edición de publicaciones impresas y multimedia, para luego seguir especializándose en el mundo de la literatura con el grado de estudios literarios en la universidad de Barcelona.

Escribió el primer borrador de la novela Única en el año 2014 y lo corrigió varias veces, modificando su título hasta dar lugar a la obra publicada.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Saúl no se molestó en aparcar bien; se quitó el casco y lo colgó descuidadamente en el manillar. Estaba delante del bloque de pisos donde vivía Irina, pero no parecía haber nada fuera de lo común. Fue hasta la entrada a paso ligero y la encontró abierta, de modo que empezó a subir escaleras. Todas las puertas que llevaban a los pasillos estaban cerradas a excepción de la del tercer piso. Cuando entró, vio al chico de esa mañana frente a una de las puertas; tenía el pelo y la ropa sucios de sangre seca y le observaba con una sonrisa.
          ―Saúl, ¿verdad? Dargo y esa chica te están esperando, entra, por favor.
          ―¿Y si antes de entrar te matara?
          Marco sonrió y, dirigiéndole una mirada divertida, le respondió:
          ―Dargo no tendrá suficiente paciencia.
          Sin darse cuenta, Saúl soltó un gruñido amenazador y entró en el piso. Dargo estaba en un salón, junto a Irina, quien, con los ojos vendados y las manos atadas, aguardaba, completamente paralizada, al borde de la terraza a la que habían arrancado la barandilla. Al verlo llegar, Dargo le dedicó un saludo.
          ―¿Vienes para convertirte en su héroe o por mí? 
          Saúl miró a Irina, estaba temblando por el miedo, deseando que todo terminara de un modo u otro. Sin embargo, hasta el momento de llegar frente al edificio y sentir su aroma, ni siquiera había sabido que era su casa, no, él no era el héroe del cuento.
          ―Vengo a por ti.
          La sonrisa de Dargo se hizo más ancha y abrió la terraza.
          ―Me siento halagado.
          Dargo se acarició la cicatriz. Saúl volvió a gruñir, esta vez más fuerte.
          ―Te mataré.
          Dargo rio alegremente y señaló a Irina.
          ―Hagamos un trato. Si la dejas caer a ella, te daré la oportunidad de hacerlo. Sin embargo, estamos en un tercer piso. ¿Crees que sobrevivirá?
          Saúl dio un paso hacia Dargo, diciéndose a sí mismo que antes de que pudiera tocarla ya lo habría matado.
          ―No me importa.
          Cuando terminó la frase, Dargo empujó a Irina bruscamente, haciéndola caer al vacío. Antes de que pudiera pararse medio segundo a pensarlo, Saúl saltó tras ella. Irina no era un licántropo; no era un monstruo. Si se golpeaba desde esa altura, moriría. La envolvió con su cuerpo para protegerla y, cuando llegó al suelo, ahogó un grito de dolor. Sintió como su brazo derecho se rompía con un crujido escalofriante. Le costó más de lo que había previsto reunir las fuerzas necesarias para incorporarse pero, tras un breve instante de vacilación, consiguió hacerlo y además quitarle la venda que cubría sus ojos. El verlo pareció tranquilizarla; tenía los ojos llenos de lágrimas»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Única que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona a la autora, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Olga Gort vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

¿Qué?
Única es una trepidante novela de acción paranormal que aporta un soplo de aire fresco al género new adult.
La vida corriente de Irina se rompió cundo un sueño la envolvió en un nuevo mundo repleto de magia, seres fantásticos y peligros a los que jamás hubiera pensado tener que enfrentarse.
Solo ella, junto a sus compañeros: Derek, un poderoso hechicero; Anais, una mestiza misteriosa; Elda, una preciosa aprendiz; y Saúl, un vengativo licántropo. Podrán evitar que el oscuro pasado de la organización llamada Guardianes de la Brecha marque el futuro con los errores de otro tiempo.
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
